review.title: Nice area.  Old building
review.reviewText: Our room had a water leak in the bathroom.  I reported leak and requested extra towels to avoid a slip hazard in the bathroom. The front desk did not send a service person to attempt to repair the problem.  The towels never arrivedwhen we checked out I again reported the water problem.  Based on the smell in the leak has been going on a long time.

review.title: Never going there again
review.reviewText: It wasn't a good place and all the rooms for shanty I didn't like the smell the hallways were narrow tiny elevators it was a lie the pictures are all a lie

review.title: Would not stay here again
review.reviewText:
Would not stay here again

There are many homeless people outside of hotel screaming at all hours of the night, while I know that the hotel cannot control this...it is an unpleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing windows  and updating the furniture and the elevator

review.title: Nice hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located, clean and the staff is very helpful and kind.

review.title: Too far to spend so much
review.reviewText:
One person at desk, double booking rooms
Additional $47 parking fee
Apartments across the way look directly into your room
Noisy elevator
Desk person arguing with other guests

review.title: False advertisement
review.reviewText: “This hotel is not as advertised ..had a bad birthday trip for my girlfriend room was next to loud elevator and laundry chute kept us awake all night we were given a full size bed not queen with stained bedspread .. Homeless sleeping all around curb sides ”

review.title: Convenient to city attractions
review.reviewText: The pictures in the Expedia ad looked better than the actual hotel. Quality of the hotel is very poor. The only thing I appreciated was that the location made it very accessible to San Francisco's public transportation system, which helped a great deal for getting around the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs a completer overhaul.
review.locationRemarks: Enjoyed being in San Francisco, going walking around the city, visiting museums, dining out, and taking a boat tour.

review.reviewText: Dated, rub backed up with bad dirty water and partivles looked like throw up! Could not fix, left like that overnight. Couldnt shower. the bath sink counter was old lifted wood rotted, the floors squeek like your gon a fall through the floors, ceiling fan "to loud for upstairs neighbor guest reception called me to turn it off! Never again!

review.title: great place to overdose!
review.reviewText: Very old and run down. bed was ok. more of a youth hostile than a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: the ceiling fan was unusable
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do its san francisco!

review.title: There Are Better Choices
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on location and price, perhaps I should have spent more.  The sidewalk across from the hotel is lined with homeless all hours of the day.  There are fewer in the day when they go off to "work."  The parking was $48 per day, but this isn't out of line with other downtown hotels in larger cities.  It takes about 20 minutes to get your car after requesting that the car be brought around.  During the late night and early morning hours the parking agreement says it can take up to two hours for them to bring your car around.  The elevator is very small, old, and somewhat scary.  Some of the reviews say their rooms look recently renovated.  I guess I got one on the waiting list for renovations.  Everything seemed old and worn, for example, the door hinges in the bathroom were terribly rusted.  The condition of my room was very different from those shown in the photos for this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: There isn't much that couldn't be improved based on the room I was given.

review.title: Old and Smelly
review.reviewText: My room smelled of pee as soon as I walked in. This smell never went away.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire hotel needs a brand new makeover.

review.title: Noises
review.reviewText: The motel was in the financial district to far from where we needed to be for  our meetings,, cost a lot of money in taxi fees,, very noisey, neighborhood dirty.
review.negativeRemarks: Updated
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do close by everything was far away

review.title: Horrible location
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to one of the hundreds of homeless people around the hotel. It's not safe to walk in the streets near the hotel, it's not safe even to leave your things in the room. I pre paid three nights without knowing this and after the first night (we get to SF at night) we went to another hotel. Guys from Expedia you shouldn't advertise this hotel

review.title: not a good hotel to stay in
review.reviewText: this hotel looks good in the photos only ,but when you arrive there its a totally wrong .
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: i find out after a few days from my local co workers that i was in a hotel that located in the worst area of downtown SF

review.title: Convenient location but not recommended for family
review.reviewText: The Monarch hotel was located by a community center, so it was no surprise that there were strange figures on the streets outside of the hotel. The location itself was in the middle of the city, close to Union Square, which made up for the sketchy surrounding neighborhood. The hotel itself is fine. The rooms are comfortable and cozy, but very outdated. The elevator of the hotel is best described as vintage.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms had all the basic necessities.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and maintenance of the hotel facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Small but close to everything
review.reviewText: Small hotel, but for the price it's not bad. Room was clean & the neighborhood is filled with places to see & go

review.title: Nice old hotel close to market street
review.reviewText:
We stayed there for 3 nights.
Bad: The elevator is really old, and there will be homeless people sleeping right across the hotel at night.
Good: It's right in the middle of Downtown and close to Market Street. Hotel staff are nice. They can hold your luggage for you after you check out and even book the shuttle to the airport for the fair price.
review.positiveRemarks:
The bed is comfortable.
Close to malls in a walkable distance.

review.title: New sleeping area, old bathroom, forget the wi-fi
review.reviewText:
The room appeared to be rather recently renovated: the carpet and drapes were clean and attractive. The room was pleasant. The bathroom, however, was in need of repair. The door squeaked horribly (and they couldn't come up with a can of WD-40 on a Saturday), the countertop was separated, the toilet was quite low. That said, the bathroom seemed clean.

The "free wi-fi"  was really bad for someone who checks email regularly and uses the web to find information. I could see -- occasionally -- that I had messages, but I could rarely get the files open to read them. And the couple of times I got that far, I couldn't send the answer. Sometimes my tablet couldn't find the server. The front desk folks said it was due to the hotel's being full.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly, coffee and tea were always available in the lobby, the room was attractively furnished.
review.negativeRemarks: A more powerful wi-fi system needs to be installed. The bathroom -- at least in our room -- needs to be renovated.
review.locationRemarks: There are a few restaurants in the area. It's very convenient for some buses to Fisherman's Wharf. It's walking distance to Union Square.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: First room, shower didn't work right and drain was clogged. Bathroom was dated and the room smelled bad. Moved to a different room, staff was nice but room didn't improve much except the drain in tub was not clogged. Would not stay there again or recommend to anyone.

review.title: Was ok, worth the money!
review.reviewText: They lack in amenities, and staff are not easy to work with...but we where compfortable!

review.title: Looks nice in pictures. Last minute booking
review.reviewText: I had a nice time in SF for the 3 days of my vacation

review.title: Misleading website
review.reviewText: The hotel was nothing like what was shown on their website.  It is very old, dirty and smelly.  We were scheduled to stay there 3 nights but left after one because it was so bad.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the room & bathroom.  Update the room & fix the bathroom door so it closes.

review.title: Decent hotel in heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok. It was clean but the bed was broken so we were sleeping very uncomfortable. The elevator is very old and makes a terrible rumbling sound and shakes when it stops at the floors. That would have been good to know before we got in it and thought we were going to die. The Valet service is expensive and your vehicle is taken off site. You have to call 30 minutes ahead before you want it even if you are just accessing it to retrieve something. There is a body shop next door that it appears charges less money but seems maybe a little sketchy to leave your car outside unattended in the neighborhood. There was/is construction going on across the street so it was very loud even on the weekend so check into that before you go. The picture showed a fridge but there was not one in the room when we got it.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good. 15 minute walk to union Station and lots of food nearby.

review.title: Marathon stay
review.reviewText:
Lot's of homeless outside. Valet parking only
At $50.  Centralized location if you don't mind walking Or buses and cabs. Its not for the foo foo. This place is for the economical that don't need all the gadgets and somewhere to sleep.

review.title: SF Adventure
review.reviewText: The Monarch Hotel was a perfect place to stay for me. Central location and price was right. It was clean and served me well for my San Francisco adventure. I hit City Lights Books and the Cannery, all walking. Used Uber for longer distances. The staff were polite and friendly, and helped me save money on my trip. It's not a grand hotel, however, I had a spacious room, king size bed and private bath. Clean, clean, clean. Recommended.

review.title: Good, clean, cheap
review.reviewText: Many other reviews said the neighborhood was dangerous and messy, but I didn't find it too bad. Rooms were a little old and small but clean. Great deal for the price.

review.title: Bad Area
review.reviewText: Hotel needs a lot of upgrades. Room smelled musty. This is a no frills hotel but pricy for what you get.  Extremely bad area, a lot of homeless and would not recommend walking around at night. Website makes it look ok but buyer beware.  Only there 2 nights but could not wait to leave. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone

review.title: Nice view but bad sorroundings
review.reviewText: The location of these hotel is perfect we can walk to museums market Street is nearby there's a lot of shopping nearby Gym nearby dining. The only thing bad around this is the surrounding there's a lot of homeless and a mechanic next to the building but it's quiet because of the soundproof all the windows

review.title: Nice hotel and very helpful staff!
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The room was nice and clean.   I would stay there again.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: not what advertised, very old and dirty. terrible location in downtown
Great Staff. Walking distance to few places. Horrible social conditions with the homeless people right outside of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The accommodating staff. Knowledgeable of the area.
review.negativeRemarks: It is an old hotel. The elevator should be improved.
review.locationRemarks:
Few places to eat good food.
However, too many homeless people in the area.

review.title: Run down and outdated.
review.reviewText: Notice at front desk of potentially cancer-causing materials in the building.

review.title: Terribly noisy old room.
review.reviewText: Aside from the relatively convenient location, everything else was a deal breaker. no self parking available and valet parking is over priced.  Room condition was poor. Dirty curtains and bathroom. Squeaky floors and very noisy at night.

review.title: clean and great location
review.reviewText: accommodating and awesome staff who bend over backwards to please

review.title: $50 for Valet parking!!!!
review.reviewText: Bathtub are broken.  There is no free parking, you have to paid $50 for valet parking at the hotel.  Room doesnt look like it was in the picture.  Very disappointed!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of the Room!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Location was OK

review.title: Hotel ratings do not represent the actual status
review.reviewText: This hotel is in front of a homeless shelter, we found reaches and covers were not washed properly, towels had hairs.  Our experience was not pleasant if reviews could tell people the reality, we would it never stay here.

review.title: Hotel View
review.reviewText: Room was not like shown on Web site. Homeless people camp out across the street. Parking was expensive.

review.title: Friendly staff located near bus pick up.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located about a 30 minute walk from the Warf and 15 minute walk to Union Station. It is right around the corner from the bus stop. This is an old building, so do not expect the modern luxuries of an updated/newer hotel. The rooms are basic but clean. The smell of deodorizer can be overwhelming. The view from our room was looking at a concrete wall of an apartment building next door.  The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant which made our experience better than it could have been.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was the best part of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great if they used fabric softener for their towels - they felt like sand paper.
review.locationRemarks: The Warf was 30 min walk away and Union Station was about 15 minutes.

review.reviewText: No fascilities for the price , but stay was comfortable

review.title: Love the staff
review.reviewText: The staff were fantastic the place could use some up grades.. If it was not foe the staff I would probably not go back but because of them I would..

review.title: Very Bad Experience
review.reviewText:
When we arrived at the hotel approximately at 11:20 pm, the first impression that still comes to my mind is the street full of homeless people.  A lot of guys with guys on the street like if it was midday, talking, smoking and looking at you.  When I went inside the Monarch hotel it was the worst experience in my life of traveling, the hotel was ugly with two receptionist who attended me really bad, rude and very unhappy because I told them I was totally afraid of my life and my husband safety.  I asked them about not wanting to be there and actually I was threaten that I had no choice because I had already paid and had to stay there. I told both of them who where already arguing with me that I was going to call Expedia and let them know about my choice, the one of them told me that for that first night I had no choice that I had to pay for a Valet Parking to  park the car or leave, because I was going to be towed away. I was very upset and stayed there with the door inside the room lacked and two chairs behind the door for security.
The next day I had to relived the same situation with another receptionist ( by the way all of them were vietnamese or chinese for sure oriental) and had to pay $ 46.47 for the parking and told the receptionst told me that I was not going to get my refund at all, that I had to stay there for the other night or I will be losing my money.  He was going to charge me for the parking twice because it was $46.47 per night.  I told him he was wrong.
review.negativeRemarks: none, please get another hotel.  this Monarch hotel is like 70 years old and is not upgraded at all.
review.locationRemarks: none

review.reviewText: They do not have parking lot so we had to pay $48 plus tax per day for parking. Rooms are too small.
review.negativeRemarks: They should have parking.
review.locationRemarks: Dirty and noisy location

review.title: Convient location ruff around edges neighborhood
review.reviewText:
Was in for few days for Red Sox series .I have stayed at this hotel  couple times before.For the price of SF hotel it what you pay for nothing fancy but if you want place just to rest your head it is OK.Neighborhood is rough round edges w homeless folks but did not feel threaten.plenty of restuants
About 10-15 min walk to Union Sq about same  near BART MUNI stations

review.title: bed bugs at the hotel!
review.reviewText: horrible! we left after the first night!  we were supposed to stay 4 nights!

review.title: Very simple
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to the center but in a dangerous neighborhood, lots of homeless at the hotel entrance. Try not to walk at night, you may have problems. The hotel is simple and old, no breakfast or facilities. The room is small but ok.

review.title: I had low expectations - even those were too high
review.reviewText:
I wanted to like this hotel. I checked in late in the evening and only stayed one night. The man who checked me in was nice and the lobby was clean, though dated. The room (a standard queen) smelled like old smoke and there was a strange banging noise (elevator?) all night long. The room was on the second floor and outside the one window were pipes mostly obstructing my view, old q-tips, and, best of all, used syringes. The bathtub was clogged and gross. I didn't feel comfortable in the room at all and I don't understand how anyone could give this hotel over 1 star. 

It's in the Tenderloin and I'm not usually squeamish about less than ideal locations, but on top of the homeless camp across the street, there is very noisy construction that (as if May 2016) looks like it is just beginning.

review.title: Worth $100 a night max
review.reviewText:
Had to pay $300 to stay here. Not worth it at all. $100 would have been more appropriate. No hair dryer, curtains wouldn't close all the way, door lock got stuck.  Kind of felt like a strange part of town. 

Only good thing was check-in which was very quick.

review.title: For the price, it was okay, a little far from BART
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay, elevator a bit scary, was not clear if it would stop working midway.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator could be fixed up.
review.locationRemarks: a bit far from BART, but walkable.

review.title: Good Location, Good staff, Needs major renovation
review.reviewText:
When I arrived we were given an uncleaned room.  The desk staff promptly allowed us to switch and made a consideration to refund the 2nd night through expedia.  

The rooms are decent sized. For some reason the bathroom was the same size as the walk in closet adjacent to it.  Makes no sense since the bathroom is small, with a loosely fitting faucet, battered toilet seat, gross tiling, etc. The rooms themselves had a stringent cleaner odor as if it was harshly bleached and everything was horribly dried out as a result. The beds were noisy and not firm. 

Street parking is possible if you're bringing a car, esp with mobile apps to renew the meter in SF, avoid the $45/day valet fee.
Stay was satisfactory... a touch belowStay was satisfactory... a touch belowStay was satisfactory... a touch belowStay was satisfactory... a touch belowStay was satisfactory... a touch below

review.title: Dirty hotel in bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel hardly has an operable elevator (it fits maybe one or two people and you are crammed with luggage). It is also extremely slow so found myself walking up and down a narrow staircase four flights. My room was dusty and seemed very dirty. I saw makeup on the sheets before I even slept in it so it clearly wasn't mine. It smelled like weed in the hotel 24/7. My sink was also clogged so I couldn't wash my face without it overflowing. Horrible hotel, horrible location.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, that's about it. The staff was nice and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: I would steer away from Civic Center altogether - it was a very bad neighborhood where homelessness and drugs are rampant. I felt very unsafe.

review.title: Nothing fancy.  Good value.
review.reviewText: About 5 blocks from union square. The 5 blocks are a tad "shady" but during day didn't feel unsafe.  Hotel lobby has tea, coffee, water.  Staff is nice. Hotel dated.  Clean.  Has phone, cable with HBO, wireless included.  Since San Francisco has great weather and you rarely spend all your time at hotel, it's worth the price.

review.title: bad experience
review.reviewText: cant even deeam ab this in my future plan got sick me an my kids thrwing up with realy bad smell all body full with rash cuz of bed bites oh god so upset ab it

review.title: Nice hotel, good service.
review.reviewText: A nice place to stay and relatively close to attractions without being extraordinarily expensive. Also some good bars within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Valet parking. 24-hour reception. Luggage storage. Friendly, professional staff.
review.locationRemarks: A bit noisy outside during the night, but overall we had a good stay.

review.reviewText: Comfy one night stay, centrally located, friendly staff. Neighborhood is a bit rough but also surrounded by good late night joints.

review.title: Expect what you pay for !
review.reviewText: It is about 20 minutes walking distance from the Union Square. And it is definitely what you pay for. Being on Geary Street It is relatively safer however the further away you go from the Union Square the more shady it can get. The house staff was very friendly and welcoming. One of my buddies was arriving early but the reservation was in my name. I gave them my friend's name and he was able to check in early. Plenty of ubers are available to commute. Rooms were clean although the hotel is relatively old. The bathrooms were clean but okay nothing fancy. The internet didn't work the first day for some reason. also some rooms are a bit more noisy than the others. The beds were comfortable and I order ahead other complaints and had a great stay.
I am required to enter 50 characters of text here.
review.positiveRemarks: Unlike every hotel I have ever stayed in there was plenty of hot water for showers each day. Staff were all excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress was uncomfortable and ceiling fan was in need of repair (but still worked).

review.reviewText: I had good experience generally. But I don't really like the surrounding which the hotel has nothing to do with it.
Very basic no thrills hotel.  But clean, mostly quiet and friendly staff available at any time

review.title: Too much  noise!!!
review.reviewText: Can hear very loud yelling from the people outside everyday at nights.

review.title: Monarch
review.reviewText: I love staying at the monarch. Most of the time the staff is amazing and friendly. I would and still do recommend all my friends to stay. I just wish they would invest better. What I mean is the rooms as lovely as they are; are pretty gross. The walls need paint, bathrooms majority of them need repair. This hotel needs some TLC!! Great hotel, has potential to be 3-5 stars!!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: It was ok. Just ok. Very ok. I got nothing else but ok. I have to keep writing but it was ok. There was a door which was nice.

review.title: Hotel is downtown
review.reviewText:
There is no free parking for its guests, unless you want to pay then 37.00 for them to park it for you. No free parking anywhere in downtown sf. All parking is metered and parking garage is 35.00 a day.
If u visit sf, take the trolleys and cabs.

review.title: Clean, comfortable beds.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable, staff were excellent.

review.title: Not recommend
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a very noisy area. The interior is dated and dirty. Low water pressure in shower. Constant aroma of marijuana.

review.title: Not far from all the attractions.
review.reviewText: I was a bit scared since it's in an old building but it has character. No AC but we went in April it was perfect weather. The room was clean and spacious.  The Staff was nice and even let us check in at noon since my flight was early. The neighborhood was ok there was a lot of homeless outside but they were quiet. The only downfall was the valet it was $42 a day. The elevator was really old school pretty cool just it was broken on the 3rd floor and of course we got the 3rd floor and had to use the stairs. Other then that it was a good experience staying at the monarch I wouldn't mind staying there again and it was pretty affordable.
The hotel is clean and simple and seems safe. The neighborhood is not great....you won't want to walk around alone after dark.

review.title: Decent location, not a very decent hotel.
review.reviewText: When I arrived I was given a key to my room and directions to work the elevator. The selection button for the floor I was on did not work so I had to go up a floor and walk down to my floor. The room had not been cleaned from the previous occupant, bed not made, trash in the room, towels on the floor. I went to the desk and requested another room, which I was given. Hotel is much older and rooms are Motel 6 or Super 8 quality minus one star at best.

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: Tempted by a cheap rate, we greeted by a vomitting drug-addict on the steps, inattentive staff - room smelled, had hair balls, crumbs on pillows, stains on bed curtain, leaky toilet. We left after 2 minutes. They of course refused a refund, but did offer to show us another room. No thanks!

review.title: Would go back!
review.reviewText: The service was definitely outstanding. The front desk was very helpful in helping me find cheap parking and my way around San Fransisco. The only thing I would have to complain about is that because my room was close to the street the noise woke me up a couple times. But overall I would definitely go back!

review.title: The receptionist is very efficient and helpful.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff especially the receptionist are courteous and the rooms are clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff especially the receptionist are courteous and the rooms are clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator has to be improved so that it would not jerk especially when you reached your destination.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, near restaurants & groceries.

review.title: Scary
review.reviewText: No parking, bad neighborhood, dirty rooms.  I wouldn't recommend staying here.
If your ASTHMATIC you definitely don't want to stay here. So much chemicals floating in that hotel. Big asthma trigger.

review.title: Great hotel, horrible area
review.reviewText: If you're going, be aware, it's a beautiful hotel for a 2 star but be careful where you park. Our car got broken into the last night of stay and we lost EVERYTHING. Paying for safe parking is a must. Don't park on the streets.

review.title: Best bang for your buck in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
The Monarch Hotel is my first choice hotel whenever I am in San Francisco!  
If you are on a budget, or just looking to save money when in San Fran, you can't go wrong staying at The Monarch.  
The Monarch is located right in the heart of S.F.  You are in close proximity to everything.  
You can great great meals at Mel's Diner, right up Geary Blvd. at the corner.  
It is central to all San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: Affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Our room is located at the first floor. It was very nice, the beds are clean and fresh. The only drawback are the homeless near the place but they won't trouble you.

review.title: Simple, clean, and great price
review.reviewText:
I was lucky that the only queen-size room available when I arrived was located next to an elevator and the hotel receptionist assured me that it would be very noisy.  He upgraded me to a king-size bed.  My room was very large, clean and comfortable.  Flat screen t.v. with satellite channels. Free wifi (that I was unable to connect to successfully).  It was a good room at a good price.

That said, there was a huge construction project across the street that made it very noisy as the windows don't have double-panes.  The view from my window included many homeless people.  That's obviously not the hotel's fault.  That's just San Francisco - great location to Union Square, but near the Tenderloin.
Material under shower contained water - like showering on a waterbed

review.title: Good location for Polk Street scene...
review.reviewText: When we arrived, there was nobody at the front desk.  We had to go searching for a clerk to check us in...we found him in the back eating a snack.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk coverage issue mentioned above.
review.locationRemarks: Busy part of town for gay club hopping...

review.reviewText: Seedy location, run down building, questionable smells, and clogged plumbing - sink and toilet. Grimy clock, television remote, desk, dresser and night stand. Running the shower causes a large pool of water to collect on the bathroom floor.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights was a good hotel till I saw there where empty beer bottles under my bed the shower had no power what's soo ever and wall on ones side of room was bad other than that good hotel
Very loud and old hotel. No parking, not in the best location.

review.title: Decent for a budget hotel.
review.reviewText: I paid $150 total per night but my other hotel options were $250 plus. It was decent and close enough to things but many homeless around the area. No airconditioning so summer stays would be uncomfortable.

review.title: Take bus 38 to BART Montgomery station.
review.reviewText: Simple, adequate hotel. Front had steps. Private bath better than sharing a bath. No hair blower.

review.title: This hotel needs a little renovation
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little old for my taste. They need to renovate it a little.
The hotel was great for the price good location, very good if your passing in town and want crash.

review.title: A OK hotel if you need somewhere to sleep
review.reviewText: I do blame myself to some extent for not looking at the reviews before I booked this hotel. Honestly the price you pay to stay here is strictly based off location with this place DO NOT expect quality. The pictures are deceiving to a extent yes you see the nice bed and window but what you don't see is the entire place falling apart. The elevator felt like it was going to give out at any moment, the door on our room looked like it could have been knocked down by a blow of wind, and the phone in the room didn't even have a speed dial to call the front desk!" I understand that this is a older building but it needs some serious renovations and new frunture and paint dose not classify as renovated. The thing that got me and I don't know it all hotels in the area do this but i had to pay $41 to valet park my car because the hotel did not have a place to park at all. That to me was the final nail in the coffin. On a brighter note the only thing I can say I enjoyed was the location of the hotel and the friendliness of the hotel staff. Coming from someone who has stayed in many Las Vegas hotels at half the price of this hotel I was disappointed and I will not be looking to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, more room amenities, structure renovation, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of downtown, Short Uber ride away from Ghirardelli Square and fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Smelly rooms in a bad neighborhood
review.reviewText:
Rooms are generally clean, and staff was friendly, but they use way too much cleaning fluid.  The rooms wreak of it.  It's sort of a flowery Pinesol smell.  My stuff still smells like it after getting home.

Also, the neighborhood (Tenderloin) is full of homeless and crackheads.  There is a gospel mission right across the street, so the homeless congregate around this area.

Only bonus is that it is right beside and amazingly good Afghan restaurant.

review.title: It was in a perfect location for us.
review.reviewText: It was in a perfect location for us close to where we needed to be

review.title: Noisy location
review.reviewText:
Was on route for all fire and police vehicles, construction across the street, and many homeless, who made noise most of the night. The room we had was recently redone and the water contained "black pieces" which the desk clerk denied. The wi-fi was slow and I was unable to open or send email for my last two days. Of course, the desk clerk assured us the wi-fi was working perfectly.

Never again!
review.negativeRemarks: New windows that block noise, shelves and outlets in bathrooms, better Wi-Fi
review.locationRemarks: It was near busses and not far from Union Square. BUT, no real restaurants or stores in the neighborhood

review.title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!
review.reviewText: Terrible hotel and neighborhood, room smelled and there was no fan and the windows were screwed shut.  Hotel was run down and room was awful.

Old , old old old bad small in rooms
dirty carpet
Nice stay.  It was about about we expected: not fancy, but nice place.  Floors were a little creaky and walls were pretty thin.
review.locationRemarks: A bit "on the edge" of where you'd want to be, but certainly ok.  Tommy's Joynt restaurant nearby is great bar/restaurant for late night!

review.title: Nice old hotel walking dist toeverything
review.reviewText: I like the old hotels and the elevator was pretty cool the staff was awsome the furniture needs updated but the maids were great, wish it had a resturant.
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms updated
review.locationRemarks: walking dist to everything

review.reviewText: An ok place just to lay your head. And wash your behind. Parking was overrated. It made you be forced to pay for the $43 valet parking because they have street cleaning on the weekends.

review.title: Older style hotel with very few amenities
review.reviewText: Staff gave us a hard time about checking in early on superbowl Sunday. Older style hotel which was cool but very few amenities. Good for the price.

review.title: Decent hotel for price
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and professional and let us check-in early. The room smelled a little like mold, but that was the only complaint we had of our 3 night stay. The location was ok, 5-7min walk to union square, locals said it was kind of a sketchy location, but we didn't have any problems. Overall I would recommend the hotel.

review.title: Lacking expectations
review.reviewText: As we got into the monarch hotel, we were really expecting a decent welcoming establishment with many things to offer. However this wasnt the case. The hotel doesnt have type of restaurant or place that we can get food, they are lacking staffs and amenities, their appliances are falling apart to their negligence, and worst of all as we have stayed here we had to get up from our sleep because of a fire breakout and the only notice that we had was from the only staff member that could not even pull the fire alarm for immediate response from the fire dept. I wish i could say that this is an OK hotel but it isnt.

Homeless shelter across the street.
Loud..lots of yelling from the homeless.
Scary walking by to get to and from the hotel to downtown.  
Central location. Easily accessible by walking to the tourist attractions.

review.title: 2 star hotel through and through
review.reviewText: This hotel is convenient, though very run-down, stinky, and barely passable. The upside-- the staff is lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Fresh coat of paint, make the whole hotel non-smoking, clean the upholstery, provide two-ply toilet paper.

review.reviewText: The room was large and clean, but I was not keen on the bathroom. The sink was small and the toilet could not be flushed twice and had to be unplugged by the Hotel handyman. I also could have done with a hot cup of coffee in the morning, the coffee was too strong, the cups were the smallest you could get and it was only made once a day, I could never get a fresh cup of coffee and only powdered milk was available like it was in the war. It reminded me of the war years when you could only get powdered milk because fresh milk or cream was not available. In the end I bought an electrical appliance and bought coffee and made it myself in the room. I found it to be a better cup of coffee and at least, I enjoyed hot coffee everyday. I like cream in my coffee and at times I had to take it from  restaurants and bought it to my room. .The house maid said they cooked breakfast only for groups so I don't understand why they advertise that they offer breakfast on the internet. I needed breakfast in the mornings because I take medications, but could not always afford it because in San Francisco breakfast costs $12.99 and up to $15.00 or even $16.00 with the taxes and I could not afford it everyday. This was a far cry from another hotel I was in 2 years ago, the coffee they served every morning was fresh and as much as you wanted and there was fresh cream to go with it. Altogether, I did not think that this Hotel was good value for my dollar.
review.positiveRemarks: It was not too far from the center of the City. I should have taken a bus, but most of the time I walked to it.
review.negativeRemarks: If it were not for the electric appliance that I bought myself to boil water, I would have nothing to eat or drink before leaving the leaving the Hote
review.locationRemarks: It was a rundown area, Geary Street in San Francisco is well known for its homeless population, but they did not bother me at all. I felt sorry for th

review.title: Not a very nice area
review.reviewText: Not a very nice area, however its only a short walk to union square and powell street station. The wifi was terrible. We couldnt even use it. Some of the staff were helpful, others were really quite rude.

review.title: Mold on walls
review.reviewText: Staff were nice but the black mold on the bathroom wall left me holding my breath when using the bathroom to avoid inhaling dangerous spores.  You don't expect much with two stars but you shouldn't need to worry about health effects either.

review.title: Nice enough, totally liveable
review.reviewText: The hotel was a bit old but very clean, the location is good and has easy access to public transport. The only con about the location is it is across the street from a corner with a correctional facility but that corner is easily avoided if you just approach the hotel from all other angles.

review.title: Hotel not what is pictured, Not worth the price
review.reviewText: Upon review of the hotel on line it seemed to have a nice location, the rooms looked up to date and would be close to everything. Once we arrived it was in a bad neighbor hood, no parking, the rooms was out dated, small, cramp area. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and rebuild it
review.locationRemarks: The location is one block up from the bad area where all the homeless and drug dealers stand on the street corner. Union Square was about 7 blk away

review.title: good hotel for backpackers
review.reviewText: I booked as package and it was really a good deal! The location is 7 blocks west from union square, it won't take long to get to the square either by buses or feet. Since it is on the west side of union square, there is no slope to climb up or down. Also, it is close to Hyde street where one of cable car operates there. The room is clean with basic complementary. Free hot tea and coffee at lobby are such a comfort in this weather.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaning detergent or other cleaning tools may be too strong? I always smell something when I get into the room.

review.reviewText: Terrible wi-fi connection. Very dirty windows. No hair dryer in room.
The safe was not working. The wi-fi was very bad and slow. The clock was showing a wtong time.

review.title: Nice, central and cheap hotel
review.reviewText: I have been there with my parents and my boyfriend. The rooms on the top floors are nicers than those in the lower floors. Overall clean and confortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It's conveniently located for a fair price
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of the towels (old and worn)

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: Dissapointed in the location and in Expedia for recomending it.  Hotel is across from a homeless shelter, not ideal when you traveling with kids! Beds are very uncomfortable and hotel very old.

review.title: bed is clean
review.reviewText: no sound proved. can hear someone talking from next room. can hear someone walking upstair.

review.title: Not what it looks like in the pictures
review.reviewText: The only parking they have is vallet for an extra $46. The room was much smaller and older than it looks in the photo's. The whole hotel and room had a funky smell (reminisant of old/stale cigarette smoke). The beds were tiny (not full size - seemed about a twin & a half each). A fire alarm went off at 1am. The front desk staff was helpful when I asked them questions (but not outwardly friendly). The room was clean-ish (it is an old hotel, so probably the cleanest it could be).
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing I really liked about this hotel was the location. It was close to downtown and there were plently of places close to get food.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Location was convinent if you need to be downtown. Food, bars, mini market, coffee shop were all within a block and open late/early.

review.title: Cozy and Warm
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Monarch hotel. Some reviews said there was a smell in the room, this is correct, but it is not overpowering and you get used to it after a very short time. The staff are pleasant and friendly. Elevator access is great and you get a good feel of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Good to be able to get a cup of coffee in the Lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Offer tea/coffee in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of shops and easy walking to bay area/ fishermans warf

review.title: It was ok they should put refrigerators in the roo
review.reviewText: It was pretty good over all the elevator is a bit slow but all good

review.title: Excellent budget hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is not fancy, but it was very good price for a hotel in the area.  

The first room they put me in got a lot of street noise, but the front desk changed me a different room when I requested a quieter room.

I was very satisfied with my experience.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Hotel is inexpensive for San Francisco, but is not a place I would stay often due to how worn down the property is (and the neighborhood). It was clean and felt safe, but the first room I had was very noisy (could hear my neighbors), the TV did not work, and the toilet wouldn't flush. I was moved to another floor/room and the room wasn't as worn out/TV worked, toilet ok...  The staff is kind of hit or miss -- some very friendly, some not thrilled to be there. Also, the red "you have a message" light went on in both rooms and when I called the desk, they said there were no messages.
review.positiveRemarks: Good public transport, easy to walk downtown, price, near good/basic restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Water damage in ceilings, TVs not working, toilets slow and/or clogged, message lights on phones, alarm clock impossible to figure out...
review.locationRemarks: Tenderloin neighborhood is rough but trendy (some cool bars/clubs/restaurants but tons of homeless and lots of grime/trash). Tommy's Joynt/Mel's.

review.title: Good price, decent rooms
review.reviewText: Comfy bed, great location for bars and downtown. Not a bad price for being so close to so many restaurants and bars.

review.title: Good hotel, great value.
review.reviewText: Was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. After reading a lot of bad reviews I was weary but it turned out to be ok. I was upgraded to a king room corner suites and it was huge, very bright and had a huge walk in closet. The only thing I would complain about would be the elevator, was very slow and didn't seem very safe. Other than that it was great. Location was good too.
Hotel was close to main drag.  Nearby restaurants were substandard.  Close to movie theatres and bus lines,
Front desk was very kind and helpful.  When I needed something they brought it right up room was very comfortable

review.title: Not at all what we expected.  Old run down!
review.reviewText: There is no where to park if you have a car and to get your car from the valet which is $41.00 per day is takes up to 45 minute wait.  The hotel it self is very old, no air conditioning but a ceiling fan.  Rooms are so small I had to lift the suit case on to the bed to be able to push into the closet.  No available blow dryers and any of the basic amenities they have any normal hotel.   We will never stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to be upfront so people do not expect anything great.
review.locationRemarks: I believe this hotel is located in an area that is not so great of a neighborhood.

review.reviewText: Overall room was dingy with stained floors and walls, all linens including towels felt like sandpaper; overall nothing terrible happened the hotel was just disappointing.  Especially when we realized we could have stayed in the motel 8 for the same price and at least had a fridge and microwave and been in a better area for the same price.
Nice folks. Courteous staff . Very helpful. For the price it was an excellent stay

review.title: average hotel
review.reviewText: Good location. However,old hotel with ageing facilities

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: By some of the other reviews, I was a little nervous about staying here. But the room was great, the hotel was mostly quiet (I mean you're in San Francisco, it's going to be a little noisy) and I think it was perfect for the price! The neighborhood isn't the greatest, but it's not awful either! Would stay here again.

review.title: Economical choice that did not made my trip worse
review.reviewText: Stayed there for 3 days, the entirety of my SF trip, and it did not upset me and my GF, and 3 days is a pretty long time if the hotel is bad.  Didn't find air conditioning for my room but it was OK because its not summer and my GF doesn't like it cold anyway.  I'd rate everything (such as staff, room condition, etc) "OK", no views for my room.  It's more like a 3 star experience, but at its price point, I feel like it deserves more.  It's also a 30 second walk away from a very very good afghan restaurant and I have to say that really helped.

review.title: Very disappointing
review.reviewText: Room was dirty, hotel is in a less than safe part of town. Staff was wholly unwilling to address room cleanliness problems or issue a 75% refund.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to listen to feedback and execute on it. If a guest says the sheets are dirty and the room doesn't look clean, listen and improve it!

review.reviewText:
It has a very unpleasant smell, it's an old building most likely made of wood only, that you would be able to hear everything 
:( the only good thing there is the staff was very friendly

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but expensive for the size of the room, tub was clogged so water would not drain quick enough, I hate how we had no free parking it's bad that we are paying so much for the hotel and still have to pay for parking !!!!! Location was not so bad it was near many bars and restaurants overall It was an alright experience.

review.title: Old hotel with charm
review.reviewText: Although this hotel was not new, I enjoyed staying here. I like the old-style charm that fit with the feel of the whole city. All the staff members were helpful and friendly. The room was clean. Some might not feel it's super clean since it is outdated, but they did a good job cleaning it. For the price, this was an excellent value.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the staff and the character of the hotel. Everyone was helpful and seemed to care that we had a great stay.
review.negativeRemarks: We could hear street noise, which usually wasn't too bad when we were sleeping. Didn't like paying $40/night to park the car.
review.locationRemarks: We were a short drive or walk to many places. Union Square was about a 15 minute walk and the Wharf was about 15 min drive.

review.title: This hotel was in very very poor state
review.reviewText: The day we got their, their was a homeless person stretched out on the front steps drinking coffee. The moment we walked in, it smelled like urine. When we spoke to the front desk he was alone, and several times asked us to hold on while he answered the phone. As we went up to our room with the broken elevator, the smell now was more like toilets backing up. After we got into the room the smell was as if someone peed in the corner, and the staff tried to cover it up with some spray. The towels and face towels had " marks of you know what in them " nothing was clean in this not hotel (motel), seemed more like a half an hour motel, and not suitable for holidays. The sheets were ripped on the bed, the mattress were at lease 20 years old, you fell trough it,  the ceiling paint was flaking off the ceiling. A real run down motel. We asked to be moved, but it was to a worse. We complained but nothing was done, and even complaining dint help. Most of the staff didn't even speak English, and the manager was no where to be found....it ruined my Holiday... NEVER AGAIN!!!
review.negativeRemarks: no comment
review.locationRemarks: location was full of homeless people

review.title: Old hotel
review.reviewText: No parking needed to pay to park two block away hotel in need of repairs  homeless people sleeping on the walks across from hotel would not !!!!! Stay again

review.title: Conveniently located for convention
review.reviewText:
Attending a convention around Van Ness and California and this hotel is located close by. This area has all the amenities.(restaurants, coffee shop, transit, etc)
Hotel was a reasonable price, you get what you pay for but it was clean. Could use some more soundproofing between rooms and floors. Front desk staff we're friendly and helpful. We will definitely book this hotel again but if you're looking for something luxurious, skip it.

review.title: For economy travelers-OK,overall-not good at all
review.reviewText:
Hotel and its condition looks quite outdated, especially its dinosaur elevator system. So if you don't want to lose 10-15 minutes just to get downstairs ask for a room on lower floor or....use stairs.

Another big problem is parking. They ask for 41 $ (!) per night for valet which is quite expensive. Do not pay for that, better to look around nearby and find a free parking space, I always did.

To be fair room itself was clean but you always feel that this hotel is all about economy.

review.title: Eclectic
review.reviewText: Nice room. Poor location. A lot of homeless people around. Valet park was expensive and took forever. It was unique. Not a Hampton in.
The bathroom was so tiny and the beds were spring beds, the pillow had a roach in it. I just didn't really enjoy the hotel at all. We saw a woman peeing on a car right outside the window.
It's good old hotel but to expensive for the quality and the neighborhood  it's not one of the best in town

photos.caption: Old fashioned, but nice and clean

review.title: Old hotel however with some character to it
review.reviewText: Hotel is quite old - elevator with a manual door, very old style design of everything, however generally working (despite the faucet in the bathroom which was hardly holding in place and the half clogged sink). At the same time the room and the bathroom were very clean, the people in the lobby - quite friendly and helpful, the complementary tea and coffee in the lobby were quite nice and useful and the hotel was quite close to the downtown action. Was a good value for money if you ask me and I would no doubt come back.
review.negativeRemarks: Sanitary fixtures functional condition
review.locationRemarks: Downtown location. Walking distance to many places.

review.title: Clean bed and bathroom, just really old.
review.reviewText: The lobby was nice, no breakfast that we could find. valet parking was expensive and then they couldn't find the car for a harrowing 30 minutes. All in all, it was clean and had a nice bed and nice staff. Very old building, kinda creepy elevator, but it worked.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenience to downtown was a plus. The neighborhood was no scarier than any other. Close to everything we wanted!
review.negativeRemarks: A couple of tiles were missing in the bathroom. There was a little musty smell.
review.locationRemarks: It is right on Geary, close to Van Ness and not far from Japan Town or anywhere else we wanted to go.

review.title: Good hotel for a short stay
review.reviewText: This hotel had a nostalgic feeling to it, felt like I was in old school San Francisco, especially by the way the elevator was designed. Area is not the best but we already knew this. The price was great and so we could not say no to this deal. Hotel served as a great base for a quick three day trip to SF. Ten minutes away from the hop on hop off bus tour, which is great if you want to see the city in a day. Room was spacious and clean, no complaints.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and free coffee in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Cant think of anything, which is a good thing.
review.locationRemarks: The area is not the best, would not recommend anyone walking around with a DSLR camera at night. During the day time it is fine.

review.reviewText: The Monarch Hotel was just about as bad as I was imagining after reading the earlier reviews on Expedia. I booked with an airline bundle, so many of my options were limited, and I thought it would be ok for a two-night say. I was wrong. Upon entering the hotel, I was greeted by an awful smell (either the age of the hotel is really showing, or they are spraying an extremely potent bug repellant) that only got worse when I got into the room. Everything felt dirty — the sheets, pillows, floors, and tile — and worse, you felt dirty/grimy after taking a shower. I found myself putting towels on the floor to walk around the room comfortably. I would not recommend staying here, but if my warning does not give you pause, stay here only if you know you are going to be away from the room for extended periods of time and are looking on a budget.
review.negativeRemarks: There was an awful smell upon entering the hotel, and an even worse one once I got into the room.
review.locationRemarks: It's not an awful location, but I would not be comfortable walking around at night.

review.title: Close to Japan town
review.reviewText: Very old building. Room carpet felt kind of mushy. Did not have hair dryer. Staff were friendly. Convenient location on Geary St. close to a good breakfast place (Mel's), Japan Town and Hertz Car Rentals but maybe not the best security wise. There was a leakage which didn't affect our room but there were plumbers everywhere.

review.title: I either had to endure a sauna, or terrible noise
review.reviewText: The room was ok, as expected for the pay, but it was hot. I checked on the air conditioner, somebody had put it to the minimum already. I looked everywhere to see if there was any type of air cooler. Finally I go back to bed exasperated, realizing that I was not going to enjoy the night sleep. I looked at the ceiling and, voila, a fan! Excellent, what better? I thought. It didn't work. Then I decided to open the windows if it was possible, and it was. To wake every 5 minutes to yells and, sometimes scary screams, or sirens and trucks, or buses. Gawd! I had one of my worst nights ever!
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the air conditioner, or at least make the fan work!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of interesting restaurants and the fact that it's downtown.

review.title: poor conditions
review.reviewText: toilet was running all night could not sleep, no microwave in the room, and the room was hot because the hotel has no air condition. overall disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: i could not improve anything, but the hotel need's to update.
review.locationRemarks: nothing, just alot of homless people in the area

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: This hotel is great for friends bring together. It was me and three friends and we all like it because we were all in a budget and I don't recommend for families with children. The area is great in the day time...when it leads to night which is not that bad. Be together at night but overrall good hotel with friends. Lastly, the noise will keep going all night!

review.title: Clean, great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is older, but not run-down. The location is perfect for walking around San Francisco  (especially if you don't have a car-- parking is $40 per day). There are dozens of great, cheap eateries near by, as well as salons, bars, massage parlors and attractions. Across from a shelter, so expect some variety of peoples outside. Front desk didn't always answer the phone. Beautiful view.

review.title: Bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: So this is the third time I've been asked to revise my review. I still hold to the fact that I don't recommend this place due to being in a bad neighborhood and expensive valet parking.

review.title: Clogged toilet, stinking rooms
review.reviewText: Clogged toilet, maintenance staff made me wait while trying to clean it all morning, hotel didnt offer another room , entire room filled eith string stinking

review.title: Had hoped it would be close to the Univ. of SF
review.reviewText: Very small room that was not accommodating for a disabled guest.

review.title: Nice hotel staff.
review.reviewText: Thank you for the good customer service.especially that asian girl that works at the front desk at night shift.i would recommend it and I will come back for sure

review.title: I'd go back.
review.reviewText: Definitely not a luxury hotel. Very basic. Clean, but dated decor.

review.title: Don't believe the pictures.
review.reviewText: The rooms don't look like the pictures. Very out dated hotel. Rooms just have enough room for two beds and bathroom. No A/C. Just ceiling fans and open the windows but there's a shelter for the homeless across the street and with the windows open you hear them screaming and fighting every night. All night long. There is 1 extremely old elevator that takes forever and every time we got on it we thought it was going to break.
So helpful and kind, clean and comfortable. Location is close to food and entertainment, right outside of the downtown area, and extremely well priced.

review.title: good "vintage" feel
review.reviewText:
pros: 
EXCELLENT customer service, if it wasnt for this I would've hated my stay
located walking distance between Japantown and Union Square. 
great if you like old, Victorian-style buildings
rooftop view access (by either stairs or fire escape, dont get locked out)
coffee shop right across street, and CVS a block away
wi-fi

cons:
since building is pretty old, rooms are kinda on smaller side (don't let online photos fool you)
some aspects of the building are a tad bit rundown (doors, bathroom, elevator, etc.)
walls were a bit thin, I could hear a bed rocking on the mattress above
our room had a temp control unit, but I didn't feel any AC? there is a ceiling fan tho.
review.positiveRemarks: cozy, vintage, best customer service I have exp
review.negativeRemarks: pricing
review.locationRemarks: coffee shop, japantown, union square, china town, painted ladies (further walk)

review.reviewText: It wasn't the best but it was terrible it was good if it's just a place you want to sleep while you're out day and night in the city

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We got there late at night and the lady at front desk help carry our luggage up to our room. We loved our room because we had a huge closet that had a window in it. Parking was expensive but when we got ready to leave hotel the car was out front waiting for us, which was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Very roomy, front desk young lady was very nice and seem to be doing everything. It was late when we got there.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was way to expensive!!

review.title: Terrbile experience , no a/c in this hotel
review.reviewText: No a good experience, no parking, smile of drugs were, it's terrible I am never going back, nobody should never go to this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Every thing, build this one again
review.locationRemarks: Very bad, fo

review.reviewText: Old hotel in rough area, paint peeling off ceiling, no heat or air, homeless hollering all night outside window.  Parking cost $40 extra, avoid if you can.  We checked out early, found much better for about the same price.

review.title: Do not pick this hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel was terrible!! there was no A/C  there was mold, water damage, the window screen from one of the rooms we booked was falling out.  we had to open the windows to stay cool... which wasn't good because we could hear bums fighting on the street all night..  I am from Texas and I had no idea this hotel was located in the "Tenderloin District".  If you do not know what that means... let me explain!  Homeless drug addicted bums are all over the streets around this hotel.... 24/7.  At night they become more lively and fight outside the windows of this hotel.   Furthermore there was NO PARKING LOT... THERE WAS NO OPTION TO PARK YOUR CAR.  You were required to pay the valet every time you came and went.... i have no idea where this parking area was where they took the car but it took 15-20 minutes to get the car back.  i pray i never have to stay at a place like this again.  This hotel should not be a part of Expedia... Could someone please make a request to this hotel to get our money back?  we had 2 rooms.  Thank you! 

Jessalynn Tucker

review.title: Do not go here!
review.reviewText: You didn't like my first review. I feel the same. Fights in the street. Prostitute in hotel hallway.

review.title: Over priced hotel with uninterested staff.
review.reviewText: Way too expensive for the kind of place it was. $41.00 a night for valet that isn't mentioned until you get there and takes 45 minutes to get your car. WiFi never worked properly and the elevator didn't work. Tiny rooms, no A/C. Not as clean as my house. The staff had limited English skills and seemed put out by any request.
review.negativeRemarks: Virtually anything.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the California Street trolley line.

review.title: Nice hotel, Good price and location
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 3 nights and it was a very pleasant stay. The staff was friendly and the room had all what it takes to make your stay comfortable. I read the reviews before booking the hotel and most of them were pretty bad. I am glad it turned out to be a very pleasant hotel.

review.title: Hotel but Motel
review.reviewText: This hotel is more a motel. Used cheep soap in the bathroom, rip linen and people shooting drugs outside. The Monarch is located close to China Town, Downtown, North Beach and Union Square, so walking is possible during the day, NOT AT NIGHT. We found a good bakery close and Farm Fresh which had good coffee etc.

review.title: Old hotel in very loud area bad views and lots of
review.reviewText: There were no amenities bad view and rundown area

review.title: The hotel is good
review.reviewText: Is far to union square and in front of the hotel many homeless. The room is clean and the price is super high for the hotel.

review.title: Stayed for the price
review.reviewText: Weird smell in the room. Ceiling fan looked like it may fall off. Bathroom is clean.  Internet speed was so slow that it's irrelevant.

review.title: Horrible location now. Homeless shelter next door
review.reviewText: No parking. Bad location. Homeless shelter next to it. Subjects aggressively panhandling and threatening. Obvious mentally ill homeless walking around motel talking to theirselves

review.title: Q
review.reviewText: We could not stay here because it was old, run down and allowed a crowd of  scary people to hang out in the hotel lobby. Parking was impossible. They allowed a space that was encircled by other cars. The attendant was crude and caustic. The room was inadequate and was dark and dingy.  Voices could be heard from other rooms. Only one elevator with iron gate and door.  The area outside the hotel had people on various sidewalks hollering at each other.
review.negativeRemarks: Update. Clean up.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to see city from here.  Risky neighborhood however.

review.title: Hotel description NOT as advertised!
review.reviewText:
Upon check-in to the hotel, I was informed that there was NO Free Parking onsite as advertised as being FREE!  There would be a separate parking fee from a third party company costing upwards to $24-26 per day/night. And you had to walk about  a block to park your car at an underground garage located away from the hotel.
The elevator we used to go up to the 5th floor was very unstable once you reached your floor level! The room did not have any A/C or toilet exhaust for the bathroom. Finally, the hotel is located in the city where you see and here many transient homeless people because you have to open the windows to bring in fresh air from the outside to cool the room!
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing my family and I liked about this hotel was it was close  to  a Mel's Diner & an AMC theater.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide actual hotel parking onsite, rather than a third party company where you have to pay $24-26 per night to park your vehicle.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel is terrible!  The hotel is located in the old part of the town where you see and here many transient people.

review.reviewText: The hotel is nice but old decorared. Dtaff didnt help me with the luggage

review.title: Charming hotel, great staff, not far from union sq
review.reviewText: There is a homeless shelter right across from the hotel and one block down is a pretty tough neighborhood.
review.positiveRemarks: Great period building clean rooms. Very charming.
review.negativeRemarks: Move the homeless shelter away.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is not far. Otherwise stay clear of the neighborhood.

review.title: Not the best part of town
review.reviewText: Overall it was a good experience.  A microwave and refrigerator would make it a lot better.  I had to stay for two weeks due to a big move from south Texas to San Francisco and was spending way to much eating out.

review.title: It's old but comfortable
review.reviewText:
The reviews are true, this hotel is really old... the rooms are in need of major renovations but if u keep that in mind you shouldnt be disappointed. 
My room was pretty quiet minus some noisy next door neighbors one day and it was an inner room. The bed was comfy and i slept well, the windows seemed new and were pretty well insulated.
Check in was smooth and the front desk man easily accommodated my room request. The free coffee and water in the lobby is have been better if their was actual breakfast too for the price we payed.  
Overall no complaints except the room was really run down and not like the pictures on the website. The bed and tv were nice and new and the hbo cable was a plus. The area wasnt as bad as some other areas in SF as people were saying. I definitely did not not feel safe walking around the hotel as it was a pretty busy area. 
I would stay again if they renovated the rooms.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: This hotel is reasonably priced compared to the Rest of San Fransisco. Very Friendly, very understanding, not every room has Air-Conditioning.

review.title: Hotel with a perfect location
review.reviewText:
I made a reservation for this hotel a couple months prior to my trip and was skeptical about them having my reservation and everything but it was all ok. The staff is really nice and make you feel at ease. The rooms are one thing I want to talk about. The bed is really nice and comfortable, there's a semi walk-in closet for all your stuff and the bathroom is nice and clean. Although the main lights (ceiling) could be a bit brighter, the rest of the lights are incredible and soothing. 

The Monarch is in Geary St., which is really noisy due to the amount of traffic, but once you close the window, its like you're not even close to the street, which makes sleeping at night a pleasure. The one thing I really liked, despite my mother hating it is the elevator, which is fast and small.

From the hotel you can pretty much travel anywhere with little to no walking. If you're going to take buses, then you're in for a treat staying in the hotel. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise the floor makes when you walk around. Don't like to disturb the people below me.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect. You can walk to Chinatown (25 min walk), Japantown (15 min walk) and take buses to the Golden Gate and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Expedia should be embarrassed
review.reviewText: The lobby smelled of urine. The carpets in the hallways and guest rooms were stained. The bathroom counter was falling apart. Upon entry, the bathroom was dirty (hair and dirt). The pillow cases were greying. There's no AC. The description on Expedia misrepresents the location (the hotel is a mile away from Union Square, yet the hotel says it's in Union Square). The front desk uses a manual card imprinting machine and stores full credit card information - which is not secure.

review.title: Don't stay here.
review.reviewText:
Find someplace else. Pretty dicey neighborhood. Got hit up for money every time I went outside. Room was small and dirty. Totally needs 100% remodeling. I've stayed at Motel 6's that were way better.  Even the price was way too high.

Not recommended in any way.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel the entire place.
review.locationRemarks: Dicey neighborhood with bums everywhere.

review.title: Nice staff, but place is really run down
review.reviewText:
First, the good. 

The staff was friendly. It seemed important to them that I had a pleasant stay. I also saw that they were always very busy attending to hotel guests. 

Now the not-so good. 

1. Dirty wash cloths and towels. I'm not sure what is worse-- the wash cloth with the inexplicable dark stains on it or the wash cloth with the inexplicable red stains on it. I'm going to think positive here and assume the latter was simply make up which failed to come out in the wash. 

2. The plumbing is wonky. When I turned the faucet on, the entire control surface of the bathroom sink swiveled about 20 degrees to the right. It was also difficult to get a consistent temperature out of the shower faucet. 

3. General dilapidation. I wasn't expecting much of a view, but when I opened my window, I also didn't expect to see what appeared to be water rot on the wall facing my room. Or an empty bag of Doritos impaled upon the anti-burglar spikes which laced my sixth floor windows like teeth around the mouth of a Anglerfish. 

I can only assume the management is either unaware of these problems or is unmotivated to address them.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very nice and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Buy some new bath towels. Yuck.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location on Geary

review.title: GREAT price for a 2 star hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, old and in a so, so location.  The room was clean, bed was comfortable and the shower was OK.  The hotel is 7 city blocks from the streetcar and cable cars.  The bus stops at the corner and we used a $35.00 muni pass for all the public transportation to get around the city.  Parking ($42.00-$58.00) is expensive in the city, so take the public transportation. We very safe at the hotel.  The hotel is not a 3 star, but great for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel could definitely use a makeover.
review.locationRemarks: the cable car line and street cars are 7 blocks.  the muni bus in just a half block away.

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Everything was good . Staff was professional & friendly.

Outside is dangerous because vas very dirty and many danger people at night . The hotel is too old and require urgent full maintanance .
I never will back to book at this hotel .
There is no parking close . I had to park two blocks of the hotel.
The elevator wasn't working properly . Wifi was failing all times.
There's other options close to this place.

review.contentCodes: CRMD REMOD NLI CSN HMP MMD
review.title: Really Unclean
review.reviewText: We had a bad experience with cleanleness.  Checked in went to the SFG game and came in around 11:00 pm pulled back the covers and there were weavels and bugs in the the bed..Unfolded the 10.00 rollaway and there was blood and urine stains showing through the thin sheet..  Asked the staff to look at the cleanleness issue and the employee said that they were not bugs but lint... i mentioned that they were bugs and if it was indeed lint the bed was not clean and it doesn't explain the horrible stains on the rollaway...  After asking for a partial refund they were only willing to give me 10.00 off of the 172.00 room.  I then spoke to Expedia and after an hour and a half and going through 3 employess to the supervisor they finally said they would refund my $$ and we had to check out at 1:00 am  with my 84 year old mother in her PJ's and travel 1 1/2 hrs to find another hotel. Had to fight with Expedia to get a refund and after the refund they said they would give me a $50.00 voucher... which hopefully they will do .  Have to wait 2 weeks to see my refund for the room and hopefully it will come through.  Staff was very nice but not willing to budge at first... Also no house keeping for anythng to fix the problem.  Also the fire extenguisher wasa out of date by 4 months.
review.positiveRemarks: The ornate setting was very pretty and the lobby was clean but the room was YUCK...
review.negativeRemarks: Having Expedia look at the hotels better that they promote.
review.locationRemarks: right downtown with several bums across the street.

review.title: Simple, inexpensive, great location
review.reviewText: It was very good. We did not expect much for the price we paid, but it was perfect for our family of four. The beds, and pillows, and shower, and TV was all we needed. This location is very close to lots of attractions and we had great breakfast in the corner diner, and coffee from  across the street. I also liked that it is a historic building that was built in 1920's... It still has that special character! I was very satisfied, so were my children and my spouse.

review.title: convenience location
review.reviewText: look like old hotel, but convenience location, need renovation room floor bath sink
review.negativeRemarks: need renovation, such as elevator, room floor, no Wi-Fi available as advertized

review.reviewText: It was ok not great. The hotel is very old and the rooms are super small. Not worth the 700 dollars we paid for two nights.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: staff extremely friendly, made us feel at home.  Rooms very clean, and location was great for our needs. Would definitely stay here again Richard K

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: great staff, very comfertible bed. Needs a paint job and cleaning. Toilets did not work well at all.  Walking distance to everything.  Great bus system

review.title: Close to Gay Pride.
review.reviewText: I only wish the room would have had a mini frig because even a bucket with ice melts.  Also, was under the impression there would be breakfast I woke super early asked downstairs to discover not even orange juice and a bagel was to be had.

review.title: Small but confy
review.reviewText: Nice location, room was clean, small but nice, more than I was expecting

review.title: Smoke smell, noisy.
review.reviewText: Stayed for a night during San Francisco prIde. Expensive but location was good. The room smelled like smoke, could hear everything next door. If you looked out the window you could see the next room over, bed and everything. The windows had the screens popped out on the "balcony." Elevator was old and hard to use. Pictures on website look much different than actual hotel room.

review.title: Hotel is okay if you must stay in downtown.
review.reviewText: Hotel is okay if you must stay downtown San Francisco, you must know that there is NO free parking there! it's $41.00 + plus tax for car, ,more for larger vehicles.  If you have the time stay near the Air port and drive in, you make sure you give yourselves enough time.  Rooms are small, free WiFi didn't work for me, work for my daughter. Elevator was very old and slow, it even got stuck once, next time I'll look for something better.  oh yes the price was not cheap either.

review.title: Right for the price...got a good deal
review.reviewText: Took the BART train from airport to Civic Center station and walked about 20 minutes to hotel. It was about 1PM, but in hindsight I would have called a taxi, which would have cost cost about 6 bucks plus tip. The area is kind of rough. We were able to check in early, which was nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful whenever we needed anything. (hair dryer, ice) The windows in the room opened, but it could be loud outside. No other way to control temperature in room. Heater/cooler was broken. We were gone most of the day so this wan't an issue. Shower worked well, both temperature and pressure. I would recommend bringing your own soap and shampoo though or buying some nearby when you get there. TV had cable.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to busline 47 to Fisherman's Wharf. Convenience store with beer, Great American Music Hall, movie theater & Mel's Diner all within two blocks.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel in general had strange odor. One window had no screen, was open upon arrival, so flies in room. Iron leaked, iron board would not stand up.
review.locationRemarks: Close to busline 47 to Fisherman's Wharf. Convenience store with beer, Great American Music Hall, movie theater & Mel's Diner all within two blocks.

review.title: A budget hotel,with helpful staff.
review.reviewText: The location was good,apart from on Geary Blvd.there are a lot of homeless,if you are offended by them use van Ness to access Market st.and the city.This is a social issue not an hotel problem. personally I had no issues with them. The hotel staff were helpful .
review.positiveRemarks: It was budget priced and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: It is a bit dated.
