review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Union Square & Market st. gives you easy access to the whole city if you buy a Clipper card from Walgreens for$3, just top up the value

review.title: Cannot Recommend
review.reviewText: This hotel is very old - it has the oldest elevator I've ever been in.  The lobby is nice, but my room was slanted - the entire bathroom was at an angle so it was weird to take a shower.  All the white towels had grey splotches like they hadn't been properly cleaned and they were very rough - not soft.  They windows were open when I arrived and there was a lot of street noise.  The AC unit was also very old and didn't work great (I assume this is why they had the windows open).  They had tiny plastic cups for water and they shampoo they provided smelled so bad I didn't want to use it in my hair.
review.negativeRemarks: Update towels and sheets.

review.title: The necessary comfort
review.reviewText: I went to the hotel because of the E3. I didn't have any intention of spending my day using its facilities. The only facilities that I used was the pool and the breakfast. The breakfast is really good. You may satisfy yourself with what they offer on the buffet. The pool was the only place that in the first moment I thought would not be good. It has some leaves inside it and the floor surrounding it doesn't look like that was cleaned a long time ago. However, the trees are there to keep undesirable people looking what is happening in there. It's just trees. I got over it.

review.title: Nothing fancy, but gets the job done.
review.reviewText:
Like the title says, this place is nothing fancy, but it gets the job done. It's an older building, with a rickety elevator, and small rooms (I had a queen room). However, the room was clean, kept nice by the cleaning staff, and the hotel concierge were very friendly and welcoming. 

If you're looking for a comfortable, clean, no-frills place to stay, Monarch Hotel will work!

review.title: one night
review.reviewText: For one night, it's ok. The bathrooms aren't very big. There's no ventilation. The beds were comfortable. The location is ok. There were a lot of homeless across the street which made a less than pleasant view. The price was better than the rest of the places in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that it was close to the movie theater.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms could be updated

review.title: Not what I expected at all!
review.reviewText: The hotel looked very nice with nice views around the hotel on the pictures online however when I got there it looked nothing like the pictures. It was old, smelly, in a very bad area with a lot of homeless people around the area, and it was very outdated especially the elevator. Worst of all there is no free parking, it's almost an additional 50 dollars for their parking. I will never be staying again.

review.title: close to transportation
review.reviewText: Would pay more for quieter location, street noise very loud
review.negativeRemarks: toilet gurgles, did not completely flush, sink faucet loose. Elevator stopping very rough
review.locationRemarks: good for transportation

review.reviewText: This is not a hotel for families. The conditions were old, dirty and did not feel safe. This was one of the worst overall hotel stays I have ever had and feel disappointed that we paid as much as we did for so little. The only thing this hotel has going for them is every staff member was very polite and helpful. I would not recommend this to anyone.

review.title: Bad neighbors and old photos are not accurate.
review.reviewText: It's run down. Hotel is too old for the money. No parking and surrounded by bums.

review.title: Nice hotel near symphony hall on Van Ness
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for a UCSF graduation for a niece getting a nurse practitioner masters degree. The symphony hall was 0.6 mi. away. It was downhill all the way and we walked to the gratuation. It worked well for the Saturday activities also. The bed mattress was very comfortable, an important consideration for the three long and exhausting days.

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to downtown SF
review.reviewText: The Monarch is a bit dated and some of the interior is pretty old, but the beds and bedding were very clean and comfortable. Ensuite and walk in robe were a plus for us.  The staff were very helpful and friendly.  Downtown and Fisherman's Wharf are readily accessible from this hotel, but it is on the edge of the dodgy Tenderloin district.  The surrounding streets had plenty of homeless people hanging around.  They seemed harmless though and a wide spectrum of people pass through the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Fixtures (towel rack, bathroom and walk in robe doors) need replacing.
review.locationRemarks: Get a public transport passport from the downtown visitors centre.  This will get you everywhere.  Buses right outside hotel.

review.title: Good Enough
review.reviewText: It was fairly cheap and I only stayed there one night, so it did everything I needed it to.

review.title: a clean old hotel, price was right on Expedia
review.reviewText: bed was comfy, bathroom sink was cracked, neighbors across hall were noisy with slamming the door till after midnight.
review.negativeRemarks: parking valet took way too long, parking in public parking behind better
review.locationRemarks: location is fair, some homeless/shady characters nearby. Don't think I want to walk in certain directions from the hotel but we drove mostly.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: great place nice staff clean rooms, just no parking
review.negativeRemarks: there was no parking
review.locationRemarks: real easy access to area

review.title: Nice budget hotel variant
review.reviewText: We needed one-night-stay just to sleep and leave our bags and we were looking for budget variant but not hostel. Monarch hotel seemed perfect match. We are visitors and we had some issues with our credit cards and staff found solution usually they don't do. The conditions and overall comfort of the hotel is below medium, but hey, the have own bathroom, tv., bed and heater. What else do you need justfor spending your night sleeping. The case is additional price per day. And I guess there is no WiFi or its for additional price to.

review.title: Tough neighborhood, room OK.
review.reviewText: This is located in a tough, gritty part of town. Not far from nicer area and amenities, but you need to know that this is NOT in any of the postcard-ready spots of the City. Pay for a parking garage ($26-28) or hotel valet parking ($41) but DO NOT PARK OVERNIGHT ON THE STREET NEAR THE HOTEL, even where it's legal and free!!! We and several others learned the hard way, i.e., our car window was smashed along with other vehicles, which is a daily occurrence. That said, the hotel rooms and staff are fine for a night or two. They were installing new carpet during our stay, and our room was clean and relatively quiet. Walls are paper thin so you hear everything from every direction, though. Staff are very nice and accommodating. If you get a good price, it's the only reason to stay here, though. Easy to walk to Davies Hall, Civic Center, and basically anywhere from here, and, if you're not alone, you'll be fine.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff. Price was less than half of the next decent hotel for the night we stayed.
review.negativeRemarks:
It's in a tough neighborhood. Can't change that.
Hotel is old. Can't change that.
Staff do the best under the circumstances.
review.locationRemarks: Near Civic Center, and not far from anywhere else in the city.

review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, but walls are thin and on a busy street. The first floor room was pretty noisy.

review.title: OLD BUILDING & DAILY AROUND THE AREA
review.reviewText: WIFI BAD CONNECTION, I HAVE TO GOING DOWN AT LOBBY, TERRIBLE ELEVATOR

review.title: Fine hotel, not the greatest
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a pretty decent location, close to a lot of things within walking distance or a short car ride. There is a nice breakfast cafe across the street called Jebena that we ate at 3 times during our stay. We were able to check in earlier than expected which was nice. The elevator was a little scary as it was a little dated - we ended up taking the stairs five flights up to avoid it. As it is a "boutique" hotel, the room was not huge as expected. The lighting in the bathroom was terrible, and the towels/bedding provided were really harsh against the skin. Our major issue was that our sink kept on clogging up and not draining water since the moment we arrived. We talked to hotel staff about it three separate times and it wasn't fixed during our stay. Another element that would have been nice is the addition of a mini fridge or microwave. It would have been nice to keep some snack/breakfast items in the hotel during our stay rather than eating out all the time. There was also not the greatest smell in our room - a little musty - but we opened our windows during the day while we were out so it wasn't too bad. The lobby was bright and clean, and it was nice to have ice water/coffee readily available for us.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked its location, for the most part. There were a lot of ambulance sirens/honking at all hours of the day and night which wasn't ideal.
review.negativeRemarks: The attentiveness of staff - as stated before, we complained about our sink not draining three times and it was never resolved.
review.locationRemarks: Jebena cafe is awesome and right across the street. We went to a movie at an AMC theater a short walk away. Do not go to the diner down the street.

review.reviewText:
It was just ok hotel for stay, rooms not really clean and well furnished. I'll say it's just to spend a night not really enjoy the hotel.   
Staff was very slow
Very Old, needs upgrade, bad surrounded area, don't give you information like what you can do. Etc etc
Grimy. Decent location, but surrounded by bums and vagrants. I'd recommend looking elsewhere.
The place was good but it had some sort of smell that I don't like.
My stay was ok the hotel was nice clean and staff was nice, but the area was bad. Overall I would stay here again if I visited SF for a getaway weekend.

review.title: Not very impressed...
review.reviewText: I guess I had thought that a 3-star hotel would have been nicer than it turned out to be. I wasn't expecting the Hilton, but having someone answer the phone who spoke coherent English would have been nice when I was calling to see if it was alright for a late night check-in. The room itself was 'meh' at best. The door to the bathroom didn't close, the toilet paper roll fell off the hook every time you bumped it, and the shades didn't close, causing a bright stream of light to cascade in in the early morning. It wasn't a terrible place to stay, but it was definitely not comfortable or convenient. For $$$, I certainly would not recommend it to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: The foyer was nicely lit and looked well-kept. I appreciated that they allowed us to do a late night check-in.
review.negativeRemarks: Better carpet, better bedding, better bathtub, better bathroom altogether.
review.locationRemarks: It was a really sketchy location in downtown SF, lots of people out and about at 2 am drinking, partying, and probably some other interesting stuff...

review.title: The Monarch Hotel
review.reviewText: Was great because of it's access to Davies Hall and the San Francisco Symphony.  You know it's not the greatest neighborhood around the Civic Center but the Monarch was only 6 blocks away.  I will return again if I go to a Saturday night symphony again.

review.title: Disappointed for the money paid I expected more.
review.reviewText: The room was small and musty. It was a non smoking room but it smelled and the window screen had been removed and there was several cigarettes right out side the window. Also the chairs had stains on the cushions.

Great experience overall. Just wish the room and bathroom was a little more clean. Could have definitely done a little better. I would definitely come back though. Very central location for everything

review.title: Older but comfortable hotel across from drug rehab
review.reviewText: A number of homeless on the outside of the hotel which was across from a drug treatment center. Hotel itself was older but clean and the staff were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to move locations
review.locationRemarks: not a good location

review.title: Never stay there.
review.reviewText: As I walked up to the front desk to check in, someone who I later found out with the manager, was talking about how guest who are getting discounts will never get refunds or give backs of any sort. I wss apalled but not surprised.  The dingy space looked nothing like the photoshopped pictures, which werent great to start with. After few more minutes of the managers snooty attitude, i had to ask him if he really thought that he was managing a nice hotel. Needless to say, I got no room & no refund. 3 words to remember. Dirty. Dingy. Derelict.

The hotel was located at a convenient distance from Union Square where I was attending a conference.  Plenty of restaurants on the way. Fairly easy access to Bart.  The hotel was comfortable but could use air-conditioning on the upper floors (I was on the top floor).  Clean hotel and friendly personal willing to offer a little extra help made this hotel a great place to stay for a reasonable price.

review.title: Not the first option, but it is OK
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel for four nights. It will not be my first option in the future, but if I could not find a better option I will consider it again.
Everything was working, the room is clean as well, but you can easily notice that the building is very old. There is a weird smell and the paint is fading.

review.title: Bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: I applaud the effort but no go. I'm a business traveler so I'm used to staying at a Hyatt or Hilton. My reality may be tweaked a bit but at the core of it, I didn't feel safe there. I didn't even go out for a run because it didn't feel right. Bed wasn't bad, pillow sucked. Very loud outside; homeless yelling at each other.
It was OK for spending the night. Not a place I would want to hang out.

review.title: Fluffy bed & clean bathroom but in the Tenderloin
review.reviewText: Overall I thought the hotel was comfortable. Nice bed. Clean bathroom (grout clean). However, it is in an old building and water pressure was like an older house and sound traveled between rooms (guy on phone talking every evening about contract negotiations next door & bed upstairs).
review.locationRemarks: Walking to and from the hotel in all directions was an obstacle course of people suffering from various ailments and addictions.

review.title: The Monarch Hotel - San Francisco
review.reviewText: After The Soma Suites canceled my reservations only 12 hours prior to embarking to San Francisco, I was left feeling hopeless as I knew the city was an expensive place to find lodging, especially 12 hours before getting there! Fortunately, I came across The Monarch! Decently priced, despite a few reviews, I booked it as it was the only decently reviewed hotel that wasn't $400 per night. Upon arriving, I was skeptical because of the reviews, but it was a perfectly quaint room; it was all I and my significant other needed for a 3 day getaway. I read reviews about burglary by the staff, so we kept the Do Not Disturb sign on for the duration of our trip; no problems there. The only hassle we encountered was parking. It's $41 to valet by the hotel, $25 to park right next to it at the Auto Repair shop, if parking is available, $26 to park at AMC around the block, and $1-4 to park on the street, if parking is available AND on specified days. We did end up getting a parking ticket, the times are somewhat misleading. But other than the parking issue, it truly was a great experience. I am grateful for The Monarch, they were lovely people and the room was most comforting for 3 days.

review.title: Nice hotel close to where i want.
review.reviewText: Clean room but no refrigerator or microwave. Comfortable bed. Space wise us very small. No parking n costed $$41.00 to vallet n they take forever!

review.title: Good hotel on the edge of a suspect area...
review.reviewText:
The hotel is fine and is on the edge of a trendy and suspect area. Plenty of crazy homeless people around. That said they are spread out throughout the bay area. The number of homeless has increased every year I've been back which is sad.

Takes about 20 mins walk to Union Square and around an hour to the front so not too bad.  Plenty of stuff to look at on the way down.

The benefit of this hotel is it is cheap and well looked after.  For the money it CANNOT be beaten.  We've stayed in hotels in the much nicer areas for 3x the money and that are about the same condition, e.g. the Francis Drake!

Save your money, stay here and if worried about walking round get a cab.  Reception will get you one literally in around 90 seconds using the automated yellow cabs system.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, good staff and coffee 24hrs in reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Transportation to a trendy area but this would increase the price :-(
review.locationRemarks: A few trendy bars a few mins away, e.g. Bar Amsterdam, Whisky cellar etc.

review.title: Little old and rustic a great night life
review.reviewText: Still staff was very helpful and accommodating to what I needed

review.title: Dirty hotel
review.reviewText: It had nothing to do with the pictures, the hotel is awful. The area is dangerous because there are a lot of homeless people around, and it is noisy, dirty and smells.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Not great location, dangerous area for tourists

review.reviewText: Overall great experience.  Hotel is a bit antique but staff was great! Great location,   close to union square.
only there for one night. seeing friends in the city the area was a little funky lots of homeless folks that overall seemed harmless. would have rather been a few blocks down.
review.negativeRemarks: the bed was not great
review.locationRemarks: scary neighborhood felt like I was in a homeless camp. but walk two or more blocks and it was all cool

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located. Staff is very nice and helpful.

review.title: Crash Pad
review.reviewText: I spent a great night at the hotel. Some street noise but I slept through the night, and I'm a light sleeper. Not a luxury hotel by any stretch of the imagination. There's definitely history to the place which can be seen as charming or dispiriting depending on your spirit of adventure. Make sure you bring your own toiletries as they had shampoo and two bars of soap. The shampoo had an awful sweet scent. Hey, at least there were no bugs in the bed!!! I would stay there again if the need arises.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk was very friendly, if not understaffed. They engaged in friendly conversation and were clearly trying to do their absolute best!
review.negativeRemarks: Different shampoo.
review.locationRemarks: If you have a car, be aware that you will have to pay for parking, $25 or $26.

review.reviewText: reasonably cheap hotel, location is in a bit sketch neighborhood, wifi isnt very good and the hotel as such isnt in  good condition.

review.title: Good Value near Downtown
review.reviewText: Its a good hotel, the only problem I had was that my room smelled like it had just had the carpet shampooed.

review.title: Bad Area Lots of street Noise, the Tenderloin!!
review.reviewText: The lobby is nice looking, the hotel rooms are dated other than the small TV, lots of street noise and this is not in a good area. Vallet Parking was $46 and my car had a DING after they brought it back and there is no hotel parking

review.title: Average hotel in San Francisco close to Muni
review.reviewText: Rooms are basic with no frills.  Wanted to use the safe in the room, but there was no key.  When I asked the desk about a key they told me to take my things with me and tomorrow they would ask maintenance to make one if I still needed it because the last person in the room must have taken it.  On my 2nd night I was woke up at 3 am by hotel staff knocking on the door of the room next to me and then talking through the door about some order he placed for the occupant.

review.title: Worth the price, but needs maintenance
review.reviewText:
The good: the bed was comfortable, the coffee in the lobby each day was very good, and the front desk man was very nice. The lobby is nice and well maintained. There were sufficient electrical plugs to be able to charge everything. There's a Mel's Diner on the corner, so you can get something edible any time. I had a good price and that was the reason I chose it, and probably would again.

BUT -- the toilet didn't flush properly in the first room, so I had to change rooms. The free WiFi is functionally unavailable of the 5th floor, such a poor connection that I couldn't even get an external web page to load. On the first floor (where I was moved), the connection was strong enough to watch Netflix. Conclusion: WiFi repeaters needed, or stop advertising WiFi in the rooms. In the new room, plumbing leaked so there was the sound of running water all night. Switches in the bedside lights don't work well (both rooms). Message light was on in both rooms. but there were no messages (and no answer when calling for messages). I reported the message light on, but the front desk didn't (or couldn't) turn it off so it flashed all night. No hair dryer.
review.negativeRemarks: See review

review.reviewText: The hotel is in an extremely convenient area, but the room was unclean which was a deal breaker for me. The staff were absolutely lovely, but not the place to go if you want to spend any free time in your hotel relaxing.

review.title: fair price, alright condition
review.reviewText:
in a rougher part of San francisco, but the overall wasn't bad. 

squeaky floors, some floors smell like cigarettes, old and interesting building.

review.title: GREAT STAY!
review.reviewText:
Thanks to Romy at the front desk who made my stay!  Fantastic place for the value and location of this hotel.
Definitely recommend it!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff were wonderful and the location perfect.
review.locationRemarks: You're close to Union Square and not from the Wharf

review.title: Small improvements could go a long way
review.reviewText:
Hotel is OK, but there are other hotels in the same block that are a bit pricier and way better and cleaner.
If the hotel provided breakfast I guess I would recommend it for a quick, inexpensive stay in the city. 
If you can spend $10-20 USD a night choose another option.
review.negativeRemarks:
Clean the carpets!
Small breakfast could be provided in cafeteria area and would add value to your service offerings.

review.title: Old,Very clean hotel just what we expected.
review.reviewText: We would stay here again for sure. Not a place to stay with kids because of the location. The hotel was clean and staff was great. It's an old hotel just what we liked had a great lobby and staircase  was cool. Beds are pillow top super comfy. In the heart of San Fran for the price we couldn't be more pleased.

review.title: Comically bad, but ok once you adjust to it
review.reviewText:
First impression was that this place was going to put a stink on our trip and would make me miserable. Most of the time we spent awake in the room the first couple days I was researching other hotels so I could escape the place. In the end we were there for a week. 
There was a stink in the room that was intolerable when we arrived. It wasn't hard to find mold in the bathroom or around the windows. Everything was dated and run down in the room and around the hotel. The toilet ran constantly. There was a bare bulb to light the room because the ceiling fan wobbled so much that no shade would survive long. The shower didn't drain. Sometimes the hot water came out as cold as the cold water. The neighbourhood is right at the center of homelessness and there's nothing but boarded up buildings across the street. The whole place is dingy and mildly disgusting. 
But we fixed the drain ourselves and learned that the smell vanished if the bathroom door was closed. And the alternative places sounded equally dodgy or were a huge jump in price. We adapted. It was fine. 
The lobby staff seemed a little gun shy. From what we saw they are quite used to people taking one look and wanting their money back. Once they know you're not a drunken mess and that you're not going to yell at them, they're ok. 
Beds are comfortable enough. There is pretty frequent noise from fire trucks and random yelling on the street. 
We got used to it though. Central. Comical. Late night best to return in a cab.

review.title: Not the best
review.reviewText:
So we booked this hotel because we knew we weren't going to be spending much time in the hotel room and wanted something affordable so we could spend our money on activities. 

The hotel is in the "Tenderloin" area, which we learned is pretty much the ghetto. 
Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. The rooms looked NOTHING, I mean NOTHING like the pictures. It's an extremely old and run down building. The room was very small and the bathroom was super tiny with no ventilation so it was constant fogged mirrors. 
I wouldn't say the hotel was dirty, but it also wasn't clean. 

There is no parking so you have to valet your car(43.50 a night, including tax) and it takes them about 30 minutes to get your car back to you which was a bit irritating. 

The upside to the hotel was that it was perfectly central to everything! Easy to walk to all sorts of areas(I wouldn't recommend walking at night though) and there is a Mel's Diner right up the street. The beds were shockingly very very COMFORTABLE! The staff(there only seemed to be one person at a time running the hotel) was very nice and helpful.

review.title: Nice enough
review.reviewText: It's an old hotel with character. The front  desk was always polite and helpful. We basically stayed in the hotel to sleep and shower and we stayed out most of the day. The diner around the corner was very convenient too.

review.title: Good job!
review.reviewText: The place isn't the most up to date, but the staff was amazing and it was at a good price! The staff was constantly cleaning the lobby area. Overall, it was a good stay!

review.title: Nice old hotel with central location
review.reviewText:
This hotel may or may not be for you, depending on what sort of place you like to stay at.  I've stayed at  the Monarch twice for weekend sightseeing trips to San Francisco.  I would be very glad to stay there again.  However, if you  really want to enjoy luxury or tranquility, it's probably not for you.  

It's a nice older building of the old style.  I believe it has been operated at a hotel for nearly 100 years.  It is not fancy or ostentatious, but it is a quality building which is very nicely maintained.  As an illustration, it has a classic old elevator of a style one would not find in a newer building.  The neighborhood is more "authentic urban", as opposed to "touristy", but I felt safe walking around at night.

The hotel seems to be popular with college students.  Also, there is some sort of a community health center, ( I think for street people) across the street.  These folks seem to show up in the mornings for some reason.  But they do not seem dangerous or disruptive, although sadly one sees the occasional ambulance some mornings.
review.positiveRemarks: The location an excellent central base of operations if you have the time and inclination to explore the many interesting neighborhoods in the city.
review.locationRemarks: It is next to a nice little produce market which sells all sorts of fresh fruit, a nice coffee shop and there is an AMC multiplex around the corner.

review.title: Nothing fancy, but quite adequate.
review.reviewText: I've stayed here many times, and I've never been disappointed.  The price is fair, and the rooms are comfortable.  The old building is clean and well maintained.  It's on the edge of the Tenderloin, but it's in a busy enough area that it feels safe.

review.title: Extremely helpful hotel staff
review.reviewText: From the moment I checked in, the hotel staff was helpful and accommodating. They did all of this without me eliciting any information from them. They went out of their way to make my stay a pleasant one and that has been a rare experience for me with most reasonably priced hotel in a big city.
It's definitely a two star experience.  The rooms are shabby and need to be refurbished.  That said, the staff is friendly and helpful and everything was clean.

review.title: Hold on here ...!
review.reviewText: We were given a room next to the elevator. All night we were woken by the banging and clanking as unmoved up and down the shaft. The walls were so thin that late night guests were easily heard moving through the halls. The bed was too soft to support our thin frames. If you're even average weight, beware.  I wo t stay at the Monarch again.

review.title: Good Value and Location
review.reviewText: Nice, central area and I like the charm of the old building. The room was extremely clean and the bed comfortable. There are a lot of walkable areas around (Nob Hill, Union Square, a few parks) as well as some great restaurants. I'd stay here again. Only issue was that my room was right next to the building's old pipes with trespassing spikes all over them - big eyesore! Unless you get room 216 though, you should be good.

review.title: Cramped Hotel with Bare Minimum
review.reviewText: The hotel provides the bare minimum for your stay: a bed, bathroom, small closet and a couple dressers.  A pair of someone else's shoes were found underneath the bed, which made us believe that they don't do the best job cleaning it. The small bathroom provided little water pressure or heat, and the door had to be closed to fit near the sink or use the toilet. Would not come back to this hotel unless it was my last resort.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was helpful in directing us around the city and seemed cheerful.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaning of the rooms and plumbing upgrades.
review.locationRemarks: The area seemed to be in the ghetto with a lot of homeless people waiting just outside the hotel. You have to walk about a mile to get anywhere nice.

review.title: 275 for an ice box
review.reviewText: The room was freezing, the bathroom had drops of blood on the floor when we arrived, none of the outlets worked and neither did the wifi. There was a bathroom in the hallway right outside of our room and the hotel worker decided to get into an argument with somebody they let use the bathroom at 4 in the morning!!!! Never going back.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We came in to town to see Dragonsmoke at the Independent and then take pictures with World Series trophies at AT&T Park the next morning. The location of the Monarch Hotel suited our needs perfect. We had a awesome dinner at Tommys Joint which is right up the block on Geary. Had a great time at the Independent and came back to the hotel wasted. We walked back up the block at 3am to eat breakfast at Mel's 24 hour Diner. My friend actually hooked up with a girl around 5am by the hotel and brought her back to the room to party. We had a great weekend in SF. I recommend this hotel for anyone that likes to stay out late partying and doesn't want to drive around to go eat. The staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: the beds were ok. I suggest buying Tempurpedic mattresses for every room. Also parking is a little tough but we lucked out.
review.locationRemarks: Tommy's Joint, Mel's 24 hr Diner, Bob's Donuts 24 hrs, Grub Steak, Japan Town, the Fillmore, AMC movies, Mitchell Brothers

review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable room.  The hotel is about two blocks into a somewhat seedy neighborhood, but we had no issues other than seeing some colorful characters on the streets.

review.title: Plain budget hotel, super clean room
review.reviewText: Helpful staff. The room felt more like a motel than a hotel. Spartan and well-cleaned. However the lobby had a bad smell when I arrived (perhaps a plumbing issue?). Lots of bars and restaurants within short walking distance. This place is satisfactory for the very budget-minded.

I visited San Fransisco to attend a convention at the Moscone Center.  The hotel was walking distance to the center (it's not close, but it's walkable), it was affordable, and the hotel staff was exceptionally helpful and kind.  The rooms were simple, but clean and functional.  I would recommend this hotel and consider staying here in the future.

review.title: Threadbare and shabby
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. It's shabby and old and slightly damp but it's clean and the staff are nice enough. It's in a grim area full of homeless. I booked during Dreamforce so paid over 300 dollars a night. But then the decent hotels were jacked up to 400 or 500 a night. All the hotels go up to ridiculous costs at this time. On balance it was fine and clean even if the rooms are shabby but I wouldn't stay there with a family.

review.title: Bad part of town a lot of street noise
review.reviewText: Bad part of town, didn't want to walk around at night.  A lot of street noise, not used to that. We roomed right next to an old elevator, noisy all night.

review.title: The epitome of budget accommodations.
review.reviewText:
Arrived on the first night at 1am to be greeted by an extremely unprofessional front desk attendant.  It was a bit of an abrasive welcome.  He seemed to take on a bouncer role at the hotel and yelled at everyone who walked in the front door.  We managed to get checked in without any issue an the remainder of the hotel staff were very professional and helpful.  
Hotel room didn't have AC and was on a busy street so open windows wasn't an option.  We did get upgraded from a queen size bed to a king which was nice.
The hotel is across the street from a homeless shelter so if people loitering bothers you I don't recommend staying there.  All in all I got what I needed out of the hotel: a place to sleep that was near(ish) to some of the sights I wanted to see.  It is about a 30-35 minute walk from fishermans warf or about an hour from golden gate park.  Union square is about 10-15minutes away and there are plenty of great restaurants not too far from the hotel.  Please be aware this hotel is only a few blocks from a dodgier neighbourhood and it can be a bit creepy at night.  I was travelling with my boyfriend though and the two of us felt comfortable walking around.

review.title: Ok Hotel, close to downtown
review.reviewText: I would say OK, a bit expensive for the quality and location. A lot of bums and drug dealing too close to the hotel. Not a nice scene or comforting.

review.title: You get what you paid for
review.reviewText: It is a relatively cheap hotel for the San Francisco area.  You get what you paid for including: bad neighborhood (wife did not feel safe walking around), non-functioning TV, limited support from hotel staff, and a hard bed in an old building.  Not a place to stay on a Saturday night as the neighborhood and tenants are loud until 3 AM.

review.title: Parking - $38.00 ridiculous! Car takes a nap $38
review.reviewText: absolutely ridiculous that the hotel charges $38.00 per night for a vehicle to set on pavement in the dark without any supervision.  Next door the place charged $21.00 and was more convenient.  C'mon SF get a life!

review.title: Fine location. Excellent value. Comfortable room
review.reviewText:
Would stay again.  
Worried about the neighborhood but found great restaurants. Felt vey safe.   Great value if you need to be near union square or moscone.

review.title: Nice hotel, just be careful in the Tenderloin!
review.reviewText: I have no complaints about this clean, spare hotel, other than the fact that no breakfast is served, I guess - continental breakfast is never something I really enjoy, anyway. The rooms are clean, and the beds are comfy. The price is excellent, and you are within walking distance of all the sights, including City Hall, the Museum of Asian Art, and Chinatown. As long as you keep your wits about you while traveling through the Tenderloin, this hotel can't be beat!

review.title: Smelling room, ofkoming paint ceeling, bathroom ba
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice situated in downtown S.F it was easy to travel in the town.
The room was o.k except for smelling old carpet, pealing of paint ceeling, and the bathroom was to old, shouwer was not functioning and the toilet is to low for seniors. The room was verry noisie from other rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: New carpetting new painting new sanitation
review.locationRemarks: In ten minnits walk you are in the center of town can take the busses or the cabelcar.

review.title: Simple, central and clean
review.reviewText: The Monarch was better than I expected.  It offered basic comforts, was clean and was convenient to bus and muni connections.  Few places in central San Francisco are quiet and the street people in this area are a vocal lot.  The value proposition is good given that highly rated hotels have rates that equal or exceed those found in London or Manhattan.  By San Francisco standards, the Monarch is value.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are friendly and I found it to be clean.  WiFi effective from my room.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell of stale tobacco smoke was a turn-off.  I left my windows open when I was out of the room.
review.locationRemarks: One block off Van Ness and public transport.  Walkable to Hayes Valley restaurants and Market St.

review.title: Worn down hotel
review.reviewText:
almost everything was bad -- hot room without air-conditioner, worn-down facility, old and thin towels (and one with stains), dirty-looking carpet, hair on the beddings.

The only good things were helpful staff and fast wifi.  Surrounding neighborhood was not great, although walking distance to Union Square.

Very nice hotel. I loved that it was close to all the sights, the beach, shopping, and the bay. It liked the view from the hotel and the front door was locked at night for security. I got to see many sight. The room was confortable and the staff was very helpful. I traveled with family members and they really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. The hotel was in a very good location, which made everything very accessive, even places to eat and interainment. I enjoyed my stay
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the cleaneness and that it was so close to all the sight and activities to do. It was a great experience staying at this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: I think parking a was big concern and trouble for me.I could not park anywhere and parking was very expensive. The hotel could give a parking discout
review.locationRemarks: The location of things to do around the hotel was great. The hotel was in a good location.

review.title: Unique hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was relatively close to everything, but the neighborhood didn't seem very safe.  There is a homeless shelter and closed businesses across the street.  

I think I got one of the worst rooms in the hotel.  It was on the last room in the hallway on the first floor and the fire escape was right outside my window, where several times, the staff took breaks and were able to look right into the big window and look into my room.  It was, also, loud.  I would recommend booking a room on a higher floor.

It took 30 minutes to get my car from valet and it was expensive!  The hotel staff called for a cab one morning and it took almost 30 minutes for the cab to get there.

Nice boutique hotel with poor wireless service,  however, it was free.  No other imenities.

review.title: Within a mile of the start line at Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is within a mile of the start line at Union Square for the annual Nike Women's race.  It's inexpensive compared to other hotels in the area.  When I called for a reservation, I was told there was a parking garage under the hotel, for an additional $30 per day.  When I arrived, the parking lot was full and the hotel staff told me I could park a few blocks away at a public parking garage.  There are many homeless people in the area, so I was not prepared to walk a few blocks with my luggage.  When I got to my room, it was very small and there was no air conditioning unit or fan, so after one person takes a shower, the room gets humid.  The only option is to open a window, but it is very noisy outside.  The only option was to leave the window open or there would be no air circulation.
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing I liked about this hotel was that it is within a mile of Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Air circulation could be improved.  If there was at least a ceiling fan, it would help.  The room is dingy and stained.  The staff is not friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is within a mile.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Compared to other hotels at the same price . It's nice . Atleast it has a shower . A lot of them don't at that rate ! The staff are really nice . Only one of them was kinna not too helpful . But I don't like to mention who . Overall our experience was good and the location was close to everything . I recommend this hotel .

review.title: Nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Nice old charm hotel, very clean and comfortable for the money

review.title: Looks can be deceiving
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because it was downtown close to everything. We were driving towards the hotel and we  see all these homeless people along the street. We walk in to the hotel and we were attended right away. The reception area was okay, nice furnitures, spacious seating and waiting area. We get to the elevator and we get more disappointed, the elevators were not just old, can't fit 3 luggages and slow. We get to our room and we had to wait, they were still cleaning and fixing the beds. The room was so small for 2 queen beds, the bathroom is so small, it doesn't even have a counter to put your stuff, worse no vent. The beds were old, it squicks when you move. Top linens looks like they need washing. Had to call service to fix the TV, and wifi is terrible. The hotel in not sound proof, We hear next door nieghbors talking and moving around and of course, yelling from outside. The hotel does not have parking, yes they do have valet parking and when you need your car, just call reception and in half hour they will have your car at the front- that's a lie. We waited more than half hour .This hotel does not serve breakfast only coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms and the elevators
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is walking distance to everything.

review.title: Okay for an old hotel
review.reviewText: It's old, service is slow, can't even get a taxi . But room was clean and there are a lot of liquor store near by, so that's a plus.

review.title: The bright side of the Tenderlion
review.reviewText: My first time in the bay area, having gotten off the BART and walking through the Tenderlion (ghetto), I was in a pretty bad mode. The hotel staff was kind and friendly even though I radiated a negativity. Other staff seemed uninterested throughout my stay, especially the night shift. The hotel is close to Japan town and the buses on either side take you directly to Fisherman's Warf. We didn't spend too much time in this hotel and it was sufficient for our needs - next time I may pay the extra bit for a nicer hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean and bus stops going to tourist attractions were frequent and close.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless internet was weak in our room. We had to stand next to the door to get mediocre service.
review.locationRemarks: A breakfast diner is close by and a Thai food option. Japantown is a short hike away.

review.title: Valet
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay but the charge each day for to valet our at was ridiculous. I ended up paying $218.00 for four days of valet. I was greatly disappointed with this charge.

review.title: Old. Dirty. No parking lot
review.reviewText:
First of all. They dont have own parking lot. They charged 26 dollars per day to parking at other private parking lot. 
Second, their elevator is so old that people scared to use it.

review.title: Convenient to Union Square/Public Transportation
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable room.  Hospitable front desk staff.  Only negative was mildew smell in closet.
review.negativeRemarks: TV channel listing, get rid of mildew smell in closet.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Union Square and Powell/Market area public transportation.  Enjoyed eating at several local diners in area.  Would recommend Pinecrest

review.title: OK, good location
review.reviewText:
It's an old hotel; clean; service is OK; nice staff and good located: near Union Square, Financial District, Nob Hill; the only thing is area full of homeless people and 'crazy' things going on at nights, but door to the hotel are closed at nights, so it seems to be safe. 
Simple as just to sleep, some coffee is always in the lobby - not the greatest quality though and from paper cups; not the best condition of complementary soaps and shampoo, so better to take some before staying. 
In general: OK.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square (transport point - can be reached by Bart train directly from the airport and then it's like 15 min walk to the hotel), Civic Center

review.reviewText: Worst room so far! Staff was nice. Highest price with a small rundown room. TV didn't work. Would not advise staying there!

For one of the most affordable hotels I could find in SF within proximity of the ball park this hotel was a good find.  I wanted to have our own bathroom and a clean and comfortable bed.  This hotel served this purpose!

review.title: Bad neighborhood, drug related incidents.
review.reviewText: Police stormed room across from me, likely drug incident. Rough neighborhood and not very safe, bad hotel for children.

review.title: good and economical
review.reviewText: The hotel was a good buy, and the location was good also.  Overall, the hotel was nice, except for the elevator which needs a new interior to improve the image of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator interior.

review.title: Very nice place - close to everything
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful since we had a large group - for checking in and going in and out .

review.title: Horrible!!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel clerk "upgraded" our room to what we jad already booked, put us in the smallest room up the stairs instead of giving us  a room that is acessible with an elevator with our stroller. THE VIEW was the worst part - trash and homeless peoples' belongings, not to mention the noise all night... Horrific, dangerous area!! $43 for parking?!?! NEVER AGAIN!!!

review.title: excellent for the PRICE
review.reviewText: WE used for sleeping only in town location==not bad
review.negativeRemarks: improve entrance
review.locationRemarks: walk to restaurants==median priced near enough to both fisherman's wharf and chinatown

review.title: Nice hotel close enough to everything.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for the weekend. Shower was a little weak. Location was very convenient. Room was comfortable. Bed was amazing!

review.title: Nice hotel in the city near civic center
review.reviewText: My experience was an overall good one. The beds were fantastic, the room was well ventalated, nice tv. However, there wasnt a fridge or microwave which would have been nice.

review.title: Very reasonable hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel but very well maintained--meticulously clean and very quite. It is very close to the Civic Centre, Asian Museum, opera house, and Davies Symphony Hall. It is half a block from the Van Ness traffic and public transportation corridor. I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Shady location. Room was OK OK
review.reviewText: Bad experience as such. Location was very shady. Staff was very indifferent . take this as last option.

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: Not a terrible hotel, but you will get what you pay for. I'm pretty sure we showed up during a software upgrade to their system because they were having problems with checking people in. We did arrive slightly before 4pm, but without even looking at the computer screen we were told we will not have any rooms until your check-in time (4pm or later). Once we checked in, we entered a room that we though someone was still occupying. The beds were not made and looked freshly slept in, towels scattered throughout the room and the trash was full. We quickly left and waited at the front desk for approximately 15 - 20 minutes (meanwhile the owner or owners son was sitting just a few feet from us talking to a sales guy about their software). Finally after informing the front desk clerk about being checked into a "dirty" room, he took our keys and said, "Oh, the system doesn't know which rooms are clean and which are dirty. That's the problem when you check "all clean" after 4pm." I have to say, he did personally walk up to the room with us to ensure the room was clean and apologized. Like I said, not a horrible experience, but definitely no diamond in the rough!
review.negativeRemarks: Update facilities, decor, plumbing & fixtures. Also, Continetal Breakfast would add to the appeal
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and pharmacies near by

review.title: Nothing important
review.reviewText: Normally dome troubles with shower but the personnel was very fine
review.locationRemarks: Good location and Cinemas near

review.reviewText: The location is convenient but the hotel is ok.The room was small.

review.title: Overpriced historic downtown
review.reviewText: Historic downtown building made touring the area very convenient, bus stop right out the front door and Union Square and Chinatown within walking distance. However, for the price the place was not nearly as clean as I expected....layers of dust on the wood trim and stains on the curtains. The beds were clean and comfortable despite cheap sheets but the towels were thin and scratchy. Breakfast was only for the tour groups and manager was very rude about that fact. They charge for everything! Parking was $38 per day and even the use of the room safe was an additional fee. Bathroom was very small and did not have a hair dryer, but closet was huge. Overall it was overpriced, at $209 per night I expect cleanliness! It would be a decent $85 a night place, maybe even as high as $120 for the location factor only.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square only 9 blocks east, Chinatown only 4 blocks from that, cable car from there to Fisherman's Warf, bike rentals to Golden Gate bridge.

review.title: It's dumpy
review.reviewText: There were NO rooms available in sf the weekend we were going so this was all we could find. The room was old but clean. Our room looked right into next door tenement building so you could not open the windows. Our room was overall dumpy but our friend's room was slightly better. It's in the tenderloin so expect bums but really there are bums everywhere in San Francisco. It's about 8 blocks from union square and easily walkable during the daytime, a bit more sketchy at night. Overall, it was ok and frankly, typical of sf in general- dirty, run down and full of homeless people.

review.title: Reasonable Hotel
review.reviewText:
Though there are no aircon, just a ceiling fan but is ok but at least there should be a kettle for boiling water.
And simple tooth brush and shaver should be given daily
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonable clean and comfortable, counter staff are friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Include daily bread fast as package

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: just a little off the tourist areas but cheap and clean.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Overall good. Decent place to just sleep. Don't expect resort like accommodations. In a central location. Parking was very expensive. Area was decent but not the greatest. Overall an affordable place to stay while you explore the city. Not great not horrible. One thing I didn't like was I briefly got locked out at night when the attendant was on his break and decided to lock the front door. When confronted he was extremely unappologetic

review.title: Easy access to Moscone Center on a budget
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel mainly because of its proximity to Moscone Center for the event I was attending. I also had a tight budget, which meant that I really didn't expect too much other than cleanliness and helpful hotel staff. Monarch hotel scored well on both fronts.

Union Square and the shopping district around Union Square are easy to access as well.

Overall I recommend this for business travel on a budget.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Union Square & Moscone Center, clean, functional
review.negativeRemarks: The double room was rather small - wouldn't have minded a larger room :)

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Clean and neat room. Nice and kind staffs. close to Union square

review.title: It was a place to rest and nothing more.
review.reviewText: Had a great experience with the staff and facilities worked well.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near AT&T park, which we gladly walked to.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Not the best location, but is within walking distance to Union Square and the Civic Center

review.title: all great no parking
review.reviewText: all went great, i had to pay $25.00 per night on parking
review.negativeRemarks: get parking
review.locationRemarks: all attractions

review.title: Would not like to recommend
review.reviewText: You can everything in neighboring rooms and smells bad.

review.title: This place is terrible! Don't even think about it!
review.reviewText: This place is a joke! The odor throughout the bulding and each room was foul, foul, foul. It was filthy. The room didn't even have the basic microwave, fridge, or coffee pot. Nothing has been updated in probably 40 years, but it's not quaint or pretty. It's just nasty. You will pay $40 a day in "valet" parking, because there is no where else to park.

review.title: nice hotel close to fishermans wharf, union square
review.reviewText: unforgettable experience this hotel is close to fishermans wharf, establishments (e.g. restaurants), union square, china town, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very central, staff friendly and helpful. Building a bit tired but very good value.
review.negativeRemarks: Building looks a bit tired but clean and has everything that one might need.
review.locationRemarks: Central to all the cable cars, can walk everywhere, very good typical dinner round in the corner with Van Ness.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Good place for someone not trying to break the bank. Nice older hotel with everything you need for comfortable nights rest. Close to market and Chinatown. Park at next door auto garage for 25 dollars a night.

review.title: Monarch Hotel review
review.reviewText: For what you're charged, not worth it. I realize staying anywhere in the city will be pricey, but the price tag that comes along with this hotel is roughly $60 too high. Watch out for being charged extra for the room/parking. My friend and I were charged $98 for parking two cars, okay, but then I saw my credit card was charged $198. I had to call the hotel, they told me to contact my bank. Not something I want to take care of on a Monday work day...
review.positiveRemarks: Close to a lot of good bars, relatively close to AT&T Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms, excess charges for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to a lot of good bars, relatively close to AT&T Park.

review.title: Stay in an old hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice and has history but it's very old and they don't do much to make you comfortable

review.title: Disgusted
review.reviewText: I ordered this hotel for $120 on expedia. They charged me a $100 cleaning fee in order for me to check in which totaled $220 for this dirty hotel. The room appeared decent, but we found a crack-pipe and cigarettes in the room. They must've barely cleaned the room before we checked in. We are disgusted by this hotel. We attempted to speak to the manager twice and no one has called back even though they said they would. Even though it's advertised at a low price, look somewhere else without hidden fees, and that actually cleans the room.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness.

review.title: Old and smelly
review.reviewText: Hotel was old and smell weird, need major makeover. Would pay a little more $ for a better hotel.

review.title: No heat the first night. Blech. Cold!
review.reviewText:
Cigarette smoke seeped in my room at night (room 315).
COLD first night.
Cleaning service good tho, front desk was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: improve facilities, fix broken heater
review.locationRemarks: geary street, near market st

review.title: Just say NO
review.reviewText: Bad neighborhood, old hotel. Would not recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Ban neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: Bad, just plain bad.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for the price. It is in a sorta seedy neighborhood, but it's just weird, not dangerous. Hotel staff was very accommodating and they are really trying. If you are staying in the city for a conference like Dreamforce and need an affordable room, Monarch is a good bet.

review.title: No Parking, Bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: Big Let Down! I had to park 4 blocks away in a city garage the price of which negated any savings offered by the Monarch. Thought since I can't access my car I'd walk around and see a few things. That was a bad idea, this is absolutely not a family neighborhood due to drug and alcohol use!!!

I was given a room that was adjacent to the elevator. The walls were shaking every time someone used it, making my first night absolutely terrible. Fortunately, they gave me another room the next day, but with a smaller bed.

What hotel would allow such rooms to be given to customers? I guess they are simply looking for bad reviews.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing, instructions for heating the room.
review.locationRemarks: Good location if you are attending an event nearby.

review.title: Only 1 night ..
review.reviewText: The room was very tight. no A/c but the weather made it comfortable. No counter space in the bathroom. We had to ask the front desk firmly to please make more coffee. Ammenities were out dated.. elevator was 1st generation 1920.. stairs were narrow. Parking was in a shady auto repair store around the corner. Buidling smelled like a smoke shop from 1900's. the room window was facing the apartment atrium and we were watching people do dishes, and in their living area.
review.positiveRemarks: location was great. central to Union Square and China Town..

review.title: It is not worth the price you pay.
review.negativeRemarks: This is a very old and out of date hotel. It should be renovated drastically.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in Downtown San Francisco. There is a good persian restaurant walking distance away from the Hotel.

review.title: Stayed Several Times
review.reviewText: I stayed here several times. It is what it is. A slightly cheaper priced hotel in San Francisco. You will hear the street noise but I'm ok with that. Others might not be able to sleep. The staff can be slightly rude but they can also be very nice. Clean for the most part. No fridge and no microwave. If you want to park overnight, go to the car service station next door for the cheapest price. For late night eats, Tommy's Joynt, Mel's Drive In, and a couple of Pizza by the Slice places all within walking distance. If you're there just for a night or two this place is very o.k. to stay. I will stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: Working heater

review.reviewText:
Hotel is within walking distance to union square, Chinatown, & bus stops to get around town in case you don't have a car. We took public buses everywhere, from Golden Gate Bridge bus dropped us off a block away from hotel. Lots of restaurants around.
Hotel itself is old, but clean. Room had a cheap decor & look outdated but it was clean. if you are a germophob like my daughter you bring your own fitted sheet & pillow cases.
Bathroom in room so no sharing bathrooms with strangers was a plus!
Front desk staff was friendly & helpful. But I forgot to bring toothpaste & the front desk did not have any...so I didn't brush for one night..oh well. Bring your own toothpaste.
No frills, just the basics. Coffee in lobby was terrible but many coffee shops around.
And of course you have homeless people in the area but it is what it is. They are harmless.
Lastly, I had no cell phone reception in room & had to go outside room to call. But I had free wifi in room.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to union square, Chinatown, restaurants Bathroom in room so no sharing bathroom Wifi in room
review.negativeRemarks: Room sheets, coffee in lobby. I had no cell phone reception in room, had to go outside to make phone calls.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Union square & Chinatown, take a bus to fishermans wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, & anywhere your hearts desires.

review.title: Close to Cathedral
review.reviewText: Located on Geary just off very busy Van Ness. Nice older hotel. We very much liked it.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.positiveRemarks: A clean room makes the guest to feel well.
review.negativeRemarks: The room heating.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, near the Asian Museum, good restaurants and walkable to Union Square.

review.reviewText: The bedspread smelled terribly of body oder and the walls were super thin. Stayed there out of necessity.

review.title: OK, but rather expensive
review.reviewText: Room was fine, but you usually pay 2 to 4 times less for that.

review.title: Surprised by this hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed at a 4 a star hotel in downtown sf. So I was worried about staying at the monarch. When we got there it was old. Parking confused me at first. But overall I enjoyed staying here over a 4 star hotel cause it felt more like San Francisco and had an old school feel. Would stay here again. Staff was friendly as well!

review.title: Very depressing hotel. Dirty carpet in halls.
review.reviewText: Seedy location, not a good neighborhood. Noisy street life.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace dirty, old carpet throughout.
review.locationRemarks: Seedy neighborhood.

review.title: A noisy experience
review.reviewText: Squeaky beds and floors, no soundproofing, loud/drunk people shouting in the corridors at night. There was a very active couple just above us, it was really hard to sleep because of the squeak squeak squeak noise all night long! The elevator noise is terrible in rooms next to elevator shaft, so even if your neighbors are quiet, it's still terribly noisy!
review.negativeRemarks: floor soundproofing, beds

review.title: Well located for our needs (near the opera house).
review.reviewText: The hotel is an old, shabby, but clean hotel. Everyone working there was very nice - could not have been nicer or friendlier, in fact. They seem to get European tour groups - 24 rooms of French-speakers arrived while we were there. The amenities were minimal - but because it was clean and friendly, it met our needs. The hairdryer in my room was missing so they quickly got me a brand new one. No fuss; no muss; no problem.
review.positiveRemarks: It's clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs to be rehabbed - they've done some work in the rooms - good beds, for example - but the bathrooms are a little beat-up.
review.locationRemarks: It's walkable to the Opera House & Symphony Hall - Union Square in less than 15 minutes. Good transportation on Van Ness @ the corner.

review.title: Motel. Not a hotel.
review.reviewText: Its a decent place to stay for a few days. Expect a motel like ambience. For the amount I paid, think it is overpriced even for downtown SF. I wouldn't mind staying here if there are no other options for the price range.

review.title: Hotel to stay in if you're on a budget
review.reviewText:
Hotel building was old, but everything was functioning fine. One lift in the building that served all 6 floors but it was enough, you wouldn't have to wait long for it. Carpark right beside the hotel goes for $20 a night to the asian lady manning the 'store' right beside the carpark space. I believe the hotel parking is slightly more expensive. My room and toilet was clean and overall the staying experience inside the Hotel was pleasant.

Although the Hotel is on Geary street, it can be quite a walk to union square (about 8 blocks).
review.locationRemarks: 8 Blocks to Union Square

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Quite a good budget hotel, but lacks a fridge in each room & perhaps a small breakfast each day
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Not to bad a location for the price

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Noisy, smelly, building is not maintained. Should have coffee and tea making facility in rooms.i could not drink tea or hot water as hot water provided in the foyer tasted coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Not very good

review.title: Not as expected
review.reviewText: Older than expected. Elevator very scary. Not very updated.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Mel's Diner was enjoyable

review.title: Antique elevator!!
review.reviewText: I have never seen an elevator like this one. Antique, scary, door opened forward like a door to your house. No extras at all--no breakfast, no ice, no machine to buy a coke, and couldn't even find a remote to the tv in five days. Simply just a place to lay your head. The location was way too far from union square, and a homeless shelter across the street which presented no problem. One of the office staff wasn't really very helpful, but the others were. I would recommend a hotel closer in to union square. Overall, I would get a different hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a breakfast, remote to tv, ice, coke machines, make it smell better
review.locationRemarks: Location was not good at all, no shopping places for many blocks!

review.title: For the price OK
review.reviewText: Rm sm,but clean.Good for single travler. I have been to this hotel 3x before.Close to Union Sq.Plenty of resturants. About 10-15 block walk from Powell St Bart station.
review.locationRemarks: 5-7 blocks Union sq,close to Cable Cars. Theaters near by both drama,and AMC around the corner on Van Ness.

review.title: Pretty good price for an older hotel
review.reviewText:
The Monarch was a good price and I was able to walk to a lot of things (Union Square shopping district, Chinatown) from there. It's a very old building and the neighborhood feels a little rough but not dangerous. The staff was very friendly and professional.

I was only surprised at how old the building was. Online, you only see pictures of the rooms and you can't really tell until you get there. The view from my room was of the apartment building and disgusting alley next to me. But for what I paid, it was fine. They took care of all my needs.

I would mention the homeless people in the area, but that's really all over downtown SF. Not just where the Monarch is. None of them bothered me either, but if you're new to the city, it may catch you off guard.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that I could walk to a lot of things in downtown area. I bought a 3 day bus pass that I didn't use because the weather was so nice.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the carpet and elevator should be replaced. The elevator looked so old, I kept to the stairs.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to Union Square or Chinatown on a day with good weather. There's plenty to eat in the area too.

review.title: Fine Room
review.reviewText:
The room was clean and satisfactory. Not huge and yes, the elevator was a little scary. The location was central and we walked/rode the bus everywhere.

The hotel staff had no manners though. When checking in the man was on his cell phone and took my credit card and told me our room number. We figured the rest out for ourselves. We did have a car and parked in the lot next door with the nice Asian lady. We paid her $20 a night in cash. We stayed 2 nights. The next day there was a $25 charge on my credit card. The front desk said it was the parking charge. I said I had already paid that next door. They argued with me and finally took the charge off my card.

There is no air conditioning, which would have been fine but we had the windows open and a car alarm went off from 1 am to 10am when the car was towed.

The room was clean though and the bathroom small but clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs manners
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things to do within walking distance!

review.title: Quiet, and close to good food
review.reviewText:
I was worried about noise, as we were on Geary very close to Van Ness. But we could not hear any street noise. We liked being within walking distance of many restaurants, and the Opera House.

A fine, old hotel with well-preserved entry.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, close to restaurants, clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The view from our window was the inner courtyard. It was really decrepit, with junk hanging out windows of unused rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants on the corner were Mel's Famous Drive-Inn, and Tommy's Joynt, San Francisco landmarks and good food.

review.title: It is what it is!
review.reviewText: It provided what we needed: a bed and warm shelter. Wall are thin, and it's a little stinky. Would I recommend this hotel? Probably NOT. Especially not at the high rate we paid.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much, except for central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities. Upgraded. Lower prices. More!
review.locationRemarks: Location is ideal, but that's about all it has going for it at the moment.

review.title: Monarch Hotel review.
review.reviewText: Nice old hotel. Good location. Friendly family market right across the street

review.title: Fare
review.reviewText: It's ok. But the staff is not so helpful. And it's too noisy for a good sleep. Water is not hot enough for shower, while for drinking, you need to go to lobby every time.

review.title: Nice local cheap motel.
review.reviewText: It's good enough for the budget traveler. Don't expect a Hyatt. It's a clean room, and bed.

review.title: touring couple
review.reviewText: While reasonably well situated to tourist activities in Central San Francisco we found the location a bit noisy< Garage down below and car park used for late nite Activities> Also the Welcome from the guy on reception the day we checked in was any thing but welcoming> He appeared a very sullen type of person not suitable for the task<, However thank goodness we did not have to suffer his attentions after that first nite and the Staff that were on duty after this period were very helpful and happy people <

review.title: Nice and clean!
review.reviewText: There was no explanation about a $25.00 charge to my credit card after the fact.

review.title: Good Place, Good Price
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel that is well maintained - it has an old feel to it (i.e., it had some architectural style) with some modern amenities (i.e., cable TV and internet access) and it was comfortable and quiet. It was fairly convenient to the city (about eight blocks to Union Square) and the staff was extremely pleasant and accommodating. I felt it was a good value.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quiet, comfortable, and the staff was helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless didn't quite reach my 4th floor room, but worked fine in the lobby area (which was a comfortable work space.)
review.locationRemarks: The location was convenient for me; about eight blocks from Union Square and the BART. It was quiet.

review.title: On a budget and flexible? This is your place!
review.reviewText: I really like this place for the money. Friendly staff, clean room, fun bars and places to eat nearby and a fairly easy walk to the heart of downtown SF--Union Square. The rooms are small (like many of the old hotels downtown), you are going to encounter some street people, and this is not the place if you require a firm mattress. However, none of those are dealbreakers for me and I would stay here again to keep the cost down and still be right in the middle of the action. I would even bring my kids, but I would say it is better suited for adults.

review.title: Monarch Hotel should be called Monarch Motel
review.reviewText: While using my restroom I could hear people in the next guest-room using their restroom. Plainly I could hear the gentlemen urinating, showering, running water in his sink & talking. If it weren't for them speaking another language I could plainly say what in fact they were talking about rather I was in the bathroom or not. My father and I had a double bedroom & we could both feel the bed-spring in our indiv. mattresses. The corner on which the hotel sits is polluted with urine. There is a homeless shelter across the street and the tenants are always laying around the building on the concrete. The elevator in very old and only carries 5 passengers at a time. The online pictures show a dining area but its always closed & closed off. The lobby was decent and did offer suitable coffee and tea. There is no in-room service by the hotel. If I weren't in SF, CA due to the most sad passing of my beloved brother I would have checked out the exact same day. They charge $21.00 a day to park your car in an area they will not disclose and which was unavailable upon our arrival. They tried to talk us into parking at the mechanic shop next door for the same price. A car accident occur the third day we were there; someone ran into the light pole and 4 cars were shattered to pieces b/c the pole fell on them. When checking out the clerk had to be asked twice for a receipt which I was Not leaving w/o showing zero balance owed. I appreciate nostalgia but this place is no tourist attraction.
review.negativeRemarks: Out dated. Needs renovation. Homeless shelter X the st, bums on opposite corner living on sidewalk. Smells of urine.
review.locationRemarks: Main cross street is Van Ness which has the coffee houses, restaurants and such. 7 blocks down in opposite direction is the Square w/Saks Fifth etc

review.title: Very good budget hotel
review.reviewText:
This is an older hotel but is also well kept and maintained.
The location is central to everything from museums and landmarks to business conventions.

Staff help is generally very helpful during the day, but is a bit more challenging after hours. Both my TV and my phone stopped working properly midway through my week long stay. I reported these issues to the night staff, and they just said to "try this and try that...". The next morning with a different staff, I mentioned the same issue and they immediately addressed the issues and fixed my TV and telephone within 30 minutes.

The surrounding neighborhood is next to the downtrodden Tenderloin district. The good news is that it's not difficult to step around it if you want to go sightseeing by foot, and the transit systems are well within reach.
review.positiveRemarks: Bus line 38 across the street stops next to the Pacific Ocean.
review.negativeRemarks: Homeless people seems to be everywhere downtown
review.locationRemarks: Central to all "Tourist Traps".

review.title: Only positive - in downtown
review.reviewText: Terrible place with horrendous parking options. Room is alright, not very clean. One Staff was helpful, but the other who looked like the head was very rude. Will stay away from this one.

review.title: Geary street is really sketchy. Don't recommend it
review.reviewText: No AC, just a noisy fan. Elevator was broken when we were there. Internet worked for one night out of our entire stay. Could smell cigarette smoke from another room in our non-smoking room. Could hear all the squeaks and creaks at night when we were trying to sleep in our boiling hot room. Mattress was very uncomfortable. Blanket had stains on them. The floor in our room was uneven under the carpet. Super small bathtub/shower, I felt claustrophobic. No ice machine, no vending machine, nothing in the hotel. Located on a sketchy, very noisy street. This hotel wasn't even cheap.

review.title: Entirely functional and pleasant.
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised to find this hotel to be clean, functional, and pleasant at a reasonable price (for SF). Front desk staff maybe not as friendly as a lot of places, but not a problem. They quickly replaced a burned out light bulb that I reported, so seemed to be trying. Nothing fancy, but the queen bed was good, bathroom clean and adequate, good shower, writing desk, nice furniture in very good condition, windows opened and fine with just overhead fan and no air conditioning. No computer in lobby but internet cafes a few blocks north on Polk. Mel's Drive In 3/4 block away is good. Parking next door is ok but don't expect to get in and out easily even if it is allowed unless you park on the edge of the lot; they pack in the cars. There are narrow stairs (this is an old place), in addition to the elevator. Lobby is functional and quaint. I couldn't find anything to complain about and would gladly return.
review.negativeRemarks: Friendliness of staff.
review.locationRemarks: Chinese consulate only a few blocks down Geary. Mel's Drive in 3/4 block. Internet cafes a few blocks north on Polk. Library not too far.

review.title: Nice hotel and convenient to the Unique Square
review.reviewText: I have a good experience in the hotel, except the noisy midnight over door.

review.title: Monarch
review.reviewText: The bed and room was okay, but the bathroom door was broken and would not stay shut. We asked to upgrade to a king size bed and the guy at the desk sort of just brushed it off instead of giving me a complete answer. There was enough space in the room, but the area around the hotel is a little sketchy at night.
review.negativeRemarks: No parking lot

review.title: Good hotel to rest your head but not to hang in
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel and you get what you pay for. It definitely meets your needs if you just need a simple place to stay with a good mattress and clean linens and bathroom. Upon entering the lovely architecture of the Monarch, you'll notice a smell that is the same as a thrift store and the outside of a dive bar, due to the age of the building and smoking being allowed at some point in it's past. The carpet, furniture and paint are all in fairly good condition. The stairways are steep and narrow. The room was comfortable and has a heater, but the drapes didn't close all of the way.
