I alerted the front desk staff to this upon our departure, so we'll see if it is addressed next time. The owner or manager was surly, but the front desk girl was pleasant. Overall, a great place for the price and location.
review.negativeRemarks: narrow/steep stairs and gapping curtains
review.locationRemarks: 1/2 mile from Union Square on Geary. Perfectly located

review.title: Hotel stinks
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and needs to be renovated. Room had a bad odor. Was awakened by people screaming on the street both nights.
review.positiveRemarks: I found nothing good about the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: old and stinky
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Eh not bad
review.reviewText: Just used it to sleep. Staff was not very friendly. Bed was horribly uncomfortable though clean. Defenitly knew that i wasnt coming back. Im not picky about my rooms and have stayed in some small places but I think this was the least satisfying. Especially for 107 a night which is rediculous for the quality. But it was my first time in San Fransisco so it could've been me not being familiar with the area which was not bad.
review.negativeRemarks: comfort of the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Really good pizza less than a block away.

review.title: Very scary neighborhood!
review.reviewText: For the price, the hotel was about what I expected. It's old, but the room was clean. The elevator was kinda scary. However, the worst part of my experience was the neighborhood --- VERY frightening! Most of the buildings across the street are vacant and boarded up. Many street people hang around the area. Do not walk around this neighborhood after dark!
review.negativeRemarks: The neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: Not far to walk to Market St. shopping, theaters, the opera, and symphony hall.

review.title: Comfy place
review.reviewText: I was in SF for 5 days, stayed at the Monarch Hotel. I have not complains at all, the service and room were good. The area isn't the best, but that didn't really bother me at all.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: comfortable room for resting after a long day of sightseeing, very nice staff

review.title: Good central location, clean rooms
review.reviewText: Good central location, clean rooms, friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Clean, location is good, cheap
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean, location is very attractive, price is not expensive...
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel have not refrigerator. No berakfast...
review.locationRemarks: Location is good, very attractive place

review.title: OK but worn
review.reviewText: Worn but OK for the price and convenient location.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: The hotel is old, but clean & well maintained. For the price, it's a very good value.

review.title: Accommodation during a conference.
review.reviewText: The experience was quite pleasant and convenient. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: The hotel was ok for a single man
review.reviewText:
My first 2 nights were difficult, I was supposed to be in the non-smoker area however the smell of smoking was all over the place...

I went alone, and after being there I would not go back with my wife or a friend...
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom, too small
review.locationRemarks: Great location, near movie theaters, food stores, restaurants...

review.title: Dated soulless
review.reviewText: Dated and soulless. Rooms tended to smell damp/sour even after cleaners had been. Good location only 10 mins walk to central square. Noisy during night due to traffic. Staff not very friendly (different person every day).
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and staff

review.title: good for young people
review.reviewText:
unfortunately no breakfast (except coffee and tea)
the furniture is not new
but for a 2 star hotel its really clean, comfortable and nice, thats all you can expect for this cheap price.
very good for young people, who cant efford much money for a room but still want to have something clean.
review.negativeRemarks: no breakfast
review.locationRemarks: not the nicest area but very near to downtown and 15 minutes walk to union square

review.title: Great value for the area
review.reviewText: Not nearly as bad as some of the reviews on this site would lead you to believe. Prices in San Francisco are very expensive, and the value you receive for this hotel's price is worth it. It's a historic building and certainly no worse than any hostel I've stayed in. There IS heat, it's just a bit antiquated and you have to turn it all the way up to get it to work.

review.title: typical "ok" hotel
review.reviewText:
this is one of the typical "ok" hotels, nothing fancy, but cozy and clean. I stayed two nights. the room for the first night is facing the street, it's a little bit noisy even during the mid night. I switched to another room on the other side which is pretty quiet.

there is a convenience store across the street, and a thai restaurant one block away.

the only complaint is that i left my electronic tooth brush in the first room, and when i came back asking the receptionist, it's just gone. they told me no one reported to find it.

review.title: A Homey Hotel
review.reviewText:
I picked this hotel for its location and its price and was not disappointed. The location, on the edge of the Tenderloin, is probably not for everyone, but I wanted something near the War Memorial Opera House and this was it (also with Mel's Diner in the same bock.) The hotel is old-style, but the lobby looks well kept-up, with easy chairs and free coffee. The staff was tremendously helpful, especially when I had to stay for three more nights because Hurricane Sandy would not allow me to return to New York. Its only problem (that of most other San Francisco hotels) was lack of heat.

I would stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of heat
review.locationRemarks: Seedy neighborhood, but a block from Van Ness, near the Civic Center.

review.title: O.K.
review.reviewText: Mel's Diner just down the street was good for breakfast

review.title: SFO on the cheap!
review.reviewText:
If you are looking for a bargain in San Francisco, look no further. It's an old hotel but it is pretty well kept, clean, and the lobby is charming.

My sole complaint is noise. My stay in SFO was unseasonably hot and I had to sleep with my windows open due to the lack of A/C. No shock there, few hotels in SFO have Air conditioning, at least not the older places. Once I could close the windows, shutters, and heavy drapes I was able to sleep well.

The neighborhood is sketchy, but not unsafe. SFO has put out the welcome mat for the homeless. They are everywhere, but the neighborhood being on the edge of the Tenderloin district has a higher % than other parts of downtown.

Overall I was pleased with my accommodations, vs. some of my colleagues who spent 300 per night.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator it's ancient
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy, but OK and safe

review.title: Great value good location.
review.reviewText: We had a really nice room very clean a bit noisy staff helpfully would have been nice to have been able to get breakfast, but really enjoyed our stay good location. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: Not able to get breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Great location for all sights

review.title: Would not recommend, but close to transportation.
review.reviewText:
The hotel felt very old and damp. We requested a non-smoking room but the whole floor smelled like smoke (probably embedded in the carpets). There was only one person at the front desk at all times so it was difficult to ask questions because they were always busy. We didn't understand how to get breakfast within the hotel because there was no information and the dining area seemed to always be closed.
It's a good option if your looking for an inexpensive location near public transportation or within walking distance to major area, but not if you intend on spending a lot of time in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to public transportation and Mel's Diner.

review.title: Completely Adequate
review.reviewText: It's an old hotel and thus needs some upkeep, but it's clean and adequate if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room.

review.title: staff
review.reviewText: The staff presence was minimal. Uninspiring really for a person just arriving from another country.

review.title: Good hotel wrong area
review.reviewText:
Hotel was great only problem was the area it was its a very rough part of town after 9pm I wudnt won't to be walking round with my family.
Also we had a room that looked over the road which was very noisy at night not much sleep the 3 night we where there
review.negativeRemarks: Area
review.locationRemarks: Rough

review.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE
review.reviewText: while waiting on the valet to park my car being there is no where to park by the motel all my windows in my car got busted out. We only had time to get the luggage out of the car and within that time someone had time to bust all my windows and no one seen anything. When i talked to the hotel clerk she said my car would be fine and nothing would happen, then after it happend the hotel clerk said well its all your fault you shouldnt have left your car they were not helpful nor understanding about it so i do not recommend anyone staying here unless you would like to pay an extra $700 to fix all your windows like i had to
review.negativeRemarks: hotel clerks inconciderate
review.locationRemarks: bad

review.title: reasonable...but tall guy may hate this hotel!
review.reviewText: Actually it is old...but I think you can't find any hotel this price. It's reasonable and has good location.

review.title: Old hotel that is tired!
review.reviewText: Old hotel that is tired and in a bad neighbourhood! Don't walk south anywhere when its night. Even the cabbie said that.
review.negativeRemarks: the elevator was scary as when the door opened or closed it seemed like it was going to drop.
review.locationRemarks: 6-8 blocks from Union Square and what a difference!

review.title: served the purpose
review.reviewText: Great location to be able to get around without much difficulty or cost. Room was clean, not bad for an older hotel, but no amenities, including no hair dryers in the room. Served the purpose, only there to sleep...

review.title: Clean rooms on a small budget
review.reviewText: The Hotel itself is a good place to lay your head if you plan to be out and about most of the time. It is not in an ideal location, being the Tenderloin district, we were expecting a few down and outs , however there were far more homeless people and drug addicts then we expected in and around the area. The hotel itself was acceptable , very much in need of re decoration, however on the plus side, clean room , sheets and towels every day, and comfortable room and beds. The walk itself to Union Square is only approx 10-15 mins , so in this respect good location , but be prepared for the lifestyle of the homeless on the street, and sometimes the unpleasant smells along the way. Saying this they dont give you any bother apart from asking for money every now and then. I would not recommend you being alone at night in the area. Our stay was a good one, San Francisco is a must to visit, but if you can afford to pay a little more I would recommend a Hotel away from this area.
review.positiveRemarks: The daily room service. Clean towels and sheets, and Coffee available in reception area. Mels diner on the near corner so easy for a good breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Least favourite has to be the aged decor , and the area the hotel is situated. Would not want to take my grandchildren to this area.
review.locationRemarks: The area around the hotel is popular with the homeless and drug addicts so maybe not a great place to be if you are travelling on your own.

review.title: Overall a great place to stay when on a budget
review.reviewText:
For the quality of the hotel and it's price, it is not a bad choice at all. You get what you pay for and here is a little more detail about my stay.

Hotel: Priced right

Area: It is a "alright" area, there are some bums and some rough looking people who hang out on that block. I wouldn't recommend talking your girlfriend there and expect not to get hassled. (Although every block down town in unpredictable)
Out party included three white males and encountered zero problems, but I would feel a little more uncomfortable if it was just me and my significant other.

Rooms: We were there to sleep and shower that is it. The rooms were a little small if you are planning on making the best out of your hotel experience. The beds were alright, not the best in the world, but you get what you pay for. I am a clean freak and I can say I wasn't too bothered by the cleanness of the hotel.

Customer service: I checked in, valet my car and checked out. Those are the only three times I had to interact with the staff, zero problems.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a little bar/food place named Timmy's joint- very good beer and "fast food"
review.negativeRemarks: Locations and the homeless people
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of town, not too bad to navigate north or south side of town

review.title: Perfect for someone looking to walk
review.reviewText: Not a 5 star hotel but perfect if you're just looking for a place to sleep. The WIFI works sometimes and not the next but there is a fabulous little diner on the corner that also offers free WIFI. Perfect location if you are looking to do a lot of walking, about 45 min from Pier 39 and about the same if you are going to AT&T stadium. The area is a little run down but we always felt safe. You can catch the shuttle to the airport for $15/person and it's about 30 minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: on and off WIFI

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel is reasonable, but the area is aweful! We stayed for 3 nights and had noise outside every night. It was very hard to sleep. On the positive - a walking distance to Union Square and the bus outside will take you all the way to the Water Front.

review.title: good for the price
review.reviewText:
for the price hotel was realy ok. old but clean. room small but decent. bathroom newer than rest of the room wich is good.
the neighborhood down the geary street is realy bad, almost ghetto, but you don't have to go that way at all, unless you're coming by metro. the van ness avenue is the next one up the street and you have all the buses you need for tourist destination there and neighborhood is ok on that side.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Even though the building was old, the hotel was clean, and the room was big enough for two people. We were scare to use the elevator because it was the oldest ever. It's very close or already inside? the Terderloin, so we easily smelled drugs and saw many more homeless than other places. But location is good; it is close to the most populous shopping area.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator, Parking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect with the price

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: The location is not one you want to walk around in at night but overall I was happy with the condition of the hotel and for the price. The elevator worked the first two days but was broken on the third day and had to walk up and down 5 flights of stairs. The hotel Is close enough to everything that it's only a five buck can ride. Good for the price and the hotel was clean. It smelled funny but For the price it was all I could have hoped for

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Good location on Geary, 5 - 10 minute walk from Union Sq. Spacious room. Comfortable. Fairly easy to hear noise from rooms adjacent / corridor. Also, rather difficult to get right temperature for shower - either very hot or cold.

review.title: slight disappointnent
review.reviewText: It's ok but service minimal. Location can be hard to get a cab. Dangerous neighborhood

review.title: No thanks
review.reviewText: My boyfriend stopped on the street out front of the hotel so I could run in and get us checked in/inquire about parking. A tow truck immediately started backing up down the street so they could tow our vehicle. As my boyfriend circled the block, the gentleman at the front desk was rude and not helpful. I had to pry him to figure out parking. He brushed me off saying "just park beside us". I looked at the tiny lot and it belonged to an auto repair shop just packed full of vehicles. After flagging down my boyfriend, he squeezes into the entrance of the lot. The repair shop owner had to move 4 cars so that we could have a "spot" which was then blocked back in. We had to pay the shop owner $25. The hotel bathroom was old and dirty. The shower was either freezing or scalding hot. Room was very small and cramped. The bed did seem clean enough though. Traffic from the street was loud and the 1980's TV didnt help to drown it out. Checkout was very smooth however, with a pleasant lady. We went to get our car and the shop owner had to move a bunch of cars to try and get us out. Just not a good experience. I know parking is hard in San Fran, but at least explain at check-in that we're using another business's lot and we pay them, not the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to things, but I would only walk in the daytime. It felt pretty sketchy during the day and VERY sketchy at night.

review.title: It's ok, but u can fin bettter...
review.reviewText: It;s on a cleaner side. You can hear everything and everybody from the first floor, we were on 4th. Not very good or very safe location. Way to many bums outside. :(

review.title: it's close to almost anything
review.reviewText: it's a decent hotel to saty. just a little thing we didn't liked . hotel dont provide parking .

review.title: Good value for a night or two
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for one night when we were seeing a show in the city. Booked it easily enough on Expedia and had a very simple time getting the room booked and was very pleased. Once we got there the only slight complaints I had were about the staff. There were very brief with me hardly saying hello or being pleasant. Sort of just "Here's your key, here's your room. See ya" We paid cash to the auto repair shop next door for the "parking" and to be honest it didn't feel too secure but nothing happened and it we got the car out fine the next day. The room was very clean and comfortable especially since we were just there one night. The noise was very minimal for being in a busy part of town. When we checked out again is was just, "Okay everything is good" no goodbye or thank you. We had no problems but I wish the staff had been more pleasant.

review.title: Nice hotel but lacks service!
review.reviewText: Rooms were nice but we never had any maid service in our room. Couldn't connect to their wi-fi 3 out of 3 days. They had no ice available in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: Not an area to be in at night, a lot of homeless people on the streets

review.title: Oh dear!
review.reviewText: You only get what you pay for, in this case we didn't even get that! Homeless people everywhere, fire extinguishers out of date, not very clean, very old and tired. A shame as could be made nice if someone actually cared!

review.title: Cheep But Old Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good price in between all of the expensive San Francisco hotels, but the quality of the hotel was poor. Our main concern was a heavy Lysol stench in our room that tried to cover up that "old hotel" smell. There is no air conditioning in the hotel, only a ceiling fan. When we tried to open up the windows for some fresh air, there weren't any screens on the windows, and they also needed cleaned very badly. Their elevator was very old and needed replaced. The neighborbood was a little run down as well.

photos.caption: Even IN service, it was a little scary!

review.title: You Get What You Pay For!
review.reviewText:
I read this hotel's reviews but decided to take a chance anyway.
Pros: it's cheap, clean (NO bedbugs), & fairly centrally located.
Cons: Bums EVERYWHERE (though none bothered us), NOISY!!! Firetrucks & ambulances screaming up the street day & night, pillows were SO flat (we asked for extras & received them promptly), towels were super-scratchy, just as everyone else said, the front desk staff is surly, the elevator was broke 1 day of our stay (we were on the 5th floor & glad no one was in a wheelchair!), we were told it was $25/day to valet park & that we should pay the Asian man on the corner next to the hotel $20/day because that's where the valet would park our car anyway! We did that & had no problems except our uneasiness with the situation. We stayed 4 nights so that was an extra $80 expense. There is no air conditioning (not that you need it in San Francisco, it's always cold) so if you need the "white noise" to sleep, this is not the hotel for you. It does have heat.

Well, you get what you pay for. If you want a cheap room, this is it. If you want a room in a nice part of town, you're going to have to pay more for it. This hotel is about 26 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf (Pier 39). You can take the bus down there for $2. Union Square is within walking distance but you're gonna walk through a very sketchy neighborhood to get there. I would definitely pay more to stay in a quieter/safer part of town. Eat at Moulin Rouge, the couple that runs it is SO sweet!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, scary location, unreasonable parking situation, unreliable elevator, staff attitude, flat pillows, scratchy towels, no restaurant in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the very worst possible part of town. I felt like I should be carrying a gun or knife to protect myself.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText:
The stay in the Monarch was pleasant. It is a very simple hotel, without any major features, but with a very good staff.
More it has free wifi in all areas including the rooms, and the location is close to perfect.

For the price and expectation it was a very pleasant stay.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location of the hotel, 15 minutes to Downtown by walk, but weird smell in whole hotel
review.negativeRemarks: smell

review.title: hotel was nice but location was poor

Simple and old
needs renovation
it is cleen
T V works well
wake up call was performed on time

review.title: Good cheap stay.
review.reviewText:
I showed up at 2:33 to check in and got moved to a room right next to the elevator. It was noisy, but I dealt with it. The female checking me in wasn't too friendly, but other staff was nice.

Location is a little dicey, but other than the elevator the room was nice. Nice places to eat nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Room next to the evelator
review.locationRemarks: not the best

review.title: Not bad to stay
review.reviewText: I stayed here for couple of days, area is good wifi is good but doesn't have Microwave and Fridge.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. This hotel was cheap and basic, there is pretty much nothing there for you apart from a room with a bed and a bathroom! The place is not well insulated for sound, we were on the 5th floor with all windows closed and could hear street noise easily. The fire station isnt far away so heard many sirens. The area around it has its hairy parts but you feel safe enough in the hotel itself. Overall this wouldnt be my first choice but I would probably stay here again if there wasnt other options I could afford
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Ok, just do not walk down Polk St for long...

review.title: Nice boutique hotel.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel, worked great for our needs. Very clean. Spacious closet in our room. Boutique style with fun coffee/pasty shop just down steet. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Only drawback would be street noise, which is a bit unavoidable in a city.

review.title: Acceptable and Equal to the Amount You Pay
review.reviewText: It was very acceptable for the price. It's an old hotel but in decent shape. Staff was helpful but not overly so. I'd stay there again because the price was right. For any complainers, if you pay less, you get less; you should go in with the right expectations.

review.title: Average hotel- basic facilities
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco alone for 5 nights and stayed at this hotel. The location of the hotel is good, it is easy to jump on the bus and the BART station was around a ten minute walk from the hotel. The first three days I was there the staff were incredibly helpful and told me how to get around on public transport to see the sights. However the last two days there was a lady at the desk that spoke little English and gave me wrong directions...! Hm. Also I noticed that the windows were incredibly dirty and there was a lot of dust on the blinds. However the staff hoovered my room, made my bed and provided fresh towels on a daily basis. I could hear the occupants in the next room when they were using the bathroom (eew!) but was able to resolve this problem by keeping my bathroom door shut. The area is a little rough and ready at night time but perhaps I felt that way because I was travelling solo. It is a basic hotel so if you are looking for somewhere cheap to stay as a springboard for your trip to San Fran then this is the place to stay. It is incredibly basic but I guess that is reflected in the price. There is a nice diner at the top of the road called Mel's cafe and they do an amazing breakfast! Would definitely recommend going there for your morning fix
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty windows and hearing the occupants of the room next to me on the toilet!
review.locationRemarks: Was good for getting to the tourist attractions, bit rough at night time

review.title: no go
review.reviewText: give it a big miss,noisy,small rooms ,smelly,coffee/tea facility only in the lobby,hotel not in a nice area of town.
review.negativeRemarks: facilities
review.locationRemarks: not good

review.title: Don't stay here if you can avoid it
review.reviewText:
Really dissapointing hotel. The staff are monosyllabic and not at all warm and the place needs a lot of redecoration.
I found a soiled face towel in my bathroom and the rooms need updating/painting.

The hotel is also in a slighlty strange neighbourhood - quite close to town but lots of undesirables hanging out on the street corner and lots of shouting at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff and dirt
review.locationRemarks: Close to town but strange atomosphere

review.title: not the greatest experience
review.reviewText: bath thub and lavatory were clogged which made what could have been a pretty good experience into a disappointing one.

review.title: Good 'Nuff
review.reviewText: The hotel was suitable, right on the downtown strip, it has valet parking for a reasonable rate. The employees are suitable, and there is free coffee in the library. The Bathrooms had lots of hot water and good water pressure. Room came with a HUGE closet.
review.negativeRemarks: Scratchy quilt
review.locationRemarks: homeless people outside, but otherwise safe

review.title: Clean, average hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in Geary St, 10 minutes walking from Union Square. The area doesn't seem so nice as other parts of the city but overall is ok. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I would recommend it as an average hotel.

review.title: Old world charm that does not suffice
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel because the one we were planning to stay in had no room and this was reviewed to have an old world charm with agreeable levels of comfort. Hence we checked in prepared for all the disadvantages of an old hotel in mind. And we were STILL disappointed. First of all, the description said this is a double double room with 2 queen beds. The beds were way too small for 2 people. There was a smell lingering in the room and we found discarded toileteries from the previous occupant in the walk-in closet. The plumbing was iffy and there was no exhaust in the washroom. The coffee was worse than a gas station and there were homeless people hounding us as we left and entered the hotel (more of a city problem than the hotel's fault). Overall, I don't think I am going back to stay here. The so called "city view" this offers is also not to kill for.
review.negativeRemarks: badly maintained

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Inexpensive and great location. I would stay there again

review.title: Go here, only if you can't find anything else. The wireless access in the rooms are terrible.
review.reviewText: The rooms are spacious. The interior looks ok, but at the price you pay here, you can find something better (in terms of quality but a little bit smaller) room very near SF downtown. Also the wireless access in the rooms is unusable. You have to go to the hotel lobby to use the internet.
review.locationRemarks: Financial District

review.title: Filthy
review.reviewText: Dirty, dusty, the elevators are too old and makes one feel unsafe. The rooms and the corridor stinks. No breakfast and they charge $24 for parking. We had booked for 3 days but we left after10 hours.
review.locationRemarks: Mill brae

review.title: Good for its cost
review.reviewText: NO PARKING!!! Old hotel old rooms but pretty clean. Average service... Central location but kind of loud in the outside

review.title: Noy that much good
review.reviewText: Full of homeless people , small bath room. smelly room

review.title: wifi in the lobby
review.reviewText: normal hotel... a little bit older but ok

review.title: So so
review.reviewText: it's really an old building~ there are two doors for elevator(need to manually open the 1st wooden door), we stayed one night then checked out for Yosemite tour and then came back again. The room we were given is facing the street and is very noisy, we can't sleep well. But when we came back, we got a room x05, it is much better. No wifi signal in the room. But the location is good, can walk to Union square ( 8 blocks) or take the bus#38.The bus stop of #38 is just on the opsite of hotel .And there is a small super-market on the corner of polk street and Geary street, where you may prepare water, bread, fruit for the 2nd day trip - this is good.

review.title: the bear
review.reviewText:
The Monarch has somewhat of an ourworn splendor, but I liked the atmosphere there. The service is friendly, the rooms are clean, the matrasses are good. The hotel is situated near to downtown and near to a cable car line.
The homepage needs an update, its informtion is not always correct.

review.title: Beware, this isn't for everyone. If you want fancy, find anothere place
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel 6 weeks out and requested a queen smoking room and prepaid via Expedia. I arrived around 7pm the day of the show and was told that I had a King smoking room, if I didn't want that I could have a queen smoking or 2 doubles. There were no non-smoking rooms. The desk guy was a bit a smug stating "you already paid, no refunds so you can stay or not". I didn't feel like paying for another 2 nights a different hotel and I knew the city was booked up. I stayed and made my way up to my room. This place needs a GOOD cleaning and a makeover, The room on first look was clean but shabby. I pulled the bed from the wall to check for bedbugs and saw them piles of white powder and dead bugs lining the wall. gross! The bed was clean, sheets clean and thankfully the room didn't smell like smoke. I opened all the crappy windows and let the fresh SF air fill the room. The closet was huge, bigger than some rooms I seen in SF, the bathroom tiny but spotless. The sink didn't drain and in the morning it was filled with specks of cigarette ashes that had backed up in the night. The neighborhood is cool, walking distances to good bars and food. If you want a "nice" hotel, forget it. If you can handle a pretty clean room in a funky hotel at a fair price, stay here. Usually there are lot's of hotels for less in SF so shop around!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel twice, liked it both times, no problems with anything, it's in a convenient place of the city, not in the center though.Overall, i would recommend this hotel, pretty good deal.

review.title: You Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText: The hotel felt like a convalescent home. The mattress was old & unconfortable. Rooms were tiny, restrooms were tiny. I was so disappointed upon arrival that I really considered looking for another hotel but was talked out of the idea by my wife. in NO WAY did we let our little daughter crawl around the floor. The towels were old and felt as if they had been washed one too many times. Overall, I would not recomend this hotel to anybody. Next time, I rather pay the difference and stay at a hotel that will give me better quality.

review.title: Does the job, but you get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Small hotel in a seedy area of the city. If you're a 20 or 30 something that doesn't need the fancy ammenities of more expensive hotels and you're not too put off by the unsavoury types that litter the streets after dark then price wise this place works. If you plan on being out and about all day a just need a place to lay your head down and kick your feet up then you can make this place work. However if you're a family with small kids or a couple looking for a romatic stay in the city I wouldn't recommend this hotel. If you're looking for a hotel close to Union Square you can do better as it's a good 10 blocks or so from the square and the cable cars.

review.title: Not bad for a day or two,but not a place for family and kids.
review.reviewText: We stayed in San Francisco for 5 days and the hotel was good enough.I had free coffee in the morning,internet, and a clean bed and bathroom.The room was cold and I had to wear long socks in Aug.Bring your own pillow(their pillows are limp,flat and hard) and be prepaired for 15 channels on tv.We were out all day,and in the evening there were some good movies and HBO played the new episode of True Blood so I can't complain about that.The shower always had hot water and the room was a 7 out of 10.The area is another thing...which is not really the hotels fault.Its a bad area with a lot of homeless/crazy people.From 10pm -1am I could hear them yelling in the streets from our room. If you are just in the area for a day or two and you need a cheap room,the this is a good place.It is a 30-40 min walk to Union square shopping area,or there is a bus that goes straight there in 10min.

review.title: Skid Row
review.reviewText: If You like homeless people, drug addicts, and dirty streets, than this is the place for you! The view outside of the room is an old dirty mattress, what appears to be pee and three buildings. Even with all the windows in our room closed, there is a strong aroma of marijuana, which intensifies once windows are opened. The elevator jerks a lot and feels as if its going to drop or stop at anytime. Be cautious when walking outside because there are plenty of homeless people and drug addicts along the sidewalks and corners staring and begging for money.

review.title: Great value and clean decent room
review.reviewText: Pleasant desk staff, great price. Comfortable bed, very clean and nice bathroom and good toiletries. Neighborhood is a little creepy/rowdy at night but still a great location and much better than south of market locations. Very quiet in our room.

review.title: Joanna
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok, but surrounding neighborhood was terrible.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
The neighborhood surrounding the hotel was exceptionally noisy, even for a downtown location. Our room was located along the back of the hotel, facing the alley between the hotel and a parking garage. Somewhere in the area, trucks were either being loaded or unloading during the early morning hours, loud enough to think that our windows were left open. The patrons of the local bars were quite noisy around 2 or 3 AM, and sirens could be heard at any time of night.

The parking garage is the best place to park, as far as I can tell. $20 a day, but plenty of parking available at night. A parking valet is available for $24 a day, but that service is generally not available after 11 PM.

Overall, the hotel is rather old, and could use a little updating. Our room was somewhat spartan, with no refrigerator, no hotel information guide, and no ice machine on the same floor. The flooring within the entire hotel is rather creaky, and our room had a bit of a dip in one spot of the floor underneath the carpet.

On the upside, a Mel's Drive-In restaurant is located on the same block, and the staff did a nice job of keeping the room clean. None of the staff I came across were ill-tempered. The hotel is located one block off of Van Ness, pretty much in the middle of town, so you can reach most places in San Francisco by car pretty quickly, but it's a hike of 8-10 blocks to the nearest stop for the cable car.

Overall, I would look into other options the next time.

review.title: It's in the Tenderloin district!
review.reviewText: Old building, but some effort has been put into remodelling. You have to run the gauntlet from Van Ness or California through the Tenderloin to get to it. It's worth spending more to get a better location.

review.title: Not too far, not too near
review.reviewText:
The convenience of this hotel is that isn't too far, or too near of the main attraction points of SF downtown

The room was clean
There is free WiFI in the hotel, but the most stable point was the lobby.

The free coffee @ the lobby is good!

review.title: will def check in next time
review.reviewText: the place was more than ok for what we pay,, and the location was accessible to everything so it was all good,, :D

review.title: good experience in san francisco
review.reviewText: nice and comfy place that i would recommend in san francisco

review.title: Bad nights
review.reviewText: Do not ever choose this hotel, although, I have to say, the location is good, but it's too noisy. Many traffic. and building is old, the internet is almost died, there is no signal in room. I have to go down to the lobby to get online. Anyway, you can get another place than this one.

review.title: The less you pay, the less you get
review.reviewText:
Next time I'll know to pay a little more just to get a better stay in San Francisco:

The location was in a convenient location for the main bus lines #38 (to Union Square or towards Golden Gate Park) and #19 (Up to the fishermans wharf), it was located in the Tenderloin area surrounded by interesting individuals especially at night, harmless, but nonetheless intimidating.

After being greeted by the night staff on the night of arrival, we were provided the hotel room key with little to none of a greeting/or enthusiasm to our stay here in their hotel. The day staff will make their best efforts to help you find the airport shuttle, so it hopefully is just the one individual I met during my stay.

Internet wifi is slow and cannot be accessed within the room. The strongest Wifi point I found was near the south end of the hallway without any chairs----I was hoping it was at least in the lobby with all the chairs...

There are no microwaves/fridges for use in the whole hotel, so hopefully you finish all your meals without any leftovers...or else they'll potentially go bad especially if you enjoy the seafood in San Francisco.

There are some decent locations for a quick lunch at Hoang Dong Sandwiches for lunch / or a delicious lunch/dinner I tried out such as the Thai House Express on Larkin Street 1 block away.

Washrooms are modern with some wear/cracking on the lamination on the washroom door. Loose sink head & shower head. 1 Juice Stained bed sheet,
No A/C, good furniture.

review.title: Crummy hotel
review.reviewText: We booked a queen and we got a double. The clerk insisted that it was a queen and told us there was nothing he could do.

review.title: Decent place to shower and sleep
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I chose this hotel b/c it was close to a lot of places that we wanted to visit in downtown San Fran. I had read other reviews of it so I wasn't expecting much. We weren't planning to spend much time in the room anyways, we were there to be tourists and see as many sights as possible. If you just need a decent place to crash at night, the Monarch will do.

What I did appreciate during my stay was being able to check in an hour early and having our car parked all 3 nights that we stayed, after 11PM (the end of regular valet hours). We returned to the hotel between 1-2AM each night and were still able to have our car parked.

The worst thing about our stay was the bed and pillows. The bed was very old, springy and uncomfortable. The pillows were not any better. Fortunately, we were so tired from the days adventures that we both managed to sleep well despite the condition of the bed.

review.title: Good value - staff could have been more helpful
review.reviewText:
The location was fine - easy access to public transport and a nice area during the day - a great value none the less. The staff were accomodating enough - but could have been more helpful. They were courteous enough to store our bags for a few hours before our evening flight, but my husband was on crutches - I assumed that they would help him carry the luggage so I ran upstairs to leave a tip for the cleaning lady - and when i came down and we walked out, my husband told me the front desk clerk held the door for him as he carried our luggage by himself - hopping on one foot - into their storage area. Not exactly great service. My only other complaint is that the cleaning lady threw away our left overs (which were going to be our lunch) the first day we were there.

Despite these experiences - if you're on a budget and able bodied, I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Good Deal for the Money
review.reviewText: It's the Tenderloin, but it's not "dangerous" ... just some street people. Plenty of good places to eat within short walk. Bed was ok; bathroom good; room cleaned everyday. The hotel provided the basics. Wi-fi was sketchy; no fridge in the room; Ice machine in the basement. But if I could get Pres. Grant to go with me again, I would definitely stay at the Monarch.

review.title: Don't saty here/ Parking is not included on the price, you better fins a cheaper one in this case.
review.reviewText:
1.) A non-smoking room smells like someone is smoking at all times. Hotel is old, so they need to be more careful with cleaning the carpets perodically. The room smells like it has not been opened in years.

2.) There is a trap with the parking lot. It's not included in the room price and they recomend you one of the most expensives parking lots in the area.

review.title: Functional Location, Quaint Room
review.reviewText: An older hotel that is clean and well maintained. Walking distance to everything I intended on visiting in the city. The street seemed a bit shady, but I didn't experience any problems. Nice little Diner down the street. For my purposes it was perfect.

review.title: Cheap if you don't need internet
review.reviewText: There is no internet service to speak of - it is totally unuseable, as it is so slow that old fashioned dial up worked better. Thrown of it constantly as well - you will have to do all your computer work somewhere else....

review.title: Great find in SFO!!!
review.reviewText: Reasonable price, clean rooms and good location. The hotel is 20min walking distance to Union Square, a few blocks from Civic Center, near the main road, and has supermarkets nearby. Of course, don't expect 5 star amenities. The lobby has free coffee and tea the whole day and if you want to eat, there's Mel's diner nearby. Internet signal in my room was a bit weak so I had to go to the lobby to go online. That's okay considering I got a great great deal on the room price. The value was more the I expected. I would definitely go back again and recommend to my friends.

review.title: No problem. Have stayed here a few times.
review.reviewText: This is nothing special, but it's dependable, and I've never had any bad surprises. Carpets are a little dingy, and there's a sort of musty smell in the public areas, but for a bargain hotel this is very satisfactory. Rooms are pretty comfortable. Good coffee in the lobby. It's on the edge of a pretty sketchy neighborhood, but it's busy enough that one wouldn't likely feel unsafe. I'd recommend this hotel for budget travelers.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Sure the Monarch may not be the nicest place in all of San Francisco, but it was cheap and convient. It is located close to several easy to use Muni lines and not far from a BART station. For those who don't know Muni and BART are San Francisco's bus and subway systems.

review.title: SF best hotel for price less then $100/night
review.reviewText: Large room (very large in comparison with some hotels at o'Farrel and Powell) with bath, iron, TV and fan. Very clean. Refrigerator absence in cheap room seems to be disadvantage, but is quite tolerable.

review.title: Second trip better than first
review.reviewText: Great location

review.title: Expensive for what it is
review.reviewText:
In expedia webpage, breakfast was included in hotel price but at check-in they informed us that breakfast was not included.
Fair hotel, expensive for what they offer.

review.title: No surprise
review.reviewText: Not much more than expected, however the staff could be freindlier. Upon check in enquired about breakfast hours and were informed there was no breakfast for the week and that we could go up the street. No apology or explanation. It took three days of calling down for water glasses to be left by housekeeping. Less than what was expected, but the price was right. Some might find the neighborhoo a bit difficult.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText:
Everything was fine at check in except the smell, I can't even begin to describe it!
Not musty or mildewy, more like an old sailor getting off a ship after many, many months at sea, without having showered. Yuck! And although the room itself was clean, this smell tainted the whole place. Also no heat in the bathroom, no curtain/blind, only frosted glass on the window, with the light on, from the outside I am sure someone watching from any of the apartment windows across the way could see the shape of the person or pretty much what they were doing. No privacy!
The bottom sheet on the bed was not a fitted sheet, it was a constant struggle to tuck them back in during the night. If anyone at Expedia has ever stayed there, I am sure it would not be offered on your site. Really, someone should check it out! It was not in the "theater district", quite a bit north of it, although there were lots of "characters" on the street. My own opinion only, but no matter how good the deal is, this hotel should not be offered on any travel site. It is just too old and should not used as a hotel.

review.title: Probably ok for the price but not good
review.reviewText: No internet! The phone in the room was broken. Bathroom was not in a good shape.

review.title: Not for everyone, but not bad for me
review.reviewText: If you are used to staying at the Ritz, this place is not for you. First, as is mentioned in other reviews, this is not in the best neighborhood. While the homeless are abundant, they are not aggressive. I did not feel unsafe at all. This location is walking distance to Union Square and on the bus line. There are many good hole in the wall restaurants in the area and a nice coffee shop across the street. As for the hotel itself, it was built in the 20's. The room was small, but clean. I have only two complaints. First, the water pressure is extremely low to the point that it was difficult to shower. Second, the free Internet sucks and is essentially useless. Management...change the password occasionally so that the people in the apartments next door can't bog down the system so much. Certainly not the best hotel I have stayed in, but not the worst either. I think that the price was fair with all considered. San Francisco is such a great food city. I would rather spend money on food than a place to sleep.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: For the price of the room the hotel is very good. The hotel was full yet I didn't hear any noise from other rooms which can sometimes be a problem in cheaper hotel. The room was clean, had an iron and hair dryer & free toiletries. I wasn't sure after reading the reviews but for the price of a room in a major city like San Francisco, I would recommend it. That said, you may want to know that 1/ the neighbourhood is a little bit edgy at night 2/ the internet connection is very slow and not good if on a business trip - I had to go to the cafe across the road with free internet to access my emails at normal speed 3/ I probably wouldn't want to go there for a romantic weekend 4/street noise is quite loud although most can be blocked with earplugs. It was good for a business trip because it was basic, clean and cheap.

review.title: No frills--no problems.
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel before, and I will again. It's nothing fancy, but it's clean and comfortable, and the rates are a bargain. Room was simple but quite adequate. Not nicest area of the city, but the neighborhood is busy enough that it felt safe.

review.title: Decent for price
review.reviewText:
For a really affordable price, this hotel is neat, clean, and perfectly fine.
I think Expedia lists it as in Japantown, but really it's in the tenderloin, so I was a little surprised by the location, but as stated before, the location is fine for the price of the stay. They do have free hot tea in the lobby 24 hours, which I found really nice.

review.title: Good, price, good location,could be cleaner
review.reviewText:
Choose for the location and the availability of a smoking room.
Older hotel but fine.

review.title: "For the price, very nice"
review.reviewText: I would recommend the Monarch Hotel if your planning a inexpensive trip to San Fransisco. The neighborhood was at first a little scary, but the locals do not bother you. The night staff was very friendly as was the housekeeping staff. We had a great stay.

review.title: Yeah Monarch Inn!
review.reviewText: For the price, you can't get much better than this. The hotel lobby and my room were clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and I enjoyed the free tea and coffee available 24/7. Also- the hotel is centrally located and there is free wireless. What else does one need?

review.title: Basic, clean, good location, lots of fun.
review.reviewText: I enjoy to stay in the Monarch Hotel. The recepcionist in the morning was a lovely and helpful lady. the housekeeping is very good and the location is good and close to everything, with direct bus to the main beaches and parks, just in the front street.

review.title: It is what it is...
review.reviewText: Moderate priced hotel in central San Fran. If you're on a budget and don't expect to do more than sleep in the room, you could do a lot worse than this hotel. It's certainly dated, furnishings are cheap dorm room style, bathroom is bare bones, but you get what you pay for. Sheets were clean and white and towels were clean. If you want a 4-5 star hotel in San Fran, you'll need to go pay for it.

review.title: Excelent location
review.reviewText:
It's a basic hotel, not the newest, or modern, but have the necesary for travelers that want to know downtown, chinatown, japantown, and the diferent places at san francisco.

The perfect location.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: every thing was as we expected

review.title: OK for the price, good location
review.reviewText: Hotel corresponded to what expected with respect to the price and the description/pictures. A thicker comfort would be better...

review.title: Happy
review.reviewText: Definitly would stay again. Glad that I was able to find this hotel. Most of the people that stayed here were foreign travelers and twenty-something olds. The hotel is in a great location. 10 minutes to the beach by car and few blocks away from downtown. The hotel was comfortable and there is plenty of things to do just in the block surrounding the hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for the average business traveler. The internet disconnects frequently and there really is not many extra amenities with this hotel.

review.title: Good hotel, I would stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice in general (considering it is a 2 star hotel). I stayed for three days with my family. The location is very convenient for most of the attractions of the City (at least those in downtown) even though we did not have a car. The room was nice and clean and everything worked just fine. It's true it is a Hospital very close and you can hear the ambulances from time to time but, at least while we were there, it was not too bad (on the weekend). An important issue is that the surrounding areas are not really nice at night. There are a lot of homeless lying in the street, specially after 6 o 7 pm. Probably they are nice people but it's not a nice environment to take a walk with your family. At least Geary is an avenue so it is well iluminated. They do not serve breakfast but if you want to buy something (there are a lot of places within 1 or 2 blocks) and bring it to the hotel you have a place to have breakfast in the lobby. They provide FREE hot coffee and tea all day long (and it was always hot). Consider that my level of satisfaction with the hotel takes into account, specially, the price. Course, there were some minimum details (e.g. it does not include local calls and the wireless service was not good). I will not mention all of them because it is what you can expect in a 2 star hotel. If you don't want to deal with these "details" you can pay two or three times the price I paid and you will not have to do it...

review.title: if you're not looking for luxury,but need inexpensive rates and great location in san francisco but
review.reviewText:
this hotel worked for us as it was reasonably priced and located close to what we both needed and enjoyed. our kids are at the academy of arts,...so within easy walking distance to their dorms. great coffee shops and restaurants abound close by, chinatown, galleries, museums...all walking distance or quick bus trip.
this is Not a luxury hotel but it was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Monarch Hotel Stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a convenient location to the city, but it is not in the greatest neighborhood. Although I felt safe while I was there, the area has a larger amount of homeless people than most other areas. Additionally, when we arrived the smell of pot was very apparent. While the stay was fine, as we were only looking for a room to sleep in, I was hit with an addiitonal charge for having more than 2 people. As I had not been informed of this during check-in, the charge at the end of the week came as an unpleasant surprise. With that, it makes the hotel more expensive, and less desirable than it had originally been.

Additionally, the area surrounding the hotel is extremely noisy at night and at times makes it hard to sleep. If you are looking for just a bed and not planning to stay in the room much, it is a relatively good deal.

review.title: Depends on what you ask
review.reviewText: In general my opinion about Monarch Hotel is positive. It is located near Union Square, by Van Ness so it is very convenient and you can easily access many areas on foot. I think the location is the most important feature of the Hotel. Although it is easily acceptable and near Downtown, when you get outside the Hotel doors the first thing you see is a strip club.... Personally I don't mind but I would say that the neighborhood is a bit strange....

review.title: It's ok dont expect to much.
review.reviewText: All parking was taken had to park around the corner and down the street at the amc theater parking lot. Extra $24.00 a day.hotel not bad old but not bad. Neighborhood not so good.

review.title: old fashion
review.reviewText: the hotel was a bit old-fashioned but the location was fine, close to the center. the parking is a bit expensive 24 $ per day

review.title: Worked out fine
review.reviewText: The hotel worked out fine - the neighborhood is a bit seedier than other parts of San Francisco. But, it's relatively safe (for a big city) and we didn't have any problems. Coming from NY, it was comparable. The hotel, itself, was fine - the room was clean and everything worked. No complaints. Definitely would stay there again.

review.title: No problem.
review.reviewText: Good basic hotel, no significant complaints. Carpet on stairs a little dirty, but hey, it's a bargain hotel. Room was small but clean and comforatble. Coffee was always available in the lobby. Neighborhood was sort of funky, but busy enough to be safe. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Very pleasant vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Location was great for sightseeing San Francisco. Historic hotel was nice and very clean, only problem was street noise, nothing the hotel could control. Would visit again. Excellent rates.

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText: convenient location but old hotel needs maintenance

review.title: You get what you paid for
review.reviewText: At this hotel you get exactly what you paid for; the price might be cheaper than other hotels in downtown San Francisco but the the surroundings and the conditions are not the greatest. Expect to see a lot of drug dealers and prostitutes right across from the hotel, moreover the hotel itself is very old, clean but in bad conditions.

review.title: hello again
review.reviewText:
I had a little trouble trying to modify my reservation. I finally cancelled my french reservation and booked with expedia USA. I think that it should be possible to modify the dates of the reservation without having to cancel the entire reservation. This is a problem with expedia.

The night time personnel at the front desk was a little grumpy in the morning at 5h30 AM. He was a bit gruff. I had trouble receiving my telephone calls because some one at the front desk in the morningaround 10 am and at night was talking on the telephone and blocking the line.

The lobby curtains needed a wash and the lobby was a bit outdated. The telephone rates were surprising because I was billed for calling out when I couldn't get my party. There was no answer on the other end. I was still billed for the call.

Monarch hotel should review their telephone service.

I loved my room because it was nicely furnished. There was coffee in the lobby and that was a very good idea. My room was nicely cleaned every day early.
The neighborhood was the old Tendreloin district. not exactly like Union Square but the location was convenient near buses and a 15 minute walk to the cable car and downtown. I would indeed stay in Monarch Hotel again.

review.title: Monarch Hotel is A Good Deal
review.reviewText: The Monarch Hotel has gotten some unfair press lately. It is actually a nice, clean, comfortable place with a friendly and helpful staff. I found everything to be just as I expected and was very happy with my overall experience. The staff was pleasant and helped me book a shuttle back to the airport. The neighborhood is a little sketchy but I was never approached by anyone and I never felt unsafe. Additionally, the room was very quiet even though I was there during the weekend of the World Cup final. Overall, this is a good deal and I would recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco. The location is walking distance from many of the major areas of interest and a short cab ride from many others.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I am a visitor from Pakistan. I went to SFO last month and stayed at the Monarch Hotel. I loved the location and the price. Its so close to all the major locations of the city. I walked to all the fun places even in hte middle of the night. I would recommend it to everyone that visit SFO. I would stay there again.

review.title: Value for money- not a family place though! lol
review.reviewText: The Monarch Hotel is a good budget stay, very close to all the major sights in San Francisco especially Union Square. The metro is nearby and cable cars leave from close by too (around a 10 minute walk away). The man who checked us in was brusque and a bit rude, but on the whole hotel staff were quite helpful. The room was dark and the street outside could be very noisy- enough to wake a person up. Lots of homeless on the streets outside and a lovely sex show theatre opposite- obviously not a family hotel! However, it was perfect for my friend and I to just sleep and use as a base while we explored the city. Lots of excellent television channels for late night boredom. I would stay again.

review.title: Review of The Monarch San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great hotel to stay at in San Francisco, especially if you are on a budget.
The location is excellent and centrally located in the city.
The Monarch is right down the block from a previous hotel I formerly stayed at when vacation in San Francisco. I chose the monarch because it is just as good with a far better rate.

If you are looking for a place to stay in S.F. that is clean, quiet, and comfitorable. The Monarch is the place.

review.title: Completely Adequate
review.reviewText: Completely Adequate. I travel alone a lot since no one else can afford my lifestyle in my life, so I was completely fine with a bed and a decently secure room. I do hostels a lot so this was more privacy than I'm used to, I'm also not picky unless something is blatantly wrong with the situation.

review.title: best for travellers
review.reviewText: reaaly good location, walking distance to union square and shopping, dining. good hotel, wifi works fine. If I SF again I will defenately stay at monarch.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: The price of the hotel was cheap to which was made apparent as soon as I walked through the door. If it wasn't for the location of the hotel I would not bothered to check in & would have asked for my money back. The bed had human...let me just keep it clean by saying that it was possible "below the waist" hair on the bed. I wasn't looking to complain because they DID have my car under their control. I could have forseen something "accidentally" happening to my car with that regards. Old & a bit run down, the hotel lived up to the price.

review.title: My review should be helpful to others
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I planned a last minute 1 year anniversary to San Francisco, , on Memorial Day Weekend, and the Monarch had availability and it's located close by to tourist attractions. The hotel once you walked inside isn't so bad, but the rooms are really small. We had a king size bed, a small bathroom, & a little t.v. My boyfriend is 6'5 so it was a bit uncomfortable for him. Their is no A/C in the rooms at this hotel, just a heater, and our's had a broken knob. It was pretty warm, but all we could do is open the windows. The room & bathroom were clean, but the carpet is old. I was able to sleep at one point, but ALL night you could hear people shouting in the streets, police car sirens, alarms going off, etc. I felt like I was in the hood. The area is basically like a hood, and we walked during the day to Union Station which was near by (about 7 blocks), and also to dinner at The Cheesecake Factory which is inside Macy's and we walked back at night (around 9:30pm), and I must say, I was a little scared, but I felt safe with my boyfriend. Also, if you stay here & walk around at night, be prepared for people to talk to you on the street asking for money, change, or trying to con you. We encountered that about 5 times in just 7 blocks walking back to our room. There is adult book stores across the street, & some nude places near by, so it's definitely not a hotel for a family to stay at. I say it's more for couples, or friends, looking for a room in Frisco on a budget.

review.title: Not friendly neighbourhood for family
review.reviewText:
The last time I stayed in this hotel the rooms were much bigger and modern. This time around the rooms were on 1st and 2nd floor and were smaller and felt archaic.
I hadn't noticed earlier that the hotel is in the tenderloin district, so it's a bit uncomfortable with family. It's fine for singles.

review.title: It smells dampness
review.reviewText:
Usual cheap hotel with old rooms (a sink was malfunctioning) and strange. It's mediocre hotel.

I can't say that we were satisfied with this hotel.

review.title: good deal in downtown SF
review.reviewText: An old hotel, elegant but a bit dilapidated now. The price was excellent and the location fantastic.

review.title: not bad for the offered price
review.reviewText:
The noise is the biggest problem:
The hotel's surrounding can be noisy at nights--nothing to do about this!
Some nights there was too much noise within the hotel corridors and not much was done about it by the staff.

review.title: Terrific value!
review.reviewText: Hotel does smell old, but it is old. What do you expect? Inside it's very quiet and clean but be aware that the streets can be noisy at night with bar goers and early in the morning with street sweepers so ear plugs are recommended. Hotel staff very helpfull, got extra pillows immediately after asking for them. Within walking distance of Union Square, Chinatown, Cable Cars and buses. Easy bus/cab ride to other areas of the city. Would definitely stay here again, great value for your money!

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: This is a no frills hotel, in a mediocre neighborhood, but the rooms and the lobby was clean, and it offers a good value for price. With just a little walking it is close to many of the tourist spots and to public transportation. My only real complaint was the broken elevator for part of our stay (and we were on the 4th floor).

review.title: they come in your room when your gone
review.reviewText: they go there you room when you are gone

review.title: Late check in
review.reviewText:
Monarch Hotel is completely refurbished and refurnished. Bathrooms have been upgraded to modern level. Lobby has a piano and a summer cafe.
Not the fault of the hotel, but an adult book store is across the street, which may bother some travelers.
I came at 12:20pm with a reservation and the clerk told me to come back at 2 pm, not a good policy.
Location is by Geary and Van Ness.

review.title: My favorite SF Hotel.
review.reviewText: This is the fifth time in three years I have stayed at the Monarch and as always, I enjoyed my stay. Great location, lots of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Easy access to downtown.

review.title: A little rough around the edges
review.reviewText: This hotel was not quite what i expected. From an exorbitant nightly parking fee to a room the size of my (small) bedroom. The bathroom had virtually no counter space and my husband and I felt like we were right on top of each other the whole time. I did not see an A/C unit, but the heater was a little wall unit that could only be on or off, no temperature settings or anything. The neighborhood was also not the most savory as we saw a man urinating on the opposite building when we arrived. Still the location was good enough that we could walk to eating locations and the Capitol building and we could use the City Sightseeing bus as transportation.

review.title: cheap and good
review.reviewText:
It's a really cheap hotel so don't expect luxury, but it's a good choice if you don't want to spend a lot of money.
The room was clean, so as the bathroom.
Hotel's staff weren't friendly or very polite, but we were all day sightseeing so we didin't mind, we just used the hotel to sleep and not a minute more.
There's coffee and tea at the lobby, you couldn't expect more for the price you pay!

review.title: Price/service not a good deal
review.reviewText: People had an annoying attitude, looking as if they were doing us a favor to keep us there. The room was ok, but they definitely don't know how to prepare a bed, which made sleeping less comfortable. Anyway, it was fairly clean and in a convenient location. I'm not an expert about hotels, but I thought that for what I spent I would receive a better service.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Dirty hotel, parking problem.

review.title: OK but there are things you should know
review.reviewText: no one to help with baggage, had to double park to unload luggage, luggage trolley too big for elevator. In the Tenderloin district which is the most dangerous area of SF which I didn't know until a notice in the room. Bathroom small but serviceable. Room good with ability to open windows which we liked. Pay for parking behind hotel which is only semi-convenient & the parking is $25.00 each time you go out which I thought a little steep. It would be nice for some discounted parking with the hotel stay. Surrounded by XXX theaters & the like, not a hotel to stay in with kids or an adventurous teen boy with sex hormones raging

review.title: A fair twenty minutes walk from Union Square.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Adult store right in front, which was a surprise. Friendly staff.

review.title: Best Little Affordable Hotel in the Tenderloin
review.reviewText:
I am an ex resident of SF and knew we were on the edge of the Tenderloin, which can be a little dicey, but we were only 1 block away from Van Ness (a major bus route) and right on Geary (another major bus route). My suggestion, if you are not a city person, do not walk towards downtown at night. There are a lot of homeless/handicap services in the area, which is why you see a fair amount of homeless and handicaped people in the area. Overall we were fine. I had no qualms about walking around the area with my 11 year old stepson after dark. Just be careful and be aware.
No where really great to park, without paying, plus SF has street cleaning rules. If you are just visting the city invest in a Street Wise map and use public transportation.
If you like Turkish food, head east on Geary about 1 block. YUM!

review.title: The Monarch
review.reviewText: It was in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Walking Distance from the BART. Neighbor hood was fine, if you're afraid of homeless people stay home. Geary Street is like a party street, has many bars and food places. 20min walk to Union Square. Staff was very nice, never bothered me. Worth the price, clean and I would recommend to relatives/friends.

review.title: Staff need to be more hospitable and friendly
review.reviewText:
This is a pretty average hotel. Everything was fine apart from the attitude of the staff, some of whom were not firendly or hospitable. On arrival, a young male employee of Middle eastern/Asian appearance aged around late 20s or 30 was working on reception. He didn't even say "Hello" or ask how I was. Every time I returned to the hotel in the evening, he was there, and he totally ignored guests coming into the hotel. He was so absorbed by watching films on his laptop computer.
One day I left the hotel and wished another older employee on reception "Have a nice day". He simply glared at me as if I was an extra-terrestrial! Perhaps my problem is being too pleasant to people, or simple manners escaped him. Only one person, an older male employee in his 50s, was regularly pleasant to me, chatting away merrily and taking an interest in the guests. It should not be too much to expect employees in the hospitality industry to actually be hospitable. Otherwise we might as well go and sleep in a garage.
Concerning the room, it was fine. Nothing great, a decent size though I did notice some grubby traces left on the doors where people had opened them further up than where the handle is, so they need to wipe this with some detergent, otherwise everything was fine.
Just because of the attitude of the staff, I'd like to give another hotel a go the next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Good reasonable place to stay for a night or 2
review.reviewText:
Good hotel for the money. Not the friendliest at the desk but sufficently helpful.
They will park your car in an overnight garage for 21$- convienant and safe.
Also helpful to walk a few blocks to the state building to get a day pass to ride unlimited on the buses, trolleys.

review.title: Lovely hotel, would love to go again!
review.reviewText: I had one of my greatest days in your hotel. Thank you!

review.title: clean quaint convenient dive, helpful staff
review.reviewText: this place has obviously been around for a WHILE, but [although it shows,] it's for a reason. the location seems sketchy at first, but is no more so than the rest of the city, which you can get easy access to via its central location, and a very accomodating front desk staff that can help you find anything and everything you'd want to do, along with a way to get there. rooms, hallways, and elevator are small and simple with vintage appeal, but well maintained despite the age of the building. nothing too fancy, needs wifi, but it's a nice little place to hang your hat, shower, etc if you're planning to spend most of your time out and about. p.s. buddy system recommended if you plan on getting ice/visiting the vending machine.

review.title: The right price for a hotel with Internet
review.reviewText: No parking available that one doesn't pay for. The pictures on the hotel's web site make it look better and more comfortable than it actually is.

review.title: Great place at a great price
review.reviewText: I'm not sure what the negative reviewers here were expecting, but don't be fooled by them. Sure, the neighborhood isn't the greatest, but I never felt in danger during our 5 day stay. If you're that afraid of homeless people - go vacation in the country. The Monarch is a decent little hotel with all the necessary comforts in a very convenient part of town for tourists. There's lots to eat around the area, even late at night - which was a big bonus. Not only is it centrally located along several muni lines that go to tourist stops like the Wharf, the beach, the Castro, etc. - it was also a pretty short walk from the Bart to the airport.

review.title: Overall very pleasant, clean and safe.
review.reviewText: Overall very pleasant, clean and safe.

review.title: Charming hotel with old SF feel, not in best part of town
review.reviewText: Had charm of wood decor, antique elevator.

review.title: was there in the end of august.
review.reviewText: very nice hotel not far from union square i would stay there nex time

review.title: Good if you're trying to save some money.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean. The area is not the best part of town and from our room we could hear the busy street all night long. But if you're looking to save some money and don't mind a little noise I think that it's a pretty good deal.

review.title: Basic and perfect
review.reviewText: No frills, just a nice place to stay, especially for business. Only 1 block to the gym, and the bus is right out front.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel many times and it is just great. Reasonable price, clean, and friendly. It is right on the 38 bus line that can take you into Union Square.

review.title: Good for the relatively low price
review.reviewText: I was positively surprised by the hotel, given the low price for the room. It is ideal for people who don't want to spend huge amounts on a hotel room. It is very conveniently located. It might be difficult to find parking - we parked right in front of the hotel, but had to move the car early in the morning.

review.title: Comfort and affordability
review.reviewText: The Monarch is a nice old hotel that is in the perfect location if you want to be near Union Square. It is not a fancy hotel, but it is clean and comfortable.

review.title: Nice little place
review.reviewText: This was quite a nice hotel for the price, which was much less than other San Francisco hotels. My only complaint was the lack of AC in the room, but that is very common in SF. The ceiling fan, wall fan and windows that open were an adequate replacement for the lack of AC. Free wireless in the lobby!

review.title: bring earplugs
review.reviewText: Overall, okay place to stay for the money. However, if you're sensitive to noise at night, this might not be the place to stay. There were many sirens going off at night and people yelling outside the window. If you can deal with the noise, the room is very clean, comfortable, and spacious for San Francisco.

review.title: worst ever in San fFransico
review.reviewText: Where do I start. One ice machine located in the basement. Quite a long way from the 3rd floor. I called and confirmed parking policy. When we checked in they said they could not park a suv after I specifically asked if they were ant size restrictions and was told no. Front desk clerk could have cared less that this upset me. The queen bed was tiny, uncomfortable, and noisy. Our room sloped. Tiny TV. We have stayed at several small hotels in SF and always found them quaint and unique. Not this one.

review.title: Very Nice Employees
review.reviewText: I've stayed here 3 times now and really like it.

review.title: Featured on Ghost Hunters?!?
review.reviewText: Interesting hotel within 1.5 miles of Pier 39- elevator was a little creepy, but the room was nice enough. Great stay for the price.

review.title: Hotel review
review.reviewText: This hotel does not provide free parking, and the hotel front desk clerk yelled at me for accidently parking my vehicle at the service station ajacent to the hotel. Also, I stayed in this hotel for four nights, and they did not change my sheets at all. I do not recommend this hotel for anyone.

review.title: Really enjoyed this quaint old hotel
review.reviewText: I loved this place. It was clean and well maintained. The room was small but comfortable. They had all the amenities that I need - wireless internet, cable TV, hot and cold running water....... There were some negatives however. Number 1 being parking. The hotel has none. There is a garage a block away. The neighborhood is not great, but that would describe a large portion of San Francisco. The street noise in the room was pretty bad as well, but I did find it entertaining watching the goings on down below!

review.title: Monarch Hotel
review.reviewText: I was pleased with the hotel. Room and hotel in general were clean and room was well-supplied. Noise level was low. Hotel is centrally located. A minor complaint was the way bathroom sink water dripped to floor. But that was slight. Hotel is popular with Europeans. Many Europeans were there in May.

review.title: Clean room, everything inside the hotel was great!... sorrounding area... not so much...
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Our room was clean and ready when we got there. It's a little old but a lot of buildings in SF are.
