The staff even held our bags for us after check-out time, since we had some stuff to do before our flight. The area is a little scary. I wouldn't recommend going out at night alone in this area. Its pretty close to Fisherman's Wharf, which is good. All in all, the price was good for the proximity to tourist attractions, just a little scared of the people outside...

review.title: cant wait to go back!
review.reviewText: This was a fantastic hotel in the center of the city. A rare gem. The staff was pleasant and our room was comfortable. We used public transportation the entire weekend and enjoyed every minute. There was a movie theatre next to us, but we were so busy, we didnt get to see a movie. The $11.00 buss pass worked out well for us for each day. Youll enjoy too!!

review.title: Luxurious, excellent location, but a bit loud
review.reviewText: If you want to go sightseeing San Francisco, this hotel is located well. The only challenge we had was getting a healthy breakfast, but if you like pancakes, or other fat or sweet stuff, that is not a problem. The Wifi was rather instable, the personnel not very cheerful and the rooms a bit noisy, but other than that we had a perfect stay. Clean, good beds, nice furniture, parking around the corner, bus stop nearby. Excellent

review.title: We would stay there again
review.reviewText: Repeat stay. This hotel was great 2 years in a row. Close to buses and restaurants.Easy walking to main tourist attractions.Staff was courteous and pleasant.Excellent accomodations for the price.

review.title: Clean and Helpful, in the center of everthing
review.reviewText: I was staying and doing restaurant reviews, so I needed a central location. This was a perfect hotel, right on all muni lines. The staff was helpful with directions and suggestions. A really good value for the money. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel and you can actually sleep with the window open and not have the noise of the city wake you up.

review.title: Convenient Location!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and convenient! When we arrived the clerk was very helpful and we arrived very late at night. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and sincere. They even give you a map and coffe to start your day!!! I recommend this hotel for convenience to the MUNI transit system. The #38 Geary is right in front going west to Ocean Beach and Japan Town. If you walk a bit up hill (a block) you get to Van Ness Blvd. There you can catch the #47 Muni bus to Fishermans Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. This hotel is great for young couples and students looking for a great deal and ease of travel.

review.title: Good enough for the price. Rooms very comfy!
review.reviewText: The neighborhood may not be the best in San Francisco, but it is a great hotel to spend the night, that's it.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: This is no palace, but its no dump either. Sits on Geary Street which I found to be busy and lively. The hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin area, which people will tell you is sketchy. But having traveled to many cities of the world, SF feels v. safe to me and while the Tenderloin might not be the best area of the city, it feels relatively safe, no problems there. The hotel itself is basic but fine. You get what you pay for so don't expect too much! But the rooms are clean and the staff helpful. If you want to spend lots of time in your room look elsewhere, but for crashing at the end of the day it is just fine.

review.title: Affordable and convenient.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel. Friendly staff. Nothing fancy, but very affordable. Convenient neighborhood. If strip clubs and homeless people make you nervous, you should stay further east, because the neighborhood is seedy.

review.title: It's OK
review.reviewText: Good place for tourists

review.title: Reasonable Price, not a great location
review.reviewText: The price of the hotel was reasonable. The hotel itself is small and old. However, it is reasonably maintained. It was nearly a mile from Powell Station, the central station in SF. If you don't mind riding the bus there is plenty of bus stops near the hotel which will get you anywhere you need to go. If you are staying for leisure, buy the CityPass. It gets you unlimited 7 day bus/cable car fare, plus it gets you into some really good museums to see. If you like ethnic food the hotel is near several different types of restaurants. However, it is limited to the number of chains within a 4 block radius (with the exception of Mel's Diner). Overall the experience was positive. The hotel staff provided extra blankets when requested and provide useful information when requested. Parents should be forewarned that there is a porn shop across the street and a few strip clubs nearby. I can't fault the hotel for these issues since they hotel was most likely there before the others establishments moved in. Don't expect a high quality room, but an affordable one here.

review.title: Very good value for money
review.reviewText: If you can get by the slightly seedy but non- threatening area it's located in, the Monarch is a fine place to stay for a very low price using Expedia's special rate. It's not fancy but it has all the basics: a comfortable queen bed, heating, cable, a safe, and bathroom; it's also located close to major bus lines. My only negative is a lack of ESPN on the cable.

review.title: good hotel,though 20 min. walk from city centre.
review.reviewText: satisfactory hotel in respect of position & cleanliness, slightly distant from downtown but very near to the attractive town hall dome & san francisco famous trolley in california st. 24hr. hot drinks but in the lobby rather than the rooms.

review.title: For the money a great deal!
review.reviewText: Family emergency demanded a quick selection and it was a good bet. Staff was helpful, beds were comfortable, clean rooms, great morning breakfast, 24 hr. fresh coffee and tea in the lobby. Little internet service in room but very good in lobby. Reminded me of a European hotel. Ask for a room that does not face the front of the street--too much noise and adult entertainment business across the street.

review.title: eh...
review.reviewText: This hotel wasn't that bad as far as service goes, as there wasn't any waiting for check in and check out and there was always someone at the desk. the staff was very friendly. The location of this hotel wasn't very good, I didn't feel safe walking around without someone with me. The room temp was hard to maintain it was either too hot or too cold. I feel like I paid too much for what I got which was basically a bed. I could hear everything the other guests were doing under me and below me and even to the side of me. It just wasn't a good experiance at all. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone friends or strangers.

review.title: Good location and reasonably priced hotel
review.reviewText: Nice older hotel. Room and bed were very good. Bathroom a bit cramped. Lcation for opera and classiicalmusic is very good.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The hotel is cute. We had no problems with our room or the establishment itself. It's quite clean and well-maintained. This despite the fact that the neighborhood is pretty ghetto. Let me reiterate: this is one of the more ghetto areas of the city proper. Despite that, we had no issues with any crime or anything other than panhandlers.

review.title: Good Hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The rooms aren't the largest, but when you're in the city, there's too much to be doing, so you don't spend much time at the hotel. The location is on the edge of the tenderloin, on Geary Street, about a half block east of Van Ness St. There are A LOT of bums in the area, so you're gonna be pan handeled, but if you ignore them, they don't bother you too much.

review.title: good, basic lodging
review.reviewText: Despite the fact that we got the room next to the elevator, we were comfortable and the room was clean and neat. It was within reasonable walking distance to down town and the #49 bus was an easy trip to both the mission district and Ghirardelli Square and the Maritime Museum

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText: I was very comfortable.

review.title: Good Value for the money
review.reviewText: As most of the other reviewers have said, for the price in this area of the city it's fine. I will say that it is an old building with which they've done a great job of renovating, but it is noisy. If you do stay here, I highly recommend earplugs as just walking around causes the floors to creak. Also, while charming, the elevator is the old metal kind so you can hear the door creak closed and that can be annoying. I would recommend this hotel for the location, value and ease of getting to. And the wifi in my room works just fine!

review.title: Comfortable and Cheap
review.reviewText: The room and hotel were clean. Staff was helpful. Close to restaurants/buses, though not in the best part of town. Didn't have any trouble, but didn't feel terribly safe walking around at night alone.

review.title: Be ware
review.reviewText: Make sure you do your research before choosing this hotel. It is not in a good neighborhood, it smells, and the rooms have no air conditioning. Thank goodness we were there when it was very cold outside so we just left the window open, which I wouldn't have done if we were on the first floor because it was that scary. Right across the street is an adult dvd store with a "spa" next to it. On the corner are people 24/7 doing who knows what. The hotel staff wasn't very friendly or helpful. It was very disappointing.

review.title: EXPECT A LOT OF NOISE
review.reviewText: very thin walls and not in a good area

review.title: easy walk to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is not the greatest, but the staff (really just the front desk guy) is awesome. You might want to request a room as far away from the old school elevator as possible (it's noisy). BUT your location is SO close to Union Square. Considering that there is so much to do in SF that you won't be in the hotel much, the real estate is worth it.

review.title: Great character hotel for the traveler on a budget!
review.reviewText: The Monarch was a great choice for us four young adult men on a budget minded vacation. It's reasonably priced to stay there, and it's only a short walk away from all the major city bus and cable car routes. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in the daytime there, because there is just so much to see and do when in San Francisco! It's close to some great diners and bars, and at times it seemed to be a little noisy outside, but overall The Monarch gives you a great bang for your dollar. It may not be the perfect place to bring a young family, but it was perfect for us four guys who were looking to take in all the sights and nightlife around San Francisco.

review.title: Hideaway in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great room for the price. The street was very noisy.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: good central location for the money. if you can get a bus pass, there are bus routes to almost every SF attraction within a block in every direction. the neighborhood wasn't as scary as other reviewers indicated, but it was sometimes noisy at night, so you might want to bring earplugs. staff was very nice. no frills, but free coffee and wi-fi. No A/C, but don't need it in SF. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: My room was near some sort of public restroom and a stairwell, so it was constantly noisy. And it also had a weird smell. The staff did their job but were not overly friendly. Also, it's in a slightly sketchy area, so didn't really feel safe after dark.

review.title: could've been better
review.reviewText: i understand the location, and the cheapness of the hotel, but it was hard to get good customer service while there. whenever i asked a question, i got a look of "why are you asking me that." i expected a little more than i got.

review.title: Great for the money
review.reviewText: Good hotel! Central location. The neighborhood is a bit seedy, but nothing bad. The staff is nice, and the room was clean. The television did not work well and the shower wasn't the best (although it got the job done), but nothing to keep me from staying there again.

review.title: get what you pay for
review.reviewText: This was a good hotel, I mean is not luxurious or anything, but come on... you're barely at your hotel anyway. It's in a good spot for the price (seven blocks to union square, 5 blocks to Civic Center and 7 blocks to market st. I had no problem with the wireless service as many people say. I'll definitely stay there again

review.title: WILL BE BACK NEXT YEAR!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located just a few blocks from the Civic Center and Bart station which is great. We were there the weekend of the SF Pride festivals and were able to walk to all the celebrations without a problem. The front desk was friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable.

review.title: no stars
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Monarch two nights, You can hear noises from other bathrooms. The ceiling fan in my room didn't work. Noises from street will wake you up early in the morning. I made my own bed. The room wasn't cleaned once when I was there.

review.title: Not good enough
review.reviewText: Old building,old facility. Staff are not that kind. Room is just ok.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: The best thing that get going for this hotel is its location. If you visit during a holiday weekend, you can usually find a parking space within 2 or 3 blocks of the hotel. There is street noise coming through, so ask for a room higher up. Walls are a bit thin so you can hear muffled conversation from the next room. We have stayed in this hotel several times before, this is the first time that we experienced being woke up from a loud agrument from next door, followed by door slamming.

review.title: hmm...
review.reviewText: all i didn't like is that something (some little thing) went missing.

review.title: No frills but clean and good service
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel because of the ratings from previous customers. It held true to those ratings. It is an old hotel with no frills, but it is clean, the staff is very friendly, the price is right and the location is about 7-8 blocks (about a 10 min walk) from Union Square. Neighborhood is a little "run down" but I had no problems. I was there on the "record heat" day and there is no A/C but it was still okay with the ceiling fan.

review.title: OVERALL GOOD
review.reviewText: MONARCH NICE FOR WEEKEND ADVENTURE.

review.title: clean
review.reviewText: no breakfast in the morning. hotel was clean. good location. hotel was cheap.

review.title: The price is right
review.reviewText: While the hotel is not luxurious, the rooms are comfortable enough. The staff at the front desk is generally helpful, and the room cleaners--while knowing virtually no English--are polite. Note that there is no continental breakfast, but there is 24-hour coffee available in the lobby. The Wi-Fi was intermittent at best, and typically did not work in my room. The neighborhood of the hotel is not ideal, but, then again, I didn't see any areas during my admittedly short trip that were completely lacking in seediness, the homeless, and malodor. In short, the neighborhood is not that bad. I'd stay again if on a budget.

review.title: No Frills Stay In San Francisco
review.reviewText: Have stayed in this hotel 5 times. We like it becuase it is inexpensive and located near very convinient bus routes. The hotel overall is clean but basic. A place to stay if you plan on not spending to much time in your room. About a 6 minute walk from union square and bus route 19 takes you right to the warf. It is located in an area that really does not cater to tourists, so you will be around more locales and will see street people in the area. Walking toward the warf on Polk Street there are countless restuarants and eateries all catering to the locales includung the famous Swan Oyster Depot. Hotel located in area that is geared more for the adventureful. Definitly not like staying on the touristy warf or union square but more of a real feel for the city. If you need feel of the tourist areas this is not the place for you. For others it may be the place for you. Clean But Basic.

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: It's an ok place, the neighborhood starts to change right where the hotel is, so I'm not sure is the safest area there, but it was ok. for the price it was fine, but next time, I'll try some place closer to Union Square maybe, just so I can feel safer.

review.title: Works for me
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable, staff was friendly. If you're not used to the city, or uptight at all, the location may not work for you, but I had no problem with it. The area had plenty of "local color", but I never felt unsafe. This is the SF I enjoy- a little rough around the edges, but real. And like I said before, no complaints about the hotel at all.

review.title: Can't beat the price!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a bad part of town, we didn't incounter any trouble though. You can't beat the price and it isn't too shabby of a place. I would def go back!

review.title: Good value, but nothing impressive
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, and the personnel was friendly, but my room's heater didn't work, and the wireless internet was almost completely useless (20KB/s max speed, and consistent disconnections). Other guests were quiet, but soundproofing was not good, so if they weren't, it would've been loud. Overall the stay was worth what I paid for it, but not much more.

review.title: internet
review.reviewText: Wireless internet does not work well. You may feel annoyed. Other things seem O.K.

review.title: Not very nice
review.reviewText: This hotel was dirty, there was no do not disturb sign, so housekeepers woke us up three mornings in a row. In a shady part of town that had multiple porn shops, strip clubs, and smelled of urine and puke. Charged $21 a nigh to "park" our car, when the car was never moved to their lot, instead left in their loading zone all night. Based on this stay, we have no desire to go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Good Value for your $
review.reviewText: This old hotel has been remodeled and the rooms have new carpets, and new bathrooms. Very clean and great service. It is kind of noicy at nights because of neighborly clubs/pubs, but that's what you get by staying in a centric area. The heater looks like an antique, but works perfectly.

review.title: I can wait to go back
review.reviewText: The room that I had in monarch hotel did not smell good.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: It's near a seedy part of town but not too bad. I'd stay there again.

review.title: I guess it was a good deal, but not THAT much of a good deal.
review.reviewText: It was cramped and noisy. They didn't even have fitted sheets for the beds. The towels were rough and tattered. I am in no hurry to go back.

review.title: hotel OK neighbourhood not
review.reviewText: the place was OK for the price I suppose, and not far from Union square. Main problem is all the liqor stores which attract a shady clientele in the vincinity. Place was relatively clean ( the beds were anyway) but could use a coat of paint. Yoou get what you pay for .

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText: nice & clean rooms . All that was missing was a tv remote

review.title: Not at all satisfied - had to stay one extra night eventhough I did not want to !!!
review.reviewText: I made a reservation at this hotel over with expedia for 4 nights since I didn't know how my trip was going to workout. Arriving at San Francisco I realized that I only wanted to stay for 3 nights instead of 4 nights as previously booked. I called Expedia that called the Hotel management and they said that I would still have to pay for the 4th night even if I left the hotel one night earlier because it was booked this way and I could not change any thing. I was very unhappy with the fact that they could not refund my last night (previously paid to expedia), and that I had to stay in town for one more night eventhough I didn't want to, otherwise I would loose this money and have to pay to stay at a hotel at the next city I was travelling. I'm very disapointed with both the Hotel management and Expedia due to their lack of effort to make things happen. Whenever I come back to San Francisco I will never stay at this Hotel any more!

review.title: Good Enough
review.reviewText: For those who do not require their Hotel to be top of the line,the Monarch is good enough. In a pretty tough part of town, but people are friendly and accomodating - good local spots up the road, so no need to order in.Recommended for those who travel alone.

review.title: lukewarm about this hotel - cheap but you pay the price
review.reviewText: When I got to this hotel after my flight on a Saturday, I did appreciate how they accomodated me with an early check-in around 10:30am. So I wanted to crash for a little while before the conference that evening. Unfortunately there was a jack hammer right outside the hotel digging up the sidewalk. So I asked if I can switch rooms but it wasn't possible. So I just went sight-seeing. However there is building construction going on right across the street. So do not plan on sleeping in past 7am if you're there Monday through Sat. The room was clean, I was able to use my wireless connection in the hotel fairly well and I was above the 5th floor but there is no ethernet port if you plan on plugging in you must have wireless. This hotel serves its purpose if you want to go sightseeing in the bay area and stay in a cheap hotel and don't stay up late because you're Not sleeping in. It is a very old building with a kind of an old fashioned closet elevator that makes lots of creeking noises. I met a girl at the conference that was going to hang out with me that night and when she went to drop me off she said I was in a bad neighborhood and there was absolutely nowhere to park. So that was the end of my date. That's the other thing the public transportation is excellent but this part of town and this hotel is not car-friendly. Overall I would not stay here again, I would fork out the extra cash and stay in a nicer place.

review.title: Sanctuary in the tenderloin
review.reviewText: Yes there are many homeless people in this area but they are not overly disruptive. We were able to walk to our destinations without difficulty. It was unfortunate that there was building construction happening next door during our stay. It was centrally located for the activities we wanted to attend.

review.title: Hotel should never have been rated what it was, because it is way lower.
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed with the hotel you offered. The neighborhood was horrible. The hotel was surrounded by triple X rated sex shops, movies, etc. and the street people camping all around. Your rating for the hotel on a family package was overrated. The rooms were postage stamp size with paint and plaster peeling away from ceilings and walls. Baggies of illegal drugs under the mattress, bus transfers dated August 9th under the beds. (I have pictures to show you if you wish). Police with lights and sirens arriving at the bars and sex shops across the street at all hours. Then the topper was they wanted to charge me for one of the rooms for 2 nights. I spent over an hour on the phone with you while your agent called the hotel. It was finally 4 hours later to get the call from the hotel, blaming you for the errors. Is this your normal operation? Offer hotels at star values higher than they should be. Not telling the customer with small children the neighborhood is a bad one? I expected much more from expedia. How very disappointed I was with the hotel, neighborhood and expedia. I will be telling all my friends what expedia did for us on this trip.

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: great location. very friendly and accomodating staff. walls somewhat thin.

review.title: Nice hotel - Centralized location.
review.reviewText: On our way to the hotel, I was not at all impressed by the surroundings of the hotel. To me, it reminded me of like a bad part of Los Angeles. The street was very dirty, and there was homeless people everywhere. When we walked into the hotel, I was very impressed with the cleanliness and the professional courtesy of the hotel and their staff. When I return to San Francisco for vacation, I would definitely keep this hotel in mind as a place to stay.

review.title: Would stay there when in town.
review.reviewText: For the price, this is a great hotel. I have stayed on Geary Street before for the same price in a hotel much inferior to Monarch hotel. Would definitely recommend friends and family.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: Over all it is ok for the price. My only gripe is that my room is right next to the elevator, which is quite loud and can disturb sleeping.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Monarch was a great place to stay. It was clean, offered a reasonably-priced cafe in the lobby, and had so much nostalgic charm! The hotel was also on a bus line, and was conveniently close to several lines to classic San Franciscan tourist sites. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Bay Area. The only downfall was that the hotel parking garage was full (apparently it has very few spaces), so plan on paying at least $18 each night because there is no on-street parking.

review.title: Exactly what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel was nothing special, but for the price offered, it ends up being exactly what you would ask for. It's a place to stay for a bargain price. Although our clothes iron leaked water and the pillows were really deflated. But service was satisfactory.

review.title: Loved San Francisco, but not the Monarch Hotel
review.reviewText: The service at the front desk was horrible...they were rude, except for one gentleman who was very nice and helpful (I left my camera in my rental car and I had them park the car for me...the other guys said they didn't see a camera, but when we asked the young gentleman who worked the graveyard shift Saturday night if he could look for my camera, 15 minutes later, he appeared at my room and handed me my camera). The room I had reserved did not have the amenities that I had asked for when booking. The only highlight of staying at the Monarch Hotel was that across the street there's a lounge/bar/club which was a lot of fun on Saturday night. The lounge/bar/club gets packed, but it's worth it...great music, people, and drinks! =) Overall, the Monarch Hotel sucks...I was very disappointed with the hotel...next time I go to SF, I'm going to stay elsewhere.

review.title: I would recommend
review.reviewText: this hotel, after reading reviews I hoped it wasn't as bad as they were saying, since I had to get 2 rooms. The hotel service was good, & there was a parking garage around the corner. Now that was a plus! As for the homeless people I was not bothered,for they too are only looking for a place to sleep & not begging for money like they are in the day. As for traffic noise, one should expect that in the city..Overall this is a well kept hotel, clean rooms & for the price I've paid in the past to stay in S.F. which were more & not clean I've realized that sometimes more dollars doesn't mean a better place to stay.

review.title: Great price for a comfortable stay!
review.reviewText: The Monarch proved to be perfect for a reasonably priced three-night leisure stay in San Francisco. The valet service was convenient, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and it was located with easy access to public transportation. There are plenty of eateries and stores nearby if needed and the bus around the corner takes you straight to Pier 39. My only complaints: the elevator was slow and rickety, and the struggling ice machine was inconveniently located in the basement. Don't recommend walking around the hotel at night alone.

review.title: San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: Even thou that hotel is modest is good combination what you get of price/quality

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel guide is not good.

review.title: Nice, Inexpensive Hotel
review.reviewText: It is great for the price! Nice and friendly staff.

review.title: The worse experience ever!!!!
review.reviewText: Where to start! this was a horrible experience. I arrived at the hotel at 11pm aprox, to find out that all the parking was taken. The clerk told me that I was on my own and would have to park in the structure 3 to 4 blocks away (and $20 overnight parking). I was tired so I went where I was told, the walk back to the hotel was scary as there were drunks and homeless people all over the streets. The clerk at the front desk was rude and demanded my credit card in order to check me in. I gave it to him but I told him that I had paid everything through Expedia, he demanded my credit card and charged $12.50. At this point all I wanted to do was get to my bed, and get to a phone to call en Expedia operator. To my surprise, the noise inside the hotel was horrible! My room faced Geary Ave, a very bussy street but to top things off, there was an adult video store directly across from my room. The noise and the fights (not to mention the police sirens)did not allow me to sleep at all. The room was dirty, the beds were unconfortable and the number of pillows was limited to one per bed! In a queen bed I was at least expecting two. I checked out first thing in the morning. I had to fight in order to get a receipt that stated that I had not used the phone or any other charges, mind you, the charges have not been taken off my credit card after 5 days.

review.title: so-so and cheap
review.reviewText: horrible wireless.

review.title: Good budget option
review.reviewText: I would definitely return to this hotel. Although nothing exceptional, for the price in a city known for expensive accommodation, it certainly fits the bill. The room was large enough with 2 double beds, it was clean and there were plenty of fresh towels and face cloths in the bathroom. I expect rooms facing onto Geary could be quite noisy, but fortunately we were in a room round at the side. The only negative is the area which is slightly shady, the hotel is opposite an "adult store" and the streets around are a bit shabby, however south of Geary seems far worse than the streets towards the north, so the Monarch escapes the scruffiest parts. In short though, good hotel in convenient location, worth the money and I would go back

review.title: Cheap stay, area not that bad
review.reviewText: If you are coming from a big city then this area of town is not scary at all (NOTE: stay away from Turk st.) Hotel room was quite clean. There is a lot of road noise but again if you are use to being in a city then it is not bad. Close to the subway (3 blocks) which connects to the airport.

review.title: smelly and noisy
review.reviewText: weird smell in the room very poor sound proofing bugs

review.title: Excellent for budget travelers
review.reviewText: Pleased with the location and service. Rooms were well kept. THe neighborhood is fine if you are used to cities, if not it could be intimidateing.

review.title: I would recommend it, good value for the rate.
review.reviewText: This is centrally located in the city. Easy access to bus and train. Easy to get to tourist area like Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: A decent hotel
review.reviewText: The Monarch Hotel is a typical, traditional hotel very close to Union Square and within a reasonable distance from most of the city. Other reviews have mentioned that the area is rough, and though it may have 'character', I had no trouble at all during my stay and quickly became comfortable and familiar with Geary Street and its surroundings (although as you get further down from Union Square, it's possibly not the best place for young families). The hotel itself provides free coffee and drinks in the lobby throughout the day, the bathrooms are clean and the rooms are nice and spacious. I would recommend investing in a quality plug adaptor as my UK to USA converter did not work with the older hotel fixtures.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: It was a good stay. Got pretty much what I paid for. The room was small and comfortable. The only problem was that the floors were squeky. Oh and the elevator took forever, but I was only on the 2nd floor so I didn't mind. It was a very good location. There was a bus stop right in front of the hotel. The valet service was quick. I would definately stay here again!

review.title: Pretty good. Nice price.
review.reviewText: Just as a caution, this hotel is in fact located in the Tenderloin District. But Nothing to be worried about. Area was nice, rooms were comfy. A perfect place for young people, or anyone just looking for a nice, clean budget place to stay. Staff was awesome and always helpful.

review.title: Great location, 6 blocks from cable cars.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price, great locations

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel had a stale dank odor. My allergies were going insane. NOt in the safest part of the city. Caution if you are traveling alone or with a young family.

review.title: Noisy hotel
review.reviewText: The wall of the hotel is essentially an all-sound-pass entity. Whenever there is a car or siren passing by the street, you will hear it, even during your sleep.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: only problem: noisy street

review.title: Great hotel for price and location
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for eight nights at the end of October and have to say I couldnt have been happier with what I got! The hotel was clean and well kept, certainly the area left a lot to be desired but I still felt save walking around late at night and it was only a short walk to union square. When I go back to san francisco this is where I will stay!

review.title: Monarch Hotel is a good place to stay
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is perfect for tourist especially if this is your first visit to San Francisco. Close to China Town and very easy to get Golden Gate Bridge. 15 minutes walk to georgeous City Hall building. Hotel also provide refrigerator in your room to put your drink or food. However, they don't provide microwave to heat up your own food. As we know that parking space in downtown SF is very limited, so vallet parking is the best solution. I very recommend this hotel to stay.

review.title: Good hotel, bad area.
review.reviewText: I have stayed here several times over th years and have been satisfied for the price. My lasy stay has made me reconsider going back. The rooms are basic but clean, and I feel safe in the hotel, but the area seems to be getting much less safe and Very loud all night long. Seriously think about taking a taxis at night.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: This is within walking distance to Union Square, etc. The walls are thin, BUT I would trade that for cleanliness in a second. It is amazingly clean, great price. They valet your car for you (albeit at a $21 rate), Tommy's joint is right up the block (Awesome buffalo meatloaf and cornbeef sandwiches), FREE wireless internet and the staff is fairly friendly. I am a real stickler for clean and this was clean enough for me. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Totally Fine
review.reviewText: Rented it for a night to party in the city and it worked great - centrally located, affordable, and actually much nicer than I expected - great hotel.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very, very, very, very, VERY thin walls - my girlfriend had trouble sleeping in this hotel, and when I woke up Saturday morning listening to the kid next door's cartoons, I realized why. The neighborhood is also pretty seedy, and there's a good chance you'll hear the raves and drunken madness going on outside as well. Interior was basically okay, with the emphasis on basic. No frills. Recommended if you're on a budget and need to be within a 10-minute walk to union square.

review.title: Okay, but bring earplugs
review.reviewText: The room were clean, but I couldn't sleep the first night because it was too loud. But the next day we could change the room and the scond night was much more quiet. But if you don't have a car all is reaaly goo to walk.

review.title: I would stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean. Yes there was a faint musty smell in the air, but come on, it's not a 5 star hotel. We had fresh towels and there was all the necessary toiletry. Our room was cleaned everyday and there was complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. No, not Starbucks coffee! For those of you who are wondering (like I was) yes, there's a hairdryer and an iron and ironing board. We had a good size TV and plenty of space to put our luggage etc. The bathroom is tight, but it's got what you need. Overall, we got more than we expected for what we paid.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: very small room, no parking becides vallet and vallet very expensive. thin walls, lots of loud traffic all day and all night. carpet very very dirty. cheap price compared to some others around, but next time i will pay the extra money not to stay there.

review.title: not the best pick for business travelers
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel because it was suppose to have wireless access included. Once I got there, I tried connecting to their wireless network, but it was not very helpful. I did get a connect, but their wireless router apparently wasn't giving out IP addresses. Kind of an interesting way to have wireless connections without actually allowing internet access through an ISP. Well, I called downstairs and their only advice was "try it in the lobby". I did that, and it was no better obviously because the connection to the router was fine. It was their router and ISP setup that wasn't working. I wasn't even getting an ip address. So I told them I wasn't getting an ip address, and they said "I don't know". No more assistance was provided, and I was without internet access for my trip, which was very disappointing. One of the lamps by the bed was out, which I called downstairs about. The light was never fixed the three days I was there. Aside from the internet access issue and lack of any customer support there, the room itself was decent but not good. The noise from the streets below was loud and annoying. Loud cars with no mufflers seemed to frequent the area, and they like to buzz the block for some reason. Right across from the entrance was a "massage parlor"/adult video store. Lots of beggars seemed to frequent the corners around the hotel as well... It wasn't the worst of spots in the city, granted, but there are certainly better places to stay.

review.title: worst of the hotels we stayed on this trip
review.reviewText: bathroom tap leaking; towels were not starched.room smelt 'Musty'. No coffee making facilities in the room.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: I had a terrific week end in this hotel at only few blocks from Union sq.

review.title: Great value for the money
review.reviewText: This was my second stay in a year at the Monarch. For the very reasonable Expedia price, it delivered great value. It's ideally situated for those with commitments in the Civic Center area a half dozen blocks away. It's a little bit farther to touristy Union Square, but public bus service is frequent and dependable. Don't book the Monarch if you are looking for high thread count linens and luxury room service; do book the Monarch if you want a comfortable room with friendly desk staff. Many restaurants nearby including Mel's Diner a half block away, California Pizza Kitchen and Max's Opera Cafe five blocks away. Ask for a quiet room away from Geary Avenue traffic.

review.title: fair price
review.reviewText: a fair price however... for the middle of the week an early check in or a late check out should not be a problem. They did a great job on the early check in but fell short on the late check out. Since I was there on business I wanted to check out at 2pm instead of 12pm. The latest check out I could get was 1230pm the occupancy was low enough that it should not have been a problem

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was fine for the price. Our bed sheets weren't changed from the guests before us, but they gave us another room that was clean. Although knowing that they didn't change the sheets made me a little uneasy about what else was not cleaned. There are some homeless people around the area, but it seems pretty safe. I would reccomment it if you are on a budget. They offer valet parking for $23/day.

review.title: Depends on your expectations.
review.reviewText: I used to live in the neighborhood -- so I sort of new what I was getting into. The Monarch is not in a great neighborhood but, if you are looking for a centrally located San Francisco hotel and don't want to spend a ton, the Monarch will do the trick. It is generally clean, there is always someone at the desk, and the room is pretty standard (cable, desk, closet safe, etc.) for most hotels -- all in all very satisfactory depending on your expectations.

review.title: Ok for budget
review.reviewText: We arrived very late and checked in with minimal fuss. We walked to the hotel from Union Sq carrying backpacks which seemed like a considerable walk. During daytime the walk to Union Sq was ok but did become tiresome by the end of our stay. The room was clean, however it was overshadowed by other tall buildings, lighting was poor which made the room quite dark. This was fine for us as we chose to spend the majority of our time seeing the area. No air con but the ceiling fan worked and even in the middle of summer this was more than adequate. In general an ok place to stay and I would consider staying here again if I were on the same budget.

review.title: Decent place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located, has average service and the rooms were OK given the age of the hotel. This is perfect for the budget traveler...

review.title: Good economy hotel
review.reviewText: Not perfect, but not bad either. The hotel itself is in good condition, albiet old. The staff were curteous and helpful. The stairways are extremely narrow, and the elevator was definitely retrofitted and a bit sketchy. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom sink drained very slowly, but never caused any problems. Very convienent location (walk to Union Square and Japan Town), though a bit of a bad neighborhood.

review.title: Don't go there!
review.reviewText: No parking lot available, bad reception service. Very old room and no comforts inside. No air-conditioning and heating. First time an expedia hotel was so bad!

review.title: Fine for a cheap bed
review.reviewText: This hotel is not ideal if you plan on spending quality time in your room, or enjoy a stroll of the surrounding area. Although not too far from union square - 20 mins walk - the hotel seems to be a few blocks too far and is surrounded by massage parlours, sex shops and tramps. There is also a salsa-style music fan that lives nearby that occasionally plays fiesta music at full blast at 3am. However if you're only looking for a low cost place to bed down and don't mind getting taxis at night (or walking quickly) then this hotel is fine. It's cheap with a big TV and is a lot more comfortable than most hostels.

review.title: Be careful with your car
review.reviewText: Not a good neighborhood. Too many homeless around. Noisy, especially in the rooms facing the Geary St., where there is a bar. But, most of all, be careful with your car. Although I could not prove it and they have denied it, I believe they damaged my car while they parked it. If you decide to stay in this hotel anyway, be sure to check your car every time you deliver it to and receive it from the valet. Suggestion: there are lots of hotels closer to the Union Square and many parking lots nearby where you can park your car yourself.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice older hotel. Well cared for. Does not have air conditioning but you don't need it. Our room had a ceiling fan and that was all that was needed. We stayed on the 6th floor, yes there was an elevator. The room was just like any other standard 2 bed room with a refrigerator, bathroom, large closet and in room safe. We walked everywhere and did not worry about our safety at all in and around the hotel. I would stay there again.

review.title: It is great that the hotel is downtown
review.reviewText: The Hotel is fine. It is great that the hotel is downtown. And for this price the hotel is really good.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. It was very clean and offered comfort. I would definitely stay here again for the price, however, the area where the hotel is in is not the best. But it's definitely not so bad that I was scared. It's a quick walk to Union Square where everything is including the cable cars.

review.title: Budget traveling!
review.reviewText: The Monarch hotel is perfect for budget travelers. You get exactly what you need in a hotel room. If you are looking to spend more time in a hotel vs. spending time in the city then you may want to look elsewhere. For the purpose of a quaint,clean place to stay, friendly staff and convenient location, this is a perfect choice.

review.title: 3 day stay at Monarch Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, about 10 minutes walk from Union Square. Only slight drawback was the climb to get back up to it after a trip down town.

review.title: the hotel was so bad experiance in san francisco. the reception guy so tuff rods, and not helpful wh
review.reviewText: the hotel so old and the place can be nice but it is really in a bad area in downtown

review.title: Good Enough
review.reviewText: It was equal to the price paid. Not impressive but good enough.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean. The best deal I have found in San Francisco.

review.title: good location, but not worth it
review.reviewText: this hotel is 5-6 blocks fron Union Square but the employees are not the "nicest" people. The roon didn't smell good.

review.title: a great deal and a good way to stay in san francisco
review.reviewText: located a little under a mile from powell st station. a nice walk if you go north on powell and west on geary. also a bus line (#38) will take you for $1.50. nice, clean, safe place to stay. a great bargain in a great town. free coffee all day in the lobby. careful...no ac, but was not an issue for us in the cool bay area weather ( in june!). movie theatre one block away. food all over.

review.title: Decent location. Clean, inexpensive.
review.reviewText: The staff were extremely brusk, inattentive, even rude at times. Other than that, the hotel is a bit tiny but well maintained. Its not the best neighberhood, but I seen much worse in SF and it within walking distance of Union Square, China Town, etc. Hotel also did not offer any parking. They did have a loading zone for dropping off baggage, but this area was completely full when we arrived. Not my first choice but a decent place to flop if you can't find anything else.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Monarch based on other reviews, and yes, I brought my own hair dryer. The only problem was that when I used it, the bathroom lights went out. There were no other outlets available, but when I waited for the wiring to cool down, I could use the dryer for a few minutes until it got too hot again. It was very inconvenient as I was getting ready for a business appointment. In addition,the street noise was the worst I have experienced in SF and there was no coffee pot in the room - a pretty standard amenity these days. I won't go back.

review.title: Dissappointed
review.reviewText: Noisy, no parking.

review.title: Great rates; only real drawback is the area
review.reviewText: Like a lot of smaller, older hotels in big cities, this one has its limitations: space is tight and street noises are noticeable. But it's clean, and the staff are friendly and helpful. (Don't pay attention to the really negative reviews.) Just note that the hotel is located in a two- or three-square-block area that's a little run-down. It's not a slum by any means, and if you walk three blocks in any direction, you'll be in an upscale area. I never felt unsafe during the day. Just pay attention at night. That's the trade-off you get for some really good rates.

review.title: Bad Neighborhood
review.reviewText: We selected this hotel because it was close to where we had to do business. We didn't care for the neighborhood - it was very "seedy". The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but clean. I would recommend the hotel if it were in a better neighborhood.

review.title: not a bad deal for the money...
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, but for the price I thought the cleanliness, location, dining area, breakfast, service, etc. were well above average. The only complaint I have would be the noise from the street(close to a fire station). Another plus was that the TV also had four movie channels(HBO and Encore) which was above the norm(no ESPN, however but who goes to SF to watch TV?). Nice old motel.

review.title: Okay for the price
review.reviewText: I know that San Francisco is a more expensive location, though the hotel does not really offer more comfort than a simple 60$ motel room. Staff was friendly and helpful. Located in the Tenderloin district you will find yourself in walking distance to the Market Center. Good Thing: A bus station on the other side of the street (78) which runs west...east and Van Ness right around the corner (with more bus lines). Neighborhood could be better, you will encounter a lot of shady people around but this is the price for staying central I guess.

review.title: terrible
review.reviewText: if you don't like it you can check out, but no money back.

review.title: Cheap, and you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Quite a bare minimum hotel. The location is not too distant from the "center" (Cable Car on Market St, you can walk for a while or take a bus for a few minutes), but the area is not the best, sandwiched in between many adult cinemas and clubs (one is right across the street), and somewhat ran-down; not a place I felt safe at night. The rooms are tiny and with minimal utilities, but it's an older building so the ceiling is higher than average. I did spot a cockroach on my wall in one instance, but otherwise it seemed reasonably clean, and the staff is polite enough (they let me check in early... not that they looked busy). In my case I had to get up early so I went back to the hotel while it was still light out, then slept and went to breakfast somewhere else, never to return until the evening, so for these conditions it was passable. They seemed to offer a wifi connection, but it was usually too slow to even load up Google... and the only power plug was in the bathroom.

review.title: More than the price you pay for!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were in SF in early May, 2006 and stayed at Monarch for 3 nights. The hotel is very clean and a convenient 15 minutes walk to the Union Square. An Olympic Cafe nearby popular for its various omelette chocies a nice experience for breakfast. The main bus line 38 on Geary stop just across the Hotel. Nice coffee available at the Lobby whole day. We were very happy with our stay.

review.title: hotel review
review.reviewText: Below my excpectation.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: I liked the Monarch, and the price was quite amazing. My only gripe was the bottom flat sheet that was on top of a flimsy mattress pad. Those arrangements, not at just this hotel, come untucked and are uncomfortable. Other than that, this was a very pleasant and well-located place, was clean with friendly and efficient service. when I need to stay overnight in San Francisco, the Monarch will be my top priority.

review.title: Would stay again...
review.reviewText: Hey your basically sleeping there anyway! Hotel staff was polite, not overly friendly but pleasant. Bathroom didn't have an exhaust fan, beds were comfortable, and clean. Try to request room not facing geary as ours was a bit noisy, due to the night life across the street, all in all would stay again, not a bad room for the price that is for sure!

review.title: Not a bad place if you're on a budget
review.reviewText: The Monarch Hotel in SF is a great deal if you're travelling on a budget. The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Also, the hotel had HBO, so I didn't have to miss the Sopranos. I felt that while the neighborhood wasn't the greatest, it was certainly better than staying at any place on Market Street, plus it was on 2 major bus lines and about a 5-10 minute walk to Union Square. I would definitely stay here again if I was visiting SF on a limited income.

review.title: Ideal Location and price
review.reviewText: hotel in ideal location very clean and comfortable staff not overhelpful but ok excellent for getting about and good chinese takeway/sit in on polk street. loved San Francisco and will return on day soon.

review.title: For the Price it was fine!
review.reviewText: We attended the Real Estate Expo in March. We got in on a Friday night after a delayed flight from Denver. Other than the reception being a lukewarm our check in was flawless and our room was clean and comfortable. The closet was a challenge to get into, the armoire was in the way. And the towels were a bit on the thin side. Shampoos were not new, but refilled... yuk. I would refer anyone to this hotel for the price and cleanliness only if one did not plan to spend more time than necessary in your room. The neighborhood definitely has character!

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: I had an excellent stay at the Monarch. The room was very basic and small, but that's to be expected in San Francisco. Being able to wake up and take in the view out the window towards the TransAmerica building is a definite plus (try to get an east-facing room). It's located just south of Japantown and is within walking distance of Chinatown. I highly recommend the Monarch for any stay in the city.

review.title: a little far from the downtown
review.reviewText: above all, this is a good choice where offered comfortable and quite room.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: the place was cheap, the rooms are small but clean, there are no fancy services, but you get the stuff that counts (an airport shuttle at 5:30 AM), I would stay there again

review.title: Hotel was fine
review.reviewText: While not in the greatest neighborhood, I thought the Monarch hotel was fine. I didn't have any problems; check in and out was quick and easy; and I was able to walk to the Fillmore for a concert.

review.title: Decent room, excellent location
review.reviewText: The room was not extremely upscale but it was comfortable, clean and quiet. Many nice attractions are within walking distance. If you aren't going to spend an inordinate amount of time in the room, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel for the price!
review.reviewText: I stayed here in July for a week and I had no problems. It was a little loud a few times at night from the the noise on the streets, so Id recommend an inside room next time. Its not in the cleanest part of town but I had no problems. It was convenient to all the hot spots and the staff was very friendly & helpful. I would say the bathroom was a tad cramped but other than that I'd stay there again.

review.title: Hidden Gem in SF
review.reviewText: This place is nice, it is very cost effective and centrally located. I am surprised they are charging as little as they are for what you get.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a week. The staff were extremely polite and very helpful in answering our questions. They even check us earlier than expected. It is convenient to the bus stops going to the different directions around San Francisco. About 4-5 blocks is a BART station to go to other parts of interest. If we go back, that is a place we are definitley staying. It is affordable and reasonable and you get more than you bargained for.

review.title: Good Value and Convenient
review.reviewText: This is the second time I have stayed at the Monarch. The staff is friendly and quite helpful. The property is quite well-located, within walking distance of the Civic Center, Opera House, Symphony, Union Square, Japantwon, and St. Mary's Cathedral. Most of the legit theatres are on Geary. There is a cineplex just around the corner on Van Ness. Coming from the airport on the BART (subway), it is about a ten minute walk from the Civic Center stop. There are good bus connections on Geary and Van Ness. Mel's Diner is just around the corner, and other eating options line Van Ness. The hotel is, however, right across from an adult store, and the neighborhood, while safe enough, is not posh. I felt comfortable there, the rooms are perfectly fine, they are good value for SF, but like many other areas of SF, there are panhandlers and loiterers around.

review.title: Convenient, close to downtown without costing an arm and a leg
review.reviewText: I really like this old nostalgic hotel.

review.title: Lovely place - will go back to stay
review.reviewText: Convenient location on buslines and only 10-11 blocks to Union Square and 3 more to Chinatown so easy to walk. Great breakfast. More European in feel but nice size private bathroom. Plenty of tour groups from other countries so active lobby. Quite room.

review.title: OK, not more
review.reviewText: The hotel is a bit old and the area seems a bit unsecure.

review.title: Good hotel for a budget traveler
review.reviewText: If you need a hotel in San Francisco downtown that is not too expensive but fairly good I can recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: The worst service I've ever seen
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is nice because is near Union Square, BUT the area is dangerous, there is no parking space and the service was TERRIBLE. The man who attended me was rude and didn't alloud me to see the paper I was signing...when I asked If I could see the paper, he said no because "it is my paper and you cannot see", so I asked him to take the paper out for me to sign, but he was very ironic and extremely rude...this made the beggining of my trip VERY STREESED!!!!

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: You get more than what you pay for. For being in a fairly centrally located area, you are getting a good price. The hotel has old school charm with an old style elevator and narrow steps. The rooms are not huge luxury that you'd find in your normal chain, but everything is clean, neat and functional. Great for a budget. Neighborhood is not "bad" but not also the "best" either.

review.title: Good, simple, inexpensive stay
review.reviewText: Not so centrally located, but a decent, cheap stay that was clean and simple.

review.title: Decent Digs
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying here. Although its not in the best area (there's a huge porn store right across the street and there are plenty of homeless around) it is centrally located. It was quite easy using public transport and walking to the hotel from the BART station. The front desk people were friendly and quiet but definetely didn't go out of their way to help, but what can you expect, you get whay you pay for. The room was clean and comfortable just bring a hair dryer. I acutally really enjoyed the Monarch because in staying here you can really see the real SF and not just the touristy areas and isn't that what travelling is all about?

review.title: Not an ideal vacation spot
review.reviewText: Located in a more beat up part of the city, the Monarch, while attractive looking inside the front entrance, is in need of some upgrades. The bed was adequately comfortable, but the walls seemed paper thin as to hear the activities taking place in any adjacent room. The bathroom was extremely cramped for space, and could have used a better shower. The parking accomodations were abhorrent, with no direct connection to the hotel whatsoever. I had to park my car for $24.00 during my one night stay. Once the car was parked I then had to walk outside to the street, around the block, past a seedy looking alley, before being able to enter the hotel. Hotels should offer free vouchers for parking if they intend to make it such an ordeal for their patrons. Overall I gave my experience at the Monarch Hotel a 2 out of 5 rating.

review.title: Nice for the Price
review.reviewText: With a good deal on Expedia, this hotel located just several blocks from Union Square is a bargain. Park the car and walk or take public transit to just about anywhere you like. The traffic noise was a little loud at times, but that's to be expected in a highly populated area. The rooms aren't large but are very clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel lobby is handsome, and the service was excellent.

review.title: Comfortable and reasonable hotel to stay
review.reviewText: Overall the place is recommendable to families going on vacation.

review.title: Not in the best area -- this is why you save.
review.reviewText: If you don't like to see the harsh realities of the city, you won't want to stay in this area. If you're not scared and want a cheap, clean (looking) place to stay, I would recommend this place.

review.title: if i can i will b back
review.reviewText: Nice location, the only problem is that there is no parking space. You will have to pay 25 usd a day for parking (other hotels in the same area charges aroung 40 usd).

review.title: near Centre
review.reviewText: Parking is nog easy. But walking and public transport at hand

review.title: A Good Cheap Hotel
review.reviewText: This is definitely not a high end hotel but I found it perfectly adequate.Geary and Van Ness is very central although some folks may find the neighborhood a little rough.My experience is that you will find street people everywhere in the heart of the city.The room was basic but clean. The staff was helpful.A good choice if cost is a factor.I'd go back.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Everything was just perfect.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a good part of town for those who want to be close to the downtown area and somehow close to the piers. Union Square is seven blocks down the street and it is real easy to catch a bus at Ven Ness and get to Fisherman's Wharf and the piers for all those sightseen tours. It is a simple but nice hotel with good accomodations and high level guests.

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel is absolutely horrendous.  Two of the four clerks that I spoke to during my stay here were downright rude, and the other two were merely satisfactory.  Also, the rooms are drafty, and the furniture is extremely battered.

review.title: It's Okay
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for.  This hotel has great rates and a convenient location.  Many bus routes are in the area so it is extremely convenient if you plan to take alot of public transportation.  The flip side is that the street noise can keep you up at night if you're a light sleeper.  The rooms were clean but obviously old.  It's 2 star hotel rating is deserved.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: In fact, I am really impressed by the Monarch"s services as well as their room qualities, for it is not as good as I used to know. Excuse me, but the hotel sucks. I don't recommend anyone to stay at this hotel at all.

review.title: Comfortable stay for a great price
review.reviewText: Recommended for travelers who will be spending more time sightseeing San Francisco than in their hotel rooms. It's comfortable for sleeping and rest. Clean, quiet, quaint. Don;t judge the hotel by it's cover, or location, inside is quite classy with a victorian feel to it.

review.title: "Cozy, and Breakfast Too"
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel several times.  The first time was partly due to the price, but then we were hooked.  This place is so cozy and can be very romantic.  The rooms aren't large, but they're clean.  One of the best things about this hotel is the breakfast area found next to the front desk and lobby.  You can order a simple continental breakfast or traditional breakfast.  The atmosphere is very relaxing without the rush of a regular restaurant.  It's found in the general Union Square area, so walking becomes a good option for getting around.  We'll definetely stay here again and again.

review.title: Pros and Cons
review.reviewText: no hairdryer, poorer area of SF, but everything else is fine for that price!!!
